loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is a hardworking woman with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Noralyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evelyn has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a pharmacy in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fertilizers. Luz is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional medicine to sell for her pharmacy.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional medicine to sell for her business

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es:
Guillermo es un señor con 54 años de edad, casado y tiene cinco hijos, tres de ellos ya mayores de edad. Desde niño se dedica a realizar labores de campo, actividad que aprendió viendo a sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, hoy en día le pertenece un gran cultivo de café, el cual le genera muy buenos ingresos, con lo que logra cubrir todas las necesidades que su hogar amerita.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de la moto cultivador y abonos para su cultivo de café.
Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es formalizar su negocio y más adelante dejárselo a sus hijos.
Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 54-year-old man. He is married and has five children, three of whom are already adults. Since he was a child, he has been doing agricultural work, an occupation he learned by watching his parents who made their living in the same way. With this, he has made a lot of progress. Today, he has a large plot of coffee plants. This gives him very good income, which has allowed him to cover all of his household's needs.

He is requesting a loan to invest in buying a cultivator and fertilizer for his coffee crops. He has many dreams, but his primary dream is to formalize his business and leave it to his children in the future. He knows that, with the help of Interactuar and the Kiva lenders, his dreams will become reality.

loans.use: to buy a cultivator and fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is a 45-years old woman, living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw which was not belonging to him. With the help of savings he has purchased a used auto rickshaw, its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient amount to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving but looking for lump sum amount to buy rickshaw body.

Therefore she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC pakistan for her husband so that he can buy new rickshaw body and could drive rickshaw smoothly.
She hopes that now her husband would be able to buy more income because now he does not have any need to pay daily rent to anyone.
Sheis very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw body and seat covers etc for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 27-year-old married man who started working in the construction field nine years ago to cover his family's needs and expenses. He specializes in concrete painting. He is a young ambitious man who has a good reputation among his region for his professional skills.

Today, Hasan is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to develop his business by buying necessary tools which will facilitate his business and allow him to provide his customers with better and faster service.

Hasan hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools which will facilitate his construction business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is in her mid-30s, and she is married with four school-aged children. She has been running two businesses, selling clothes and running a beauty salon for ten years now. She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing the clothing sales and started a beauty salon which is doing great. She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, repay the loan and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the best selling clothes and to increase the salon products. She dreams of building her own house.

Mary will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling clothes and to increase her salon products.

loans.name: Ericka Arely

texts.es:
La joven Ericka de 23 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus 02 hijos tienen casa propia, vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo y se dedica desde hace 09 años a su negocio que es la venta de tortillas y leña, es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
Ericka está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de leña y maíz para su negocio, con esta inversión pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio y a su vez espera que le genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Uno de sus sueños es que en su próximo crédito  mejorar  su vivienda.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Septiembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Ericka is 23 years old and a single mother. She lives with her two children. The family owns its own house in a village in San Lorenzo. For nine years Ericka has made a living at her business selling tortillas and firewood. Ericka is a hard-working woman with a great desire to move forward.

Ericka is applying for this loan in order to buy firewood and corn for her business. With this investment, Ericka hopes to stock up and improve her business. At the same time, she hopes that it will provide her with the income she needs to move forward with her family.

One of Ericka's dreams is that her next loan will allow her to make improvements to her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; September 2015

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn for her business.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a 40-year-old businesswoman who knows how to cook almost any food. She has been in the food business for 5 years now and enjoys doing it. She makes and sells different types of kakanin, which is an export-quality Filipino product. It is a sweet delicacy made from rice flour and other flavorings. Some types of kakanin are Sinukmani, Bibingka, puto, kutsinta and suman. She also sell siomai and siopao. She sells the products in front of her house and uses one table to display all of the food items.

Jeanette needs to wake up early every day to make the food products that she’ll sell. She is persistent every day to make a living and earn profit. She needs added capital to buy ingredients and necessities for the business. With this, Jeanette applied a Php 20,000 loan. She works hard every day to have savings for their future and dreams of having her own cafeteria someday.

On a weekly basis, Jeanette regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy ingredients and necessities for her food business.

loans.name: Noneluna

texts.en:
Noneluna is married with seven children. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years now. She earns additional income through buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. She works hard to support her family.

Noneluna has requested a loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy assorted fish to sell. In the future, Noneluna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Edgita

texts.en:
Edgita, 49, is married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Edgita has requested a loan of 29,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

Edgita has previously borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF. She aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 24 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosalyn has a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines. Rosalyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of gasoline to resell.

Rosalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of gasoline to resell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She buys and sells banana in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of bananas to resell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Lydia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to resell.

loans.name: Greys Paola

texts.es: Greys reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hija en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, ella es una joven madre que se dedica a las labores del hogar y al cuidado que requiere su pequeña niña. Con muchos deseos de emprender una actividad que le permitiera mantener un equilibrio entre sus funciones como madre, ama de casa y empresaria, hace tres años su cónyuge le colaboró con el capital inicial para organizar su negocio de comercialización de joyería en acero, artículos de aseo personal y ropa para damas caballero y niños, cuya venta promociona con vecinos y conocidos a través de catálogos. Ella está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en joyería en acero, artículos de aseo personal ropa y calzado para atender la demanda de las festividades de fin de año. Su visión es organizar un almacén en su casa, incrementar sus ingresos y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Greys lives with her partner and daughter in the municipality of Soledad. Greys is a young mother who takes care of the household chores and of her young daughter.

With a great desire to do work that would allow her to maintain a good work-life balance, three years ago Greys' partner gave her the capital to start a business selling steel jewellery, personal hygiene products, and clothes for men, women and children. Greys sells these products to neighbours and acquantances through catalogues.

Greys is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use this loan to buy steel jewellery, personal hygiene products, clothes and footwear to meet demand for the end of year holidays.

Greys' envisions opening a big shop in her home, increasing her income, and giving her daughter a good up-bringing.

loans.use: to buy steel jewellery, personal hygiene products, clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 36 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school. Emelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care items.

Emelyn has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future Emelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care items.

loans.name: Nisbat

texts.en:
Nisbat is a 35-year-old, married woman. She is taking a loan for her husband as he has to buy a new body for an auto rickshaw. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years in Lahore, Pakistan. He drives the rickshaw by day and by night, trying to earn maximum profit.

A few weeks ago, her husband was driving his rickshaw on the road, as usual, and unintentionally collapsed a pole. Due to the collision, the rickshaw body got seriously damaged. This has caused the passengers to feel uncomfortable during traveling.

Nisbat has requested a loan so that her husband can repair the rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly again. Her husband is responsible for a sibling as well as his own children.

loans.use: to buy new a body for the auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation service.

loans.name: Khurshad

texts.en:
Khurshad is a 52-year-old married person and mother of seven children. She is living happily with her family in the area of Multan, Pakistan.

She is an expert at the art of embroidery, so she makes different patterns and sells them to the ladies in the surrounding areas. She has been selling embroidery material for many years. She sells differently designed shirts and embroidery wooden frames.

Therefore, she applied for the loan so as to increase her earnings through her business. Khurshad is much obliged to the Kiva team and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for herself.

loans.name: Antonio Alexander

texts.es:
Antonio, tiene un hogar que comparte con su esposa e hijos, tres personas dependen económicamente de él, no cuentan con ayuda del extranjero, tiene como negocio la compra y venta de ganado, oficio que aprendió de su familia y lo desarrolla con un horario de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, lo estableció hace 15 años y por el momento no representa dificultades.
Invertirá en la compra de ganado para aumentar su inventario, podrá atender a sus clientes y generar más ganancias, espera que su negocio sea más rentable y poder resarcir su deuda con puntualidad en sus pagos.
Sus sueños son tener una ganadería bien establecida para tener producción de leche y así tener ingresos extras para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio has a home that he shares with his wife and children. Three people are financially dependent on him and they do not have any outside help. He has a business buying and selling cattle, an occupation that he learned from his family, and he works on a schedule from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon. He established the business 15 years ago, and for now it does not pose any difficulties.

He will invest in the purchase of cattle in order to increase his inventory, and to be able to tend to his customers and generate more earnings. He hopes that his business can be more profitable and that he can repay his debt with on-time payments. His dreams are to have a well-established cattle farm to have milk production and thus have extra incomes in order to move his family forward.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase his inventory, and to be able to tend to his customers.

loans.name: Tunupa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TUNUPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollanataytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bethy ella es soltera y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers are members of the "Tunupa" communal bank, located in the Ollantaytambo district of the Urubamba province in Cusco department, Peru.

One member is 35-year-old Bethy. She is single and has two children. She works at her business, a grocery shop. She sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. Bethy wants to move forward with this business. She is enterprising and hard-working. Her dream is to expand the grocery store.

Bethy is applying for a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

Other members of this group sell animals, clothes, groceries, and meals.

Bethy is grateful to this who are part of this dream through this loan, and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a widowed woman, 59 years old with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Letecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, spices, cooking oil, additional utensils and other materials for her food production business.

Letecia has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, spices, cooking oil, additional utensils and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and married with six children. One of her children is still in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for her children.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods and personal care products.

Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 44 years old and married with three children. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, spices and other groceries.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dovie

texts.en:
Dovie, 30, is married with four children. Three of her children are currently in school. Dovie works very hard to provide for them.

Dovie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

In the future, Dovie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Didith

texts.en:
Didith is 46 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Didith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Didith has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Didith aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo Osmar

texts.es:
Guillermo, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado, tiene dos hijas y una de ellas estudia.

Guillermo, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y desde hace 4 años trabaja como corralero de una hacienda; su esposa tiene crianza de cerdos, ella consiguió trabajo por medio de un amigo quien le enseño acerca del mantenimiento y alimentación de los animales; fue así como después decidieron darle el trabajo, ella también destaza desde hace cinco años.

Él necesita el dinero para comprar abono y comprar cerdos para destazo. 

El sueño de Guillermo es trabajar en grande y destazar sin compromisos de deudas ya que por este medio cree poder tener ganancias para el futuro.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 28 years old. He went to school until the fourth grade. He is married and has two daughters, one of whom is in school. Guillermo has always worked in agriculture, and for 4 years has worked as a ranch hand on a farm. His wife has a pig farm. She got into this work through a friend who taught her about caring and feeding for the animals. Later they decided to give her work. She also has worked as a butcher for five years.

Guillermo needs money to buy fertilizer and pigs to butcher. His dream is to succeed in his work and in butchering, without being in debt. He believes that in this way he will be able to have earnings for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive únicamente con su esposo, ellos tienen las edad de 68 y 88 años respectivamente, su principal actividad económica es la crianza de ganado lechero, tiene una experiencia de 50 años en el negocio, cuenta con un empleado que se encarga a tiempo completo de ordeñar y pastar el ganado.
Con el financiamiento comprara tres vacas lecheras, con ello incrementará su inventario y la producción de leche, su objetivo es administrar muy bien el capital para generar más ganancias.
Sus sueños son tener una ganadería estable y mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares como alimentación, medicinas, etc.,
texts.en:
María is married and she lives alone with her husband. She is 68 and he is 88 years old. Her main economic activity is raising milk cows and she has 50 years experience in the business. She has a full-time employee who takes care of milking the cows and putting them out to pasture.

She will use the loan to buy three milk cows to increase her inventory and milk production. Her objective is to administer her capital well in order to generate more profits. Her dream is to have a stable herd and greater income to cover the family expenses like food, medicine, etc.

loans.use: to buy three milk cows to increase her inventory and production of milk.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is the age of 23; she is the mother of two children. She lives in Multan, Pakistan.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not worked properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new one as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Shakeela is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 68 years old and widowed. She has seven children.

Milagros is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Milagros has been in this business for 2 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Milrose

texts.en:
Milrose is 38 years old and has four children. Milrose is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Milrose is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Milrose requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Milrose has been in this business for 3 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Milrose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 56 years old and has three children. Mila is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Mila has been raising pigs for 4 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en:
Jade is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her frozen foods retailing.

Jade dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Relinda

texts.en:
Relinda is a married woman, 50 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Relinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Relinda requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Relinda has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is a widowed woman, 57 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Silvana has a buy and sell mineral water business in the Philippines. Silvana requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bottled of water to sell to her customers.

Silvana has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottled water to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her manicure and pedicure business.

Remedios earns more income from a beauty parlor. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Segundo Oswaldo

texts.es:
SEGUNDO TIENE 26 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO, VIVE EN LA PARROQUIA GUANUJO, CANTON GUARANDA. SEGUNDO SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE PAPAS, ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS, GANADOS, BORREGOS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDARA A INVERTIR  PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPAS YA QUE SERVIRA DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO DE SEGUNDO  ES MEJORAR LOS CULTIVOS PARA TENER MAS PRODUCION Y TENER UN MEJOR TRABAJO.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA JUGAR PARTIDOS DE BOLLEBAY CON SUS AMIGOS DE SU COMUNIDAD.
texts.en:
Segundo is 26 years old, is single, and lives in the Guanujo parish, in the Guaranda canton. He works in agriculture, growing potatoes. He also breeds chickens, cattle, sheep and pigs. The loan will help him to plant potatoes since it will be a great help in increasing the yield.

His dream is to increase his crops to have a greater harvest and have a better job. In his free time he likes to play games of volleyball with his friends in town.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia es una mujer de 56 años que vive en la localidad rural de Puquina, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella se dedica a trabajos múltiples como peonaje agrícola y cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que ella cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a 56 year old woman, who lives in the rural town of Puquina, located in Moquegua. She works multiple jobs, such as a farm laborer, and raiser of organic cattle. She pays great attention to the care and feeding she provides the cattle. Their food consists of organic alfalfa that she grows.

She seeks a micro loan to be able to buy two organic cows. She hopes that their milk will sell at a better price because it's organic. In the future she hopes to improve her living conditions and to stay in good health, which is why she is betting on organic.

loans.use: to buy two organic cows.

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre trabajador de 24 años de edad que se dedica a la elaboración de pan francés y pan dulce, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder llevar el sustento a su hogar gracias a este negocio. Carlos habita en casa de su propiedad desde hace 4 años y en ella vive junto a su esposa y sus suegros, a los que apoyan. La panadería de Carlos cuenta con mucha clientela en su comunidad, por lo que él no logra cubrir la demanda de productos con la que cuenta, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: batidora industrial, harina, levadura y mesas para aumentar su producción y de esta manera cumplir con los productos solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hard-working 24 year old. He works making french bread and pastries, a business he has been running for two years. He feels happy to be able to earn the sustenance for his home thanks to this business. Carlos has lived in a house that is his property for four years. He lives there with his wife and his in-laws who they support.

Carlo's bakery has lots of clients in his community, and he cannot cover the demand for products that he has. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in an industrial mixer, flour, yeast and tables to increase his production and in this way meet the demand for his products.

loans.use: to invest in an industrial mixer, flour, yeast and tables to increase his production and in this way cover the demand for his products.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, 47, is married and has seven children. Three of her children are still in school.

She works in the agricultural business in the Philippines, fattening pigs. She has been in this business for eight years now. She has borrowed three times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain her business.

For this loan, Merlita has requested 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is single with one child and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional woods, nails, varnish and other materials for her furniture-making business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional woods, nails, varnish and other materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Mirna Evelyn

texts.es:
Mirna, estudio hasta noveno grado, no pudo continuar estudiando porque su familia era muy pobre y no alcanzaban para seguir dandole el estudio, ella tiene dos hijos, una en etapa escolar y el menor que aún no asiste a la escuela, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la ganadería, y son los únicos que dependen económicamente de ella. 

Mirna, se dedica a elaborar dulce típico artesanales, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual su familia mantiene como tradición, actualmente su esposo es quien le ayuda a preparar los dulces y se los transporta a los diferentes puntos de venta por todo el país, en las diferentes fiestas patronales; las labores las inician desde las 6:00 de la mañana cuando están preparando dulce y terminar a las 5:00 de la tarde.

Mirna, utilizará el crédito para comprar frutas, azúcar, dulce de panela, etc. ella espera mejorar su negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia.

Mirna, sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y con un buen empleo.
texts.en:
Mirna went to school until the ninth grade. She couldn't continue studying because her family was very poor and couldn't afford to continue her education. She has two children. One is school age, and the other doesn't attend school yet. She is married, and her husband works with livestock. They are the only ones who depend on her economically.

Mirna works making typical, artisanal candies. She has 6 years in this business, which her family has carried on as a tradition. Currently her husband helps her make the candies and transports them to different points of sale throughout the country, to the different patron saint festivals. They begin work at 6:00 in the morning when they start making candy, and end at 5:00 in the afternoon.

Mirna will use the loan to buy fruits, sugar, unrefined whole cane sugar, etc. She hopes to improve her business in order to obtain greater income to better the living conditions of her and her family. Mirna dreams of seeing her children become professionals, with good jobs.

loans.use: to buy various fruits, sugar, unrefined whole cane sugar, etc.

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es:
Laura, es soltera, tiene una venta de lácteos para tener ingresos con los cumple con sus compromisos, el negocio nace por la necesidad de subsistir, trabaja de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Comprará quesillo, queso, crema y cuajada, tendrá un inventario con productos frescos y de calidad, espera ofrecer mayor variedad de mercadería para tener más clientes satisfechos, así como también generar más ingresos.
Su objetivo es saber administrar el crédito para que su negocio sea más competente.
texts.en:
Laura is single. She sells milk products to make income and meet her obligations. The business arose from her need to survive. She works from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon.

She will buy fresh cheese, cheese, cream and curd, to have an inventory with fresh, quality products. She hopes to offer a greater variety of merchandise in order to have more satisfied customers, and generate more income. Her objective is to know how to administer the loan so that her business will be more competent.

loans.use: to buy fresh cheese, cheese, cream and curd, to have an inventory of fresh, quality products.

loans.name: Joseph Kokou

texts.fr: Joseph est un veuf homme de 50 ans qui vit à Tonkoin. Sans en enfant  à charge, Joseph est un photographe qui parcours les quartiers pour gagner son revenu. Pour s’approvisionner de son matériel, Joseph se rend une fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des rouleaux de pellicules en vue de bien satisfaire ses clients puis de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Joseph is a widower, a man of 50 who lives in Tonkoin. Joseph, who is not raising any children, is a photographer who walks through the neighborhoods to earn a living. So as to stock up on his materials, Joseph goes to the market once a month. He is asking for this loan to order some rolls of film so that he can satisfy the demand of his clients and make enough income to cover his daily needs.

loans.use: to buy nine rolls of film.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
MARIA TIENE 54 AÑOS DE EDAD ES VIUDA Y TIENE 1 HIJITO HABITA EN LA COMUNIDAD DE TINGOPANDA, PARROQUIA GUANUJO, CANTON GUARANDA.

MARIA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE PAPAS, MAIZ Y  ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS, GANADO Y CERDOS, CON EL CREDITO PRETENDE COMPRAR UNA VACA MALTONA PARA AUMENTAR LA REPRODUCCION DE LOS MISMOS. 
EL SUEÑO ES MEJORAR LOS CULTIVOS PARA TENER MAS PRODUCION PARA TENER UN MEJOR NIVEL DE VIDA Y QUE EL HIJITO TENGA UNA BUENA EDUCACION.

DURANTE SU TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA RALIZAR MINGAS DE LIMPIEZA EN SU COMUNIDAD PARA QUE SE VEA MAS BONITA.
texts.en:
Maria is a 54 year old widow and has one son. She lives in the community of Tingopanda, in the parish of Guanujo, in the canton of Guaranda. Maria works in agriculture, growing potatoes and corn. She also raises chickens, cattle and pigs.

With the loan she plans to buy a young cow to increase reproduction of her cattle. Her dreams are to improve her crops in order to increase production, to have a better quality of live, and that her son get a good education. In her free time she likes to do community work such as cleaning up her community so that it looks prettier.

loans.use: to buy a young cow to increase reproduction.

loans.name: Olga Beatriz

texts.es:
FANNY TIENE 19AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN LA CUIDAD DE GUARANDA PROVINCIA BOLIVAR.

FANNY SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y PAPAS ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS, GANADO Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDARA A INVERTIR  EN LA COMPRA DE UNA VACA MALTONA PARA PODER INCREMENTAR LA ECONOMIA. E

EL SUEÑO DE FANNY ES  SALIR ADELANTE Y CON EL PASAR DEL TIEMPO COMPRAR UN TERRENO.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA SALIR DE PASEO CON LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Fanny is 19 years old and lives in the city of Guaranda in the Bolivar province. Fanny works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and potatoes. She also raises chickens, cattle and pigs.

The loan will help her invest in the purchase of a young cow in order to increase her earnings. Fanny's dream is to get ahead, and in the future to buy land. In her free time she likes to go out with her family.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans résidant à Tokoin. Avec deux enfants à charge, Amavi est une marchande de complets des habillements des enfants et des caleçons qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Amavi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités d'habits complets et des robes pour enfants. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Amavi pourra aider son mari à bien prendre soin et promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amavi is a married woman aged 30, living in Tokoin and raising two children. Amavi sells children's outfits and underclothes and buys her goods once a month at the market.

Amavi is requesting this loan to order some outfits and dresses for children. With the profit she will earn, Amavi will be able to help her husband to take good care of her children and advance their education.

loans.use: to buy 18 outfits and 12 dresses for children.

loans.name: Grupo La Asunción Group

texts.es:
Catarina, es madre de 10 hijos de las edades entre 5 y 30 años, es soltera de 51 años de edad, vive junto a su linda familia en una comunidad de la Aldea Xejuyup.
Catarina (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa rosado)  para salir adelante con su familia y darles lo necesario se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, pero con estos ingresos no es suficiente por esa razón también se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica y venta de maíz, con estas últimas sus ingresos mejora. Gracias a su calidad de servicio en su tienda, mucha gente la visita y sus productos ya no se dan abasto, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como; golosinas, gaseosas, azúcar, arroz entre otras.
Su gran esperanza de vida es que su negocio crezca y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Catherine is a 51 year old single mother of 10 children, aged between 5 and 30, who lives with her lovely family in the village community of Xejuyup.

Catarina (first on the right in the photograph wearing the pink blouse) in order to support her family, and provide them with the necessities, earns a living buying and selling groceries. However, this income is not sufficient and for that reason she also works buying and selling traditional clothing as well as selling corn, with the latter improving her income.

Thanks to the quality of service in her store, many people visit and she cannot keep up with demand for her products. For this reason she is applying for a loan to buy products such as; candy, soda, sugar, rice and others.

Her great hope in life is to grow her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy products such as; candy, soda, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 60 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods and other personal care products. Nida has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Anabilly

texts.en:
Anabilly is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Anabilly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care. Anabilly has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future Anabilly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and repaid 34 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from clothing retail.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 47 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future Annie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manjacaze Província de Gaza, tem 64 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 10 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 4 netos que vivem em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2012, este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku com qual pretende efectuar pagamentos de despesas do tribunal por ter tido acidente com sua viatura e causado prejuizo a terceiros.
Futuramente pretende reabilitar a sua casa e mobiliar novamente. O seu maior desafio é garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
He was born in Manjacaze, Gaza province. He is 64 years old, married, and the father of ten adult children. He takes care of four grandchildren who live in his house.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2012. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku, and he will use it to cover some legal fees, since he had a car accident and harmed someone.

In the future, he is planning to remodel and refurbish his house. His biggest challenge is to guarantee his childrens' higher education.

loans.use: to cover some legal fees; he had a car accident and harmed someone.

loans.name: Castigo

texts.pt:
O senhor Castigo de 35 anos de idade trabalha caminhos de ferro é   pai  separado de 02 filhos todos a frequentarem o ensino primário e a viverem com a mãe sustenta seu irmão que vive com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar vários tipos de bebidas, refrigerantes e diversos produtos de 1a necessidade para reforçar o seu negocio.
O seu sonho é crescer no negocio, ter um estabelecimento próprio e em condições na sua casa e ser um empresário bem sucedido.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e o financeiros, e que  pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Castigo is 35 years old and works in the railway sector. He is separated, and the father of two children who go to primary school and live with their mother. He maintains his brother, who lives with him in a house he owns.

He says that he will use the requested amount to buy different types of beverages, sodas, and essential products to strengthen his business.

His dream is to expand his business, have his own, well-stocked establishment at home, and become a successful businessman.

He says that his biggest challenge is financial in nature, and that he is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy different types of beverages, sodas, and essential products to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Nenafe

texts.en:
Nenafe works hard to support her family.

Nenafe is widowed and has a buy-and-sell curtains business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from buy and sell personal collection.

Nenafe requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of curtains to sell to her customers.

In the future, Nenafe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of curtains to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 37 years old and married with four children who are all in school. He is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marlon has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marlon requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for his food vending business.

Marlon has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Marlon would like to save enough money to expand his business and continue to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his food vending business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 35 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Lorna has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, bread, spices, school supplies and other groceries.

In the future Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Marivic is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell from her stall.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Manilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Manilyn is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Manilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Heazel

texts.en:
Heazel is 27 years old, single and has one child.

Heazel is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. Heazel has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Heazel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nellyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nellyn works hard to support her family.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Nellyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials and do maintenance for her business.

Nellyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and do maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Mariza works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and general store. Mariza is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy stocks of rice to sell.

Mariza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is 39-year-old married woman, living with her family in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children, some of whom are educated though high school.

Rubina's husband has owned a motorbike corporation for many years. He buys motorbikes and sells them from his shop. Now he has decided to increase his current inventory so that he can easily fulfill his family needs. Therefore, Gulshan, has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, Brac Pakistan, to support her husband’s business.

She is thankful to Kiva and their field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more motorbikes for her husband's retail business.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y calzado por catálogo, además presta sus servicios en una empresa cercana desde hace 5 años. Fátima habita desde hace varios años en casa de su propiedad en la que vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 2 años de edad. Fátima desea invertir zapatos y productos de belleza que normalmente vende por catálogo, ya que desea tener productos disponibles antes que sean solicitados, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: zapatos, lociones, desodorantes, entre otros productos para vender al contado.
texts.en: Fatima is a hardworking woman who sells catalog beauty products and shoes. She has also worked for 5 years at a nearby company. Fatima has lived for several years in her own home with her husband and 2-year-old daughter. Fatima wishes to buy shoes and beauty products to sell. She wants to have the products available before her customers request them. This is why she is applying for a loan through FUNAI to buy shoes, perfumes, deodorants and other products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumes, deodorants and other products to sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
O senhor Jorge de 29 anos de idade, é segurança e vive maritalmente a mais de 6 anos pai de 2 filhos ainda menores e além dos quais não sustenta mais ninguém e vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  cimento, varões, portas para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O seu sonho é crescer no negócio, ter um estabelecimento próprio e em condições pois atualmente faz negócio numa banca na sua casa.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e financeiro e conta com ajuda da sua esposa que e comerciante. Pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 29, works as a security guard. He has been married for more than six years, and is the father of two underage children. He is not responsible for anyone else and owns the house where he lives.

He says that he will use the requested amount to buy cement, beams, and doors to continue with the construction works.

His dream is to expand his business, and have his own, well-stocked establishment, since he works now on a table at home.

He says that his main challenge is financial in nature, and that his wife, who is a businesswoman, helps him. He is planning to apply for more loans to fulfill his needs and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, beams, and doors.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina hails from the town of Dumanjug, Cebu. She is married with three children and all of them attend school. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods ranging from coffee, salt, biscuits, powdered soap, matches, vinegar, cooking oil, sanitary napkins to canned goods.

Aside from running a store, she also sells purchase order cards that could be used as cash substitutes to purchase goods and are payable in a fix period.
For the last 5 years now, Carolina caters to customers who are mostly neighbors and local residents in her place.

She would like to improve and augment her income. She needs funds to maintain the inventory of merchandise and monitor the flow to earning as also.

Carolina has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase stocks for the store, additional p.o (purchase order) cards and pay for school fees.


In the future, Carolina is exerting her best to c0ntinue handle her livelihood by expanding it to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for the store, additional purchase order cards and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Mainique De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MAINIQUE DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda ella es soltera y tiene 39 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people belong to the “Mainique de Urubamba” communal bank.  This bank is located in the Urubamba district, which belongs to the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

One group member is Clorinda.  She is 39 years old and is single.  She works at her business selling grains.  She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa, working from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  She has been in this line of work for four years, and it is going well for her.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her grains.  She is asking for a loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

She is thankful to those who are part of her dream in this way, and she is committed to making her established payments according to schedule.

The member who is attached to the group photo took her photo after the meeting because she asked for permission due to her work.

The other group members work in a restaurant business, a grain sales business, a grocery store, and a vegetable sales business.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa

loans.name: Liezl Mae

texts.en:
Liezl Mae is 28 years old and married with one child who is in school. Liezl Mae works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

Liezl Mae has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, snack food, spices and other groceries.

In the future Liezl Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Glenda May

texts.en:
Glenda May is 36 years old and has six children. She is widowed and four of her children are presently in school.

Glenda May is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Glenda May has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Glenda May would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Majada

texts.en:
Majada is a 34 year old woman. She lives in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For the past few days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of so much use. He feels that most of its parts are worn out, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Therefore Majada has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Majada is so thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Lorta

texts.pt: A senhora Lorta é casada, vive com o esposo e quatro filhos, dos quais três meninas e um rapaz. O marido tem uma incapacidade fisica e dependa da esposa. É comerciante, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar mercadorias, tais como leite, sumos, oleo, farinha, yougurte, etc. Tem sonho de ter um estabelecimento comercial próprio e comprar uma viatura. Tem como maior desafio, o financiamento
texts.en:
Lorta is married and lives with her husband and four children: three girls and a boy.

Her husband is handicapped and depends on her. She is a businesswoman, and is planning to use the requested amount to buy supplies, such as milk, juices, vegetable oil, flour, and yogurt.

Her dream is to have her own commercial establishment and buy a vehicle. Her biggest challenge is to find funding.

loans.use: to buy milk, juices, vegetable oil, flour, and yogurt.

loans.name: Elisban

texts.es: Elisban es un hombre divorciado de 63 años que tiene dos hijos y vive en la localidad rural de Callapoca, que está ubicada en Puno. Él se dedica al cultivo de diversos productos orgánicos y a la cría de ganado vacuno, ovino y camélido orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que él mismo cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de habas y abonos orgánicos para preparar el terreno agrícola. En el futuro espera poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos y contar con buena salud para ver crecer a sus nietos, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Elisan is a 63-year-old divorced man who has two children, and lives in the rural community of Callapoca, Puno.

He works growing different organic produce, and raising cows, sheep, and camelids [e.g., llamas and vicuñas], organically. He takes good care of the feed they eat: he gives them organic alfalfa that he grows.

He is requesting this microloan to buy organic fava beans seeds and organic fertilizers to prepare the soil. In the future, he hopes to be able to continue helping his children, and keep his good health to see his grandchildren grow. This is why he puts his bets on organic products.

loans.use: to sow organic fava beans.

loans.name: Doris Noemy

texts.es:
La señora Doris de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en una  Aldea al sur de Honduras donde se dedica desde hace 01 a su negocio.
Doña Doris vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica y sus clientes son las personas vecinas y amigos de la aldea, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, café, pan, harina, refrescos, etc. y poder así surtir su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, también espera poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Uno de sus sueños que en un futuro su negocio sea más grande.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Septiembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Doris, 36, lives with her husband and children in a house located in a village in Southern Honduras. She has had her business for a year.

Doris sells all kinds of essential products. Her customers are neighbors and friends from her village.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, coffee, bread, flour, beverages, etc., to stock-up her business and fulfill her customers' demands. She also hopes to improve her income and continue supporting her family.

One of her dreams for the future is to see her business grow.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, beverages, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Durasnitos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DURASNITOS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Beatriz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de api, venta de pollo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Beatriz es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años, ya que antes de iniciar este negocio, la señora tenía una tienda de barrio, y a sugerencia de sus vecinas es que decidió cambiar y emprender este negocio de carnicería.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de carne de res por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es divorciada y tienen dos hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal group 'Durasnitos' started it's first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Panamericana (Panamerican Central Focus). The group is made up of eight members, and is run by a Board of Directors with Beatriz is the president. The group members run a variety of small businesses including: selling blankets, selling sports clothing and selling chicken.

The loan that the group takes out will benefit the small-businesswomen in the group. This is the first time Beatriz has been involved in Pro Mujer, she joined up on the invitation of a friend who is already part of the organization.

Beatriz has her own butcher shop. She learnt the trade using her own initiative a few years ago. Prior to running a butchers, Beatriz had a corner store, her neighbours then suggested she change businesses. Thus she took their advice and learnt butchering.

Beatriz will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale beef that she will purchase from wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto and then sell at retail prices in her store. This business allows Beatriz to make money to support her family economically. Beatriz is divorced with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Beatriz responded that she enjoys the trainings and the health service that the organisation offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale beef

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en: Hoda is a 33-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Her husband represents the main income sources in the family in order to enhance their way of living. Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner vitas s.a.l to pay the first installment of the study fees.  She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their master’s degree. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering their study fees.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of the study fees

loans.name: Blanca Haydee

texts.es: Blanca de 48 años de edad es made soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 48, is a single mother who lives in a house of her own with her two children. She has been selling personal products for ten years. She sells at home, but also as a street vendor visiting different neighborhoods.

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc., in bulk. In this way, she will be able to continue working in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Fidel Adriano

texts.es:
A diez minutos de San Miguel de los Bancos tenemos el Recinto la Florida un lugar con gente muy  humilde y  luchadora en este recinto vive y  el señor Fidel, el mismo es soltero pero tiene dos hijos que viven con la mamá, por ellos lucha cada día buscando superarse en todo lo que pueda para tratar de que no les falte nada, Don Fidel realiza labores de campo como es la Producción de pitajaya. 
En su vida ha tenido varios obstáculos uno de ellos fue no poder culminar sus estudios tiene únicamente educación primaria debido a que su Padre no le alcanzaba para poder mantener a su familia.
Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera concretarlos uno de ellos es que sus hijos tengan una profesión por ese motivo desea emprender este negocio que es la crianza de toretes lo aprendió por iniciativa propia le dedicará un promedio de dos horas diarias además cuenta con el apoyo de su jefe el cual decidió facilitarle un espacio de su finca para que emprenda el negocio, con esto logrará mejorar sus ingresos económicos podrá cumplir sus sueños y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
El señor Fidel agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pronto cumplir con sus sueños
texts.en:
Ten minutes away from San Miguel de los Bancos, one can find Recinto la Florida, a place where people are simple and hardworking. This is where Fidel lives. He is single, but has two children who live with their mother. They are the reason why he fights every day, trying to succeed in everything and trying to give them everything they need. Fidel performs different agricultural activities, like growing pitaya.

He has faced different obstacles in his life. One of them was not being able to finish his studies. He could only finish primary school because his father did not earn enough to provide for his family.

He has many dreams he would like to realize. One of them is to see his children become professionals. This is why he is starting this business of raising cattle. He learned on his own and will work two hours on average every day. Besides, his boss supports him, and decided to let him use some space in his farm to do this. This will result in a higher income, the realization of his dreams, and a better future for his children.

Fidel wants to thank Kiva for the support and the opportunity he is receiving to improve his living conditions and realize his dreams in a short period of time.

loans.use: to start raising meat cattle, and in that way realize his dreams and give his children a better future.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is able to earn an approximate amount of PHP 4,600 every month. She wants to thank all of the people who’ve been part of the previous loan approval. The amount was used to buy more supplies of corn for the business. This also would not be possible without the help of all the lenders. She wants to extend her sincerest appreciation.

There are times where there’s no delivery of the product, which she considers a challenge in the business. She thinks of ways to prevent this from affecting her business’ revenue. That’s why she takes advantage every time the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) conducts business seminars to broaden her knowledge of the business.

Fely decided to apply for a loan amount of PHP 30,000 that will be used daily for buying sacks of corn. She’s determined to succeed in the business and be able to support her children’s educational expenses.

On a weekly basis, Fely regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of corn to sell.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 58 years old and widowed with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, shampoo, soap, snack foods, etc.

Lucena has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Lucena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, shampoo, soap, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en:
Rocela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal selling business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rocela has been in this business for five years. Rocela earns more income from selling lumber.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rocela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

Leah has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Leah successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leah dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jeian

texts.en:
Jeian is 29 years old and single with one child.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jeian is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jeian has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is 53 years old and married with three children; one child is still in school. Armida works very hard to provide for them.

Armida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Armida has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Armida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 35 years old. She is living with her five children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years; he sells seasonal and fresh fruits from his shop in his hometown. The people like to buy fruits from him because his rates are very reasonable.

Due to the fruits' low prices, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased and by noon his stock has finished.

Amina feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is taking a loan for her husband, so that he can buy more fruit more often.

Amina wants to save the excess profit amount so she could utilize these saving for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal stocks of fruits for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 39 años de edad que desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su compañera de vida, además de lunes a viernes el presta sus servicios como maestro. Luis vive junto a compañera de vida y su hijo de 18 años de edad al que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Luis desea construir la cocina de su vivienda, que como se observa en la fotografía está deteriorada, además desea comprar materiales para la elaboración de tamales, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en materiales para tamales y materiales para construir su cocina y tener un lugar adecuado para su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is a thirty-nine year old man who for the past four years has worked making and selling tamales. It’s a job he does with the support of his partner. In addition, from Monday to Friday he works as a teacher. Luis lives with his partner and their eighteen-year-old son. He has managed to get ahead with a lot of effort.

Luis wants to re-build the kitchen in his home since, as you can see in the photo, it’s deteriorated. He also wants to buy equipment to prepare tamales. That’s why he’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in equipment for tamales and materials to re-build his kitchen to have a suitable place for his business.

loans.use: to invest in equipment for tamales and materials to re-build his kitchen to have a suitable place for his business.

loans.name: Raiida

texts.en:
