Raiida is a 38-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children. The children are still studying. Her husband is their main income provider; he works as a farmer. As for Raiida, she don’t work, and she cares only for home and family.

Currently, with the aim of paying her children's study fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a permanent customer, and she insists that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her children and this is their only goal.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees

loans.name: Baydaa

texts.en: Baydaa is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Her husband works as an employee and she owns a clothing shop in order to fulfill their family needs and improve their lifestyle. Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's school stationery fees, which will make her very happy that she will able to pursue their education suitably and secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her children's school stationery fees.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 41 years old, married and has one child still in school.

Amie is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Amie requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Amie has been in this business for four years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is 50 years old, married with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Anafe has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anafe requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Anafe has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Anafe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Binga

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Binga works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and buy-and-sell fruits. Binga is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Binga has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 33 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Jean works very hard to provide for them.

Jean has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jean has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

In the future, Jean would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 28 years old and married with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Cecile is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cecile has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 50 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Cecilia has a buy and sell furniture business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more different kinds of furniture to sell in her stall.

Cecilia has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more different kinds of furniture to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Jomrate

texts.en:
Jomrate is a hardworking female entrepreneur with seven children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her coconut farm.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Jomrate dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her coconut farm

loans.name: Clariza

texts.en:
Clariza is 46 years old, married and has three children who are currently in school.

Clariza is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Clariza requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Clariza has been in this business for five years now, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Clariza would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Anowara

texts.en:
34-year-old Anowara is an energetic lady who lives in the small village of Falakata, Alipurduar district. She is blessed with three children (one daughter and two sons). All of her children are students in different grades. Her husband is cycle rickshaw puller. His income is irregular and depends on the availability of customers.

Anowara has been helping her husband financially by running a dairy for last five years. She rears cows and sells the milk in their neighborhood and to the local milkman. Anowara also sells the cow dung (which is used as manure in rural areas) in her neighborhood for additional income. Nowadays, the demand for milk is very high, so she is thinking of expanding her business, but she does not have enough capital to invest in her business.

Thus, Anowara applied for a loan from Kiva via Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). With the help of this loan, she will purchase more cows and sell more milk and cow dung. Anowara is now confident of earning good profit from her business, which will enable her to ensure financial stability in her family and her children will acquire a good education to establish themselves.

Anowara is thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows to expand her business.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo wants to have an abundant farm for his family. He helps his wife, a teacher by profession, in supporting the needs of their children by sending them to school and providing for their daily needs.

With his farm income, he was able to repay his previous loan. He plans to utilize a new loan for this cropping season, which will be used to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of plowing the farm.

He will use this current loan to buy manure fertilizer to improve the soil's organic level.

He is determined to provide a better life for his family in the future..

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the cost of plowing the farm

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She is a housewife only taking care of her children and her husband is covering their needs. Due to the hard financial situation, and the fact that the new school year is near, she is in need of borrowing a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to buy the school stationery. She said that she is very happy and eager always to borrow additional loans to help her children continue their education suitably.

loans.use: to buy the school stationery.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 30-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and the mother of three children. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family. As for her, she is dedicated to her house and children. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to be able to pay her children's educational fees and to buy their books. She is very eager to make use of the loan for their professional careers. This is her first loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and is eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees and to buy their books.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has been a consistent member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for many years now, and she’s grateful that they’re able to quickly respond to her loan request. The amount that they approved enabled her to buy supplies of corn for her business. She wants to thank as well all of the lenders who provided financial support without asking for anything in return.

Lourdes wants to continuously support her family. That’s why she’s hardworking and determined to make the business grow. Her goal is to have her children finish college. Regular supplies of corn is what she wants to maintain, and an approximate amount of PHP 11,000 is what she needs. That’s why she applied for a loan of this amount once again.

Lourdes has been consistent in attending her CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This enabled her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of raw corn

loans.name: Jorginia

texts.en:
Jorginia is 30 years old and married and has five children. Three of her children are still in school.

Jorginia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jorginia has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Jorginia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hydee

texts.en:
Hydee is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her motorcycle transport business.

Hydee dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 54 years old, married and has four children.

Janet is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Janet has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jestine

texts.en:
Jestine is 23 years old and has one child. She is single and has one child still in school.

Jestine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jestine has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jestine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 25 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Grace has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from farming coconuts.

Mary Grace is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Noor Ul Aian

texts.en:
Noor Ul Ain is 27-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.

Her husband owns an unstitched clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that Noor Ul Ain is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to his customer's needs.

With the help of the profits, he will put aside some savings to pay several housing bills. Noor Ul Ain hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her husband's shop

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 27-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, who are attending school.

Her husband is the main income source in the family. He owns a clothing shop with the aim to fulfill the family's needs and lifestyle.

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s required school fees, which makes her very happy and optimistic and willing to utilize Kiva loans to continue paying the fees.

loans.use: to pay her children’s required school fees.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a hardworking female entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Consolacion dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 41 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Gema has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Junnifer

texts.en:
Junnifer is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Junnifer has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy any kind of fruits like bananas, papayas, mangos, etc.

Junnifer has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy any kind of fruits like bananas, papayas, mangos, etc.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Novelyn works hard to support her family.

Novelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming coconuts and vegetables. Novelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as a fishing net for her fishing business.

Novelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as a fishing net.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 57-year-old widow, living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband has died, and now she is living in her own house with her eight children.

After the death of her husband, she began running an embroidery and cloth selling business. She is experienced and professional in her work. She is a very famous for her work in the nearby area.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy stocks of clothes for her business.

Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Murama Tukore Group

texts.en:
Didas is the man on the left with a yellow shirt in the group photo, and this is his first loan in this organization. He is also a member of Murama Tukore group located in Nyakishenyi Rukungiri.

He is married with 4 children. He comes from Nyakishenyi Sub County, Rukungiri District. He is hardworking and is a professional teacher as his main source of income. He also relies on agriculture, most especially in coffee growing for his financial needs over a period of 8 years, but later he found out that he needs to grow more coffee. Therefore, he applied for a loan to cultivate land and buy coffee seeds. This was driven by the desire to increase his income sources so that he can be able to fulfill his financial obligations.

He and the group members joined Ugafode for financial assistance. He is hopeful that his dream of agriculture improvement and expansion is going to be achieved. The group praises Ugafode for the financial assistance of 3,800,000 UGX, which will enable them to educate their children and maintain their businesses and agriculture.

loans.use: to hire labor and also to buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 20-year-old single lady. Almost a year ago, she left her job to take care of her unwell mother and started managing her mother's grocery shop. She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business and cover her family's needs and expenses.

Today, Marwa is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of products and items to satisfy her customer's special needs.

Marwa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of products and items.

loans.name: Dolor

texts.en:
Dolor can’t thank you enough dear lenders and the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the financial assistance they’ve provided. The previous loan of PHP 15,000 allowed her to buy necessities for her food business. She was able to supply processed foods to her consumers which also helped increase her daily business sales.

There are times that Dolor can’t avoid using the funds from her business to pay their household bills. That’s why a supplementary fund is what she needs to continuously operate the business. She decided to apply to CCT for another loan amounting to PHP 15,000. The said amount will be used to buy kilos of meat products and other ingredients to increase her sales. She is hoping that you’ll once again consider her story because she is determined to succeed to give her children a better future.

Dolor believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group meetings for CCT partners consisting of 15 to 30 members. Here she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of meat products and other supplies that she usually trades.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 42 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

Annabelle has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Betty runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

Betty has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 38 years old and married with two children, both of whom are presently in school. Shee works very hard to provide for them.

Josie runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Josie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Esther tiene 59 años de edad, tiene tres hijos ya adultos quienes la apoyan en los proyectos que desea emprender. Ella forma parte del grupo "Mujeres Emprendedoras" nombre que describe perfectamente a cada una de las integrantes por su espíritu emprendedor.
Desde aproximadamente cinco años inició un pequeño negocio, inició su bodega con un poco cada producto, poco a poco ha ido aumentando su stock y ampliando su bodeguita.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas, productos de abarrotes y limpieza para poder surtir un poco mas su bodega.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is 59 years old and has 3 children who are already grown and who support her in her business enterprises.  She is part of the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women) communal bank; the name of the group perfectly describes each of the members, as these women have an enterprising spirit.

Five years ago, Maria Esther started up a small business.  She started her store with very few products, but gradually she increased her stock and expanded her little store.

With this loan, Maria Esther will invest in sweets, grocery products, and cleaning products to stock up her store.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

The PHP 30,000 loan requested through NWTF will help buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Conchita has been in this business for 12 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish and crabs. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 51 years old and single.

Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

Luisa has been in this business for five years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 43 years old and married with six children, three of whom are presently in school. Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

Maribel has been in this business for six years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans et mère de trois enfants, Elise est une femme mariée vivant à Tokoin. Elise est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner, Elise demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien vendre puis d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants en payant les frais scolaire dès cette rentrée.
texts.en:
Elise is a thirty-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She lives in Tokoin.

Elise retails charcoal that she procures three times a month at the market. She resells it from the front of her house.

Elise is requesting this loan to restock by ordering bags of charcoal. Her goal is to sell them for a good price, and then to save money and support her children's education by paying for school expenses as early as this back-to-school season.

loans.use: buy six bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Semewo

texts.fr: Semewo est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses cinq enfants à charge. Agée de 59 ans, Semewo est une femme dynamique qui travaille pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour ce fait, Semewo est une restauratrice de divers aliments sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile à ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans ce lieu. Semewo s’approvisionne du nécessaire pour la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des bols de farine de manioc, des unités de tubercules d’ignames et des kilo de viande en vue de mieux vendre puis d’atteindre son objectif et gagner son profit pour contribuer à l’avancement de son foyer.
texts.en:
Semewo is a married woman living in Tokoin with her five dependent children. Semewo is a dynamic fifty-nine year-old woman who works for her children's well-being.

To do so, Semewo offers various prepared foods under a shed in front of her house; her clients are happy with this location. Semewo procures the necessary foodstuffs twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to order bowls of cassava flour, units of yam tubers, and kilos of meat.

Her objective is to improve her sales, then to reach her goal and make a profit that will contribute to the improvement of her household.

loans.use: buy twenty-four yam tubers, thirty bowls of cassava flour, and ten kilos of meat.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Meriam works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Meriam is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 43 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Mary Ann has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Mama est une femme mariée vivant avec ses trois enfants à charge à Tokoin. Pour soutenir sa famille, Mama vend des cuire dent et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Mama réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, elle désire ce prêt pour commander des planches de cuire dent afin de bien vendre et favoriser l’émergence de son commerce puis aider son mari à couvrir les charges de son foyer.
texts.en:
Mama is a thirty-three year-old married woman living with her three dependent children in Tokoin.

To support her family, Mama sells toothpicks. She procures them twice a month at the market. Mama makes a profit in this business.

To really meet her clients' needs, she wants this loan to order boxes of toothpicks. This way, she will sell well and support the growth of her business, and then she will be able to help her husband pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to boxes of toothpicks.

loans.name: Al Zahraa

texts.en: Al Zahraa is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is the mother of three school-aged children. She doesn’t work;  she is only focusing on her family and her husband who represents the main source of income for the family. Due to her hard financial situation, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s study fees. Her purpose is to ensure her children achieve high educational levels to be competitive with others.

loans.use: to pay her children’s study fees

loans.name: Leonorica

texts.en:
Leonorica is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonorica dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Ponciana is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ponciana has been farming coconuts for 20 years and earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a peanut butter-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, sugar, and other materials for her food production business.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, sugar, and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Koshi

texts.fr: Koshi est une veuve femme résidant à Tonkoin et sans enfant. Koshi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Koshi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en de mieux vendre puis de réaliser plus de bénéfices et pouvoir subvenir à ses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Koshi is a widow residing in Tonkoin. She does not have children.

Koshi is a charcoal retailer who procures her merchandise four times a month at the market and resells from the front of her house.

Koshi is requesting this loan to finance her next purchase and order bags of charcoal. This will allow her to improve sales, make better profits, and pay for her daily expenses.

loans.use: buy five bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr: Ayawovi est femme âgée de 38 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Ayawovi est une marchande de l’eau glacée et des produits alimentaires  qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Ayawovi désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de pure water en vue bien vendre et de tirer profit puis de gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ayawovi is a thirty-eight year-old woman living in Tokoin. She is married and a mother of two.

Ayawovi retails ice-cold water and groceries. She procures her merchandise three times a month at the market, and resells from the front of her house.

Ayawovi wants this loan to finance her purchase of Pure Water. Her goal is to sell well and generate profits, then to earn more and better contribute to household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fifty pouches of Pure Water.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 63 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de dos hijos de las  cuales una es mujer y un hombre, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de san Antonio Samayac.
Manuela para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a rentar terrenos para ganados, pues a Dios gracias cuenta con suficiente terreno para lograr darlos en alquiler y de ellas obtener sus ingresos, con esta actividad lleva ella 10 años. Manuela por ser la renta de terreno su mayor fuente de ingresos ha considerado necesario comprar  media cuerda de terreno para tener donde construir y no utilizar las otras que se encuentran en renta, pero su gran dificultad es no contar con su efectivo necesario, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para efectuar la compra.
Su gran sueño es aprovechar la oportunidad del terreno y construir su casa en ella para brindarles a sus hijos mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 63-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family with two children; one is a woman and the other is a man. This lovely family lives in the community of San Antonio Samayac.

In order to obtain an income and get her family ahead, Manuela works leasing land for cattle. "Thanks be to God," she has sufficient land that she is able to lease out and thus obtain an income. She has been doing this for 10 years. Because leasing out land is her greatest source of income, Manuela has considered it necessary to buy half a plot of land to have a place to build a house and not have to use the other ones that are being leased out. Her great difficulty is not having the necessary cash, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to make the purchase.

Her big dream is to take advantage of the opportunity of the land and to build a house there to provide her children better stability in life.

loans.use: to buy half a plot of land to build a house.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 48 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Lourdes is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Lourdes requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Lourdes has been in this business for 18 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 52-year-old married mother of four children. Fifteen years ago, she started working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She has professional skills in this domain and is well-known among her region.
Ferial is trying desperately to satisfy all the additional needs of her family. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay the expenses of her dental treatments. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of her dental treatments

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 60-year-old, married Lebanese woman living with her husband and six children; one of them is still attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family to help them to live in good conditions.

Today, given that her child will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register him at school. The parents’ only target is to provide him with a good educational path until graduation and help him become able to get good jobs that will give him a good income.

loans.use: to register her child at school.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en: Elham is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one school-aged child. She works hard to show her determination of being able to improve her family’s way of living. In 2010, she started her own job by opening a chocolate shop in her town. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her chocolate shop inventory and to buy decorative items.  She states that the loan will certainly help her extend her job and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans for additional development of her work.

loans.use: to increase her chocolate shop inventory and to buy decorative items

loans.name: Nuredin

texts.en:
This is Nuredin, a 59-year-old widowed, vulnerable ethnic member of the Egyptian Albanian community. His living conditions are indeed very poor.

"My wife passed away about two years ago. Doctors claimed that her early death came as a result of the lack of adequate nutrients. Many members of our community don't reach even their forties due to the bad feeding. The majority of us have done odd jobs that nobody was doing during the communist era. Even now, it is sad, yet it is a reality. We suffer from so many diseases and illnesses, and we receive a disability income that is so little, that we barely buy the basic food. Lack of sanitation is another thing. We get infections very often, and we need medication. Since we've got no money, those infections go on until ...," said Nuredin to the loan officer.

Nuredin wants to improve the living conditions by doing some basic repairs to the little, so-called "house".

loans.use: to improve sanitation and living conditions by making some basic repairs to the little, so-called "house".

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, one of whom is still attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life, and until now he has earned a barely fair income.

For that reason, today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register him for the coming school year, which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 63 years old, widowed, and has one child.

Lilia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilia has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
In the past, Gelita couldn’t think of means for getting supplementary funds to run her food business. But when Center for Community Transformation (CCT) approved her previous loan application, it became a way to increase her daily sales since she was able to buy necessities for her food business and daily ingredients.

Most of the amount earned on the business was being used for their day-to-day expenses. Revolving funds are what she aspires to maintain so that on a daily basis she’ll have spare budget to buy ingredients needed for her food business. With this in mind, she applied for a loan amount of PHP 15,000.

As a mother, Gelita wants her children to finish college and find a better job someday. That’s why she’s striving her very best to succeed in the industry and continuously be able to support them.

Gelita is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional raw products like pork, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her food business.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 23-year-old, Lebanese, married woman who lives with her husband and her two children who are still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living.

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Jhonny Leodan

texts.es:
En el Noroccidente de Pichincha con un clima cálido húmedo se encuentra el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos un lugar tranquilo de clima cálido húmedo rodeado de gente amable y trabajadora, en este Cantón tradicionalmente se realizan festividades en honor a su cantonización, el mismo muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de su maravillosa cascadas, flora y fauna silvestre.
En el mismo vive y trabaja el señor Jhonny un hombre luchador, mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tiene 1 hijo de dos años, la esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, el señor Blacio trabaja como cobrador en un local de electrodomésticos el mismo desea emprender en una pequeña granja avícola para mejorar sus ingresos económicos tiene el conocimiento necesario y los posibles clientes, anteriormente trabajaba en un galpón de pollos, su esposa será quien le ayude en el cuidado de las aves.
El señor Jhonny agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando a él y su familia para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The town of San Miguel de los Bancos, has a warm, humid climate and lies in the northwest of Pinchincha. It is a tranquil place with a warm, humid climate, and is filled with friendly and hard-working people.  This town traditionally holds a festival in honor of its demarcation, which are visited by national and international tourists who enjoy the marvelous waterfalls, and native flora and fauna.  

Mr. Jhonny lives and works her in San Miguel.  He has a steady relationship in a domestic partnership, from which he has one two-year old son.  His wife is dedicated to the household tasks.  Mr. Blacio works as a cashier in a electrical appliances store.   He also wants to begin a small poultry farm to improve his earnings.  He has the necessary knowledge and potential clients, as he previously worked on a chicken ranch.  His wife will be the one to help him care for the birds.  

Johnny thanks Kiva for the support and the opportunity they are providing him and his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to start his poultry farm, which will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is an active member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) from Malibay, Philippines. She has a variety store, or “sari-sari” store in Tagalog, which means “variety of choices”. It is somehow similar to a supermarket, but in the Philippines, it has grills and is a smaller version. Many patronize the store to purchase products here, since compared to supermarkets, products here can be bought by the piece, volume, or by kilo.

On a daily basis, Nida buys grocery items to add to the business, but she’s just purchasing smaller quantities of products, which she displays at her store. She dreams to purchase a large quantity of grocery items each day so that she’ll have complete products to provide to her customers. With this, she applied for a loan of PHP 10,000.

Nida is working hard each day to provide for every need of her family. She also saves money for future purposes. She knows that with the help of the Lord, everything will fall into place. Trusting Him and perseverance should be the foundation to succeed in all endeavors, according to Nida.

She believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. This is where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans, and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Siempre Cullaquitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE CULLAQUITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos y perfumes, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de helados, venta de zapatos, venta de dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace más de doce años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de tunta, arroz y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Siempre Cullaquitas” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It consists of eight members and is headed by a board where Virginia is the Treasurer. The businesses that members of the community association engage in are varied. Among them are: selling cosmetics and perfumes, vegetables, food, blankets, ice cream, shoes and candies. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small business entrepreneurs where Virginia is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend who is a customer of the institution. Today, she has a business selling food. She shares that she learned to manage this business on her own initiative more than 12 years ago. 

The loan that she will take out now will bring an increase in capital (by buying potatoes, rice, noodles wholesale) which she will get from vendors in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she will market them in her own retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has six children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice and noodles wholesale

loans.name: Nibale

texts.en: Nibale is a 33 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and fur children who are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, as per her husband, he is the main income provider in the family and working so hard to help his beloved family to live in good conditions. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school

loans.name: Grupo Tzamjuyup Group

texts.es:
Reina es una joven muy trabajadora, con la visión de superación, ella tiene 21 años de edad es soltera, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad del caserío Tzamjuyup.
Reina es la representante del grupo denominado tzamjuyup.  Reina con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, con esta actividad lleva 2 años de realizarlo. Reina con el afán de mejorar sus servicios ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más mercadería, como güipiles de tela alemán, fajas y cortes, esto con el fin de ofrecerles a sus clientes más productos de buena calidad. Su gran esperanza de vida es ver crecer su negocio pero también construir su casa más amplia.
texts.en:
Reina is a hard-working young woman with a vision to improve. She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in a community in the Tzamjuyup village.

Reina is the representative of the so-called Tzamjuyup Group. With the eagerness to obtain her income and support her parents with the household expenses, Reina dedicates herself to buying and selling traditional clothing. She has done this work for two years.

Reina, with a desire to improve her services, has made the decision to apply for a loan in order to buy more merchandise like traditional blouses, belts, and skirts made from German fabric. Her goal is to offer better quality products to her customers. Her great hope in life is to see her business grow and to build a larger house.

loans.use: to buy products like traditional blouses, belts, and skirts made from German fabric.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 52 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marietta is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marietta has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Giant Ladies Group

texts.en:
When asked what her dream for the future is, Dhlamini answers with a smile, ‘I want to make sure all my children acquire a good education up to the level they desire and to be the leading lady in peanut butter making in Stoneridge Park.’ Considering how far she has come, she will probably get there. Dhlamini is running her peanut butter making business from home using two electric grinding machines. Her peanut butter is neatly packed into containers of different sizes and they are well labelled. She sells to local shops, pre-schools, and individuals.

Dhlamini is 41 years old, married and a mother of seven children. She lives in Stoneridge Park in Harare. She started her business in 2013 with the help of her husband who bought her the first peanut butter making machine. She is a member of the Giant Ladies Group, which includes three other colleagues running hardware businesses. Thrive Microfinance has managed to help them form a strong group and to use money well in their businesses. This has been attained through a four week training course, which they have completed.

With her loan amounting to $250, Dhlamini is planning to buy a sheller to shell groundnuts before they are ground in the machines that she already has. This will greatly reduce the processing time as she will no longer be shelling the groundnuts by hand. This will, in turn, enable her to handle bulk orders for peanut butter and to serve more clients and realize higher revenue.

loans.use: To buy a sheller for her peanut butter business.

loans.name: Esmeralda Nahuala Group

texts.en:
Nahualá is a growing town in the Department of Sololá in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is right off the Panamerican Highway in a mountainous area with lots of trees. Most of the population live in neighborhoods on the outskirts of the town and on market days, the town overflows with people conducting business.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esmeralda Nahuala” or “Nahuala Emerald” is located here. The hardworking women in the group range in age from 21 to 42. Almost all of these hardworking women have children who are enrolled in school. The Trust Bank is on their third loan with Kiva as they are most pleased with the positive results achieved with past loans. They have maintained and expanded their small businesses and been able to meet the monthly expenses of their households.

Manuela is the 28-year-old Secretary of the Trust Bank who studied until the sixth grade. Her husband works in agriculture and the couple has an eight-year-old daughter who is enrolled in elementary school. Besides working with her husband, Manuela buys and sells shoes in her very own shoe store right in town. In addition, she has a textile business and creates beautiful traditional blouses called “huipiles”. She is requesting a loan to purchase a large variety of shoes in various colors and sizes for men, women and children. She has had two loans with Kiva and has realized great strides and increased income in her businesses. Manuela is most excited about the possibility of an additional loan and she is hopeful that Kiva lenders will fund it.

Kiva lenders are much appreciated partners with Friendship Bridge in this effort. Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to purchase a large variety of shoes in various colors and sizes for men, women and children

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 35 years old and has four children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband works very hard to be capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life.

Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay fees for her children's books. One of her greatest dreams is to see her children achieving higher positions. Fatmeh’s husband wants to develop his work in the near future so he can better support his family.

loans.use: to pay fees for her children's books

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mailyn is 25 years old and one of her children is in school.

Mailyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell to her local market.

Mailyn has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 69 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lourdes has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 29-year-old married woman living with her two children, who are still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to satisfy the family's needs.

Today, in order to pay her children's education fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them for the coming school year and to buy their stationery.

Her only target is to see her children pursuing their education suitably.

loans.use: to register her children for the coming school year and to buy their stationery.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita was able to buy sacks of shells and other necessities to make artistic crafts. The previous loan amount of PHP 10,000 helped her produce a greater quantity of finished products to sell for her craft-making business. Deepest gratitude she wants to send to all of the lenders and the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for providing financial assistance.

It’s not easy to make different designs of crafts daily, but Zita has the talent and passion needed to make the business grow so that she’ll be able to sustain the needs of her family. She aims to have savings for them that can be used for future purposes.

There are times she lacks capital needed for making lanterns, candle holders and other products resulting in delay of delivery. To avoid this from happening again, Zita decided to apply for a loan of PHP 12,000 that will be used to buy stocks of raw materials and also for future purposes and emergencies.

Zita regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma, a 25-year-old mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for five years and also earns an income from direct selling of beauty products.

Delma has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a new one to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap, noodles, soft drinks, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 50 years old, married and has five children.

Manuela is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Manuela has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Manuela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is a hardworking entrepreneur with two children.

She has a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ludy dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Baobab Group

texts.en:
Age is but a number; it does not determine one's capabilities. Maria is a 62-year-old woman who has been an entrepreneur since 2004, the year her husband passed on, when she opened a preschool named after her.

Due to the economic meltdown of 2007 in Zimbabwe, her pre-school suffered a huge dropout of students as parents failed to pay fees for their children. During this period many people had to make huge compromises; for example, her teacher had to be paid in groceries, as cash was no good anymore. Since then, she has had to cope with ongoing problems affecting the economy as a whole.

Even though times were this difficult, Maria soldiered on and did not close down her school. She now has two pre-school teachers in her employ, and her enrollment is growing continuously. Maria needs a $500 loan in order to refurbish the classrooms for the benefit of the pupils.

Maria is in a group called the ‘Baobab’ group and together, they have requested $1450 from Kiva to boost their various enterprises.

loans.use: to refurbish her classrooms.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is thankful that there are people willing to help entrepreneurs like her who are financially incapable. The previous loan of PHP 20,000 became a way to increase her daily sales. She used the loan to buy grocery items for her variety store. She wants to thank every lender supporting the Kiva program. Without their help, she wouldn't know how to get supporting funds for the business.

Gemma wants to make the business grow more because it really helps her sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She prays that God will touch the hearts of the people who will read her story and consider again her loan request, this time in the amount of PHP 20,000, which she will use to buy grocery items and stock of slippers for the business.

Gemma regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in the business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and to listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hadiya

texts.en:
Hadiya is a 49-year-old, Lebanese, married woman of three children. Two children are still in school.

Her husband is the main income provider in his family. He has worked as a farmer in his town for many years. His income is barely sufficient.

That’s why currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for her children's supplies for school with the aim of insuring them a good education.

loans.use: to pay for her children's supplies for school.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 23 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Margie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Margie has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 52 years old, married and has five children.

Nelia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nelia has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Ma. Renalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional canned goods and other household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Renalyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods and other household goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 36 years old, married and has three children. With all three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda has been operating a general store in the Philippines for two years, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food, spices and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
A 33-year-old married mother of two, Maricar works very hard to provide for her family. For three years she has been operating a general store in the Philippines.

Maricar has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care items.

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
Marjana wants to buy two dairy cows and prepare the soil for winter planting and this is where your loan will go.

Her activity has always been rural one, planting mainly wheat in land that she has rented from others and also has a sow and a cow that is growing older, thus, not producing any milk.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and prepare the soil for some winter planting.

loans.name: Beto

texts.pt: O Beto é casado, vive com a esposa e cinco filhos. Trabalha como supervisor, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar mercadorias tais como, acucar, arroz, refrescos, oleo de cozinha, omo, velas,etc. Tem sonho desenvolver mais o seu negocio, para alem da mercearia deseja abrir um armazem para vendas a grosso. Tem como maior desafio, adquirir um espaço para abrir o estabelecimento e publicitar mais os seus produtos.
texts.en:
Beto is married. He lives with his wife and five children. He works as a supervisor and is planning to use the loan to buy products such as sugar, rice, beverages, cooking oil, washing powder, and candles.

He dreams of expanding his business. Besides the grocery store, he would like to open a wholesale store. His main challenge is to buy an establishment to start his business and better advertise his products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beverages, cooking oil, washing powder, and candles.

loans.name: Jesica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Jessica  de 34  años de edad,  tiene tres  hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 04 y medio años al negocio de la venta de ropa nueva y usada.
Doña Jessica sus clientes son los amigos, conocidos y personas de las diferentes aldeas y caseríos que la visitan, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas, ropa interior, calzado, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y con su familia.
Doña Jessica su sueño es tener su propia casa algún día.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Jessica, 34 years old, has three children who depend on her. She lives with her husband in a community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has worked in the business selling new and used clothing for 4 and a half years.

Jessica’s customers are the friends, acquaintances and people from different villages and homesteads who visit her. She is requesting a loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, undergarments, shoes, etc. She hopes that this investment allows her to get ahead with her business and with her family.

Jessica’s dream is to one day have her own home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – September, 2015

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, undergarments, shoes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Grupo Sololá Group

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 54 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de dos hijos quienes estudian en la escuela de su comunidad, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad del caserío patzite. Manuel (el primero del lado derecho de la fotografía)  para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta  de pilones de café, con este negocio lleva el 5 años de realizarlo, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la venta de banano. Manuel  tiene la suerte de rescindir en una de las zonas más fértiles por lo tanto su negocio de pilones requiere de más inversión, por esa razón solicita un préstamo  para compra de pilones de café y banano para su respectiva venta.
Su gran sueño es incrementar sus clientes y con ello sus ingresos para mejor estabilidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is 54 years old, married, and has a beautiful family of two children who study in the community school. This beloved family lives in the Patzite neighborhood. Manuel (the first on the first side of the photograph) buys and sells coffee plants to generate income and support his family. He has had this business for 5 years, but to increase his income he is selling banana plants. Manuel has the luck of living in a very fertile area, and his business selling plants requires more investment. Therefore he seeks a loan to buy coffee and banana plants to sell.

His dream is to increase his number of customers in order to stabilize his business.

loans.use: to buy and sell coffee and banana plants.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz es una mujer trabajadora de 67 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace 51 años junto a su grupo familiar. Cruz se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo, además ella recibe apoyo de sus hijos que viajaron al extranjero para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de Cruz. Ella anteriormente adquirió un crédito con el cual construyo su lavadero y regadera, pero no le alcanzo para encementar el piso y colocar el techo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para mejorar el área del lavadero encementando el piso y colocando techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Cruz is a hard working 67-year-old woman who has lived in her own house for 51 years together with her family group. Cruz has earned a living for a long time providing domestic services. In addition, she receives support from her children who traveled abroad in order to improve their and Cruz's living conditions.

She previously gained a loan with which she built her washing area and shower, but it was not enough to cement the floor or put a ceiling in place. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in: cement, sand, galvanized metal sheets, beams, and fasteners in order to improve the washing area by cementing the floor and installing a ceiling as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, galvanized metal sheets, beams, and fasteners to improve the washing area by cementing the floor and installing a ceiling.

loans.name: Grupo Las Xejuyupenses Group

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 28 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Nahualá. Francisco (el primero del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace un año, este negocio se ubica en el centro de su comunidad. 
Gracias a su liderazgo que posee es ahora el representante del grupo las Xejuyupenses. Francisco gracias a su amabilidad y respeto con sus clientes, mucha gente lo busca  frecuentemente, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías  como: repollo, tomate, zanahoria. Con esta inversión Francisco espera satisfacer mejor a sus clientes.
Su gran sueño es construir una casa de block para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings in a community in Nahualá. Francisco (first on the left in the photo.) buys and sells vegetables for obtaining his income and supporting his family. This business, which he has had for a year, is located in the center of the community.

Thanks to his leadership, he is now chairperson of the Las Xejuyupenses group. Thanks to his friendliness and the respectful was he treats his customers, many people seek him out frequently. For that reason he is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise such as cabbage, tomatoes and carrots. With this investment, Francisco hopes to better satisfy his customers.

His great dream is to build a cement block house, for the greater comfort of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as cabbage, tomato and carrots.

loans.name: Armedis Rosa

texts.es: Armedis es una emprendedora habitante del municipio de Soledad que reside con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en una vivienda ubicada en un barrio de este municipio, ella inició sus negocios en la comodidad de su hogar puesto que su prioridad es la crianza y el bienestar de sus hijos.  Hace siete años se dedica a la confección de ropa, labor que aprendió cuando apenas era una niña y que es tradición en su familia y que perfecciono al haber laborado en empresas de confecciones en donde logró adquirir el capital para comprar sus propios elementos y herramientas de trabajo, así mismo también ofrece servicio de belleza en espacio que adecuo en la sala de su vivienda. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que requiere para adquirir una máquina plana que le permita un mejor acabado a su costura. Ella se visualiza en el futuro con una sala de belleza bien dotada y su negocio de confección con empleados con unos ingresos que le permitan brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Armedis is an entrepreneur that lives in the municipality of Soledad. She lives with her partner and her three children in a house located in a neighborhood of this municipality. She started her business at home, since her priorities are her children's education and well-being.

She has been making clothes for seven years. She learned this activity when she was a child. It is the family's tradition, and she became skilled while working for clothing companies. She could also save some money to buy her own machines and working tools. She also offers cosmetic treatments in some space she adapted in her living room.

She is now applying for her first credikiva from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She needs these resources to buy a sewing machine that will help her to improve the quality of her sewing work. In the future, she sees herself having a well-equiped beauty salon, and a sewing workshop with employees that give her an income that allow her to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and she applied for a PHP 10, 000 loan through NWTF to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. She industriously earns extra income through other business ventures, such as farming vegetables. Betty dreams that, one day, she will be able to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lisbeth

texts.es: Ana es una joven emprendedora de 26 años que  reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos niños en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y gracias a sus labor participa activamente  en la economía su hogar con su negocio de comercio y al mismo tiempo desempeña los papeles de ama de casa, madre y empresaria. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza y ropa los cuales promociona a través de catálogos  mediante visitas periódicas a familiares, vecinos y amigos, para propiciar las ventas;  actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual proyecta invertir en productos de belleza y un buen surtido de prendas de vestir para incrementar su oferta aprovechando la demanda que genera la temporada de fin de año. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio para generar ingresos suficientes que le permitan arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is a young, 26 year old entrepreneur who lives with her spouse and two children in a neighborhood in Barranquilla. Thanks to her labor she participates actively in supporting her home economically with her business and at the same time fulfills the roles of housewife, mother and businesswoman.

She sells beauty products and clothing which she promotes through catalog and sells to acquaintances, neighbors, and friends. Today she seeks a Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy beauty products and a good stock of clothing items in order to increase her sales taking advantage of the demand that is generated with the seasons at the end of the year. Her goal is to strengthen her business in order to generate sufficient income to be able to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and a good stock of clothing items.

loans.name: Grupo Sector La Alcaldia Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una gran mujer de 56  años de edad con una linda familia de los cuales todos sus hijos son ya mayores de edad, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Chuachinup.
