Francisca (la que se ubica en medio de la tres) para  obtener sus ingresos desde hace 6 años tomo la decisión de elegir una actividad que le permitiera mejorar sus ingresos y la actividad que ella eligió fue la compra y venta de frutas, su negocio se ubica desde la comodidad de su hogar  y esto le permite realizar otras actividades de su hogar.
Francisca ahora está solicitando un préstamo para la inversión en su negocio de frutas, con el préstamo comprara sandía, melón, fresas y entre otras. Con esta anagrama espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su gran sueño es contar con un local donde poder vender mejor sus frutas.
texts.en:
Francisca is a great woman of 56 years of age with a beautiful family in which all of the children are already adults. This beloved family lives in a community of the Chuachinup village.

In order to obtain income, 6 years ago Francisca (found in the middle of the three) made the decision to select a job that would allow her to improve her income. The job she chose was the buying and selling of fruit. Her business is located in the comfort of her home and this allows her to carry out other jobs in her home.

Francisca is now requesting a loan to invest in her fruit business. With the loan, she will buy watermelon, cantaloupe, strawberries, etc. With this loan she hopes to better satisfy her customers’ needs.

Her biggest dream is to have a shop where she can better sell her fruit.

loans.use: to buy and sell fruit like watermelon, cantaloupe and strawberries.

loans.name: Concepción Elena

texts.es: Concepción, es una emprendedora de 38 años, amante de los negocios, de la moda y sobre todo del cuidado personal. En el 2008 decidió ofrecer servicio de manicure y pedicure a sus conocidos en el municipio de Soledad, brindando estilos novedosos que cautivaron a sus clientas y que con frecuencia le solicitaban de sus servicios, de este modo con unos ahorros y mucha disciplina comenzó a ampliar su clientela a quienes atiende en sus domicilio cualquier día de la semana en un horario flexible. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo recursos que planea invertir en esmaltes y demás insumos con el fin de tener una buena dotación para ofrecer variedad en su servicio. Concepción se visualiza organizando su sala de belleza con empleados y con unos ingresos que a futuro le permitan comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Concepción is an enterprising 38 year old woman who lives business, fashion, and above all personal style. In 2008 she decided to offer manicure and pedicure services to her friends in the Soledad municipality, providing new styles that garnered her customers and with time they sought her services. With her savings and discipline she began to expand her clientele, who she serves from her home, every day of the week on a flexible schedule.

Today she seeks her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy nail polish and other supplies with the goal of having a good supply in order to offer variety in her service. Concepción sees a future for her beauty salon of having employees and with her income in the future be able to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy nail polish and other supplies with the goal of having a good supply in order to offer variety in her service.

loans.name: Xenia Antonia

texts.es:
Xenia, estudio hasta cuarto grado, ella decidió no seguir estudiando para ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar, hoy en día está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 7 hijos de los cuales 2 están acompañados, 2 trabajan y los demás estudian, en su casa vive su esposo, su abuelo y sus 5 hijos.

Xenia, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeña, sus padres siempre se dedicaron a esta actividad, es por eso que a ella siempre le gusto trabajar en la agricultura, porque todas los días que le quedaban libres se iba con sus padres a trabajar.- Hoy en día ella realiza esta actividad junto con su esposo y tienen que caminar aproximadamente 20 minutos para llegar hasta la parcela donde están cultivando maíz y frijol.

Xenia, utilizara el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como (abono, foliares y herbicidas), que le servirán de mucha ayuda a su plantación, porque con estos insumos ella espera obtener una excelente cosecha que asegure la alimentación de su familia y a la vez una mejor calidad de vida.

Xenia, sueña con tener una casa más segura de la que ahora tienen y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Xenia completed 4th grade. She decided not to continue studying in school in order to hep her parents work. Today she is married, her husband is a farmer, and they have 7 children: 2 are married, 2 work, and the rest are in school. She lives in her home with her husband, grandmother, and 5 of their children.

Xenia has been farming since she was a little girl. Her parents have always worked in agriculture, which is why she enjoys farming because every day she is able to go with her parents to work. Today she works along side her husband and they have to walk about 20 minutes to arrive to their land where they grown corn and beans. Xenia will use the loan to buy farming supplies (manure, herbicides) which will help their farm a lot, because with these supplies she hopes for an excellent harvest to ensure feeding her family and thus having a better quality of life.

Xenia dreams of having a safer house than the one she has now, and providing a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, herbicides)

loans.name: Grupo Las Marias Group

texts.es:
Maria (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa color café) es una mujer casada con una linda familia de cinco  hijos de las edades entre 3 y 13 años de edad, ella vive en una comunidad  de santa Catarina. Maria es amable, generosa, con grandes ambiciones en la vida, ella tiene un año de elegir una actividad que le permitiera mejorar  sus ingresos, y se dedica a la compra y venta de banano. Maria  con el afán de prosperar con su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la inversión en su negocio de banano, pues la gente cada vez necesita más productos y ella necesita surtirlo más, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de bananos de seda, manzanita, chocolate.
Con esta inversión Maria espera satisfacer mejor a sus clientes, pero también anhela contar con una bodega de banano y darles a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Maria (the first woman on the left side of the photograph with a brown shirt) is a married woman with a lovely family of five children between the ages of three and thirteen. She lives in a community of Santa Catarina. Maria is friendly and generous, with big ambitions in life. A year ago she chose a business that has allowed her to improve her earnings; she makes a living by buying and selling bananas.

Eager to prosper in her business, Maria has decided to request a loan to invest in her banana business, since people increasingly need more products and she needs to stock her business more. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy bananas, apples, and chocolate. With this investment, Maria hopes to better satisfy her customers, but she also longs to have a store to sell bananas and to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy and sell bananas, apples and chocolate

loans.name: Marielos Isabel

texts.es: Marielos es una mujer de 23 años de edad que muestra su tenacidad cada día ya que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, además aprovechando su clientela vende productos de belleza por catálogo. Marielos habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre y su grupo familiar desde hace varios años. Marielos desea invertir en ropa y productos de belleza ha contado pero no cuenta con la suficiente liquidez económica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, vestidos, lociones, desodorantes y maquillaje para comprar por contado.
texts.en: Marielos is a 23-year-old woman who shows her tenacity each day; for the last five years she has been selling clothing in an itinerant fashion, also taking advantage of her customer base to sell beauty products from a catalog. Marielos has lived in a house she owns with her mother and her family for many years. Marielos wants to invest in clothing and beauty products in cash but she doesn't have enough financial liquidity, so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, dresses, lotions, deodorants and makeup to buy in cash.

loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, dresses, lotions, deodorants and makeup to buy in cash.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, no logro obtener ningún nivel de estudio porque su familia era de escasos recursos economicos, actualmente es madre de 4 hijos que aún viven con ella y se dedica a vender tortillas en su lugar de residencia, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de albañil y agricultor.

Maria, tiene 8 años de vender tortillas, se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana a preparar todo para hacer las tortillas y termina a las 6:00 de la tarde de vender, quien le enseño este oficio fue su madre; pero aparte de eso también cultiva granos básicos y sus hijos toman parte activa junto a su compañero de vida en esta labor, la distancia donde ellos cultivan es aproximadamente de 1 kilometro desde su vivienda. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y ampliar más su negocio, para obtener una mejor ganancia y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones económicamente y una vida más estable. 

Ella sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda y también sueña con poder ver a sus hijos como profesionales.
texts.en:
María, 48 years old, never went to school because her family had scarce economic resources. Currently, she is the mother of 4 children who still live with her, and works selling tortillas from her home. She is in a relationship, and her partner works as a bricklayer and farmer. María has been selling tortillas for eight years. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to prepare everything for making the tortillas, and finishes selling them at 6:00 in the evening. Her mother taught her this trade.

Apart from that, María also farms basic grains, and her children, together with her life partner, take an active part in this work. The location where they farm is approximately 1 kilometer from their home.

María needs the loan to purchase corn and firewood, and to grow her business in order to earn a higher profit and be able to give her family better economic conditions and a more stable life. Her dream is to finish construction on her home. She also dreams of being able to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood, and to grow her business.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino de 63 años de  edad, es casado y vive con su esposa en su casa propia, se dedica a su negocio de venta de abarrotería, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y demás personas que transitan por la zona, vive en una ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Don Faustino es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de Abarrotería como vende arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, churros, pan, frescos, jugos, papel, café, huevos, etc. para surtir su negocio sus clientes lo prefieren por su buena atención y simpatía.
Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del  2015.
texts.en:
Mr. Faustino, 63 years old, is married and lives with his wife in their own house. His business is his grocery store. His clients are all of his neighbors and friends, as well as other people who travel through the area. He lives in the city of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

Don Faustino is an enterprising man with the desire to improve his quality of life. He is requesting the loan to purchase grocery products, like rice, sugar, beans, butter, churros, bread, soft drinks, juices, paper, coffee, eggs, etc. to stock his business.

His clients prefer him because of his good service and his friendliness. His dream is to grow his business to improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras
August, 2015

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, butter, churros, bread, soft drinks, juices, paper, coffee, eggs, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Gabriela Guisela

texts.es:
El Recinto Mulaute está ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos un lugar hermoso y tranquilo de clima cálido húmedo al que muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros les gusta venir a pasar vacaciones o feriados disfrutando de sus maravillosas cascadas y hosterías. 
En este Recinto vive en casa de sus Padres la señorita Gabriela una mujer luchadora es soltera trabaja en Sto. Domingo en una consultoría contable, la misma desea emprender en una pequeña granja avícola tiene el espacio necesario para esta actividad y el conocimiento lo aprendió con su Padre, la entrega las realizará en tiendas del sector, le dedicará un promedio de cuatro horas diarias a esta actividad.
Desea con este negocio mejorar sus ingresos económicos para poder continuar sus estudios superiores y poder ayudar a sus Padres quienes son su razón de seguir adelante.
La señorita Gabriela agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando para salir adelante y poder tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en: The precinct Mulaute is located to the northwest of the province of Pichincha in the canton San Miguel de los Bancos, a beautiful and calm place with a warm, humid climate where many national and foreign tourists like to come to spend their vacations or holidays enjoying its marvelous waterfalls and inns. In this precinct, Gabriela lives in her parents' house. A hardworking young woman, she is single and works in Santo Domingo in an accounting office. She wants to open a small poultry farm; she has the space necessary for this business and learned the business from her father. She will deliver her poultry to stores in the area. She will dedicate an average of four hours a day to this business. With this business, she wants to improve her financial earnings to be able to continue with her higher studies and to help her parents, who are her reason for getting ahead. Gabriela thanks Kiva for the support and the opportunity it is giving her to get ahead and to be able to have a better future.

loans.use: to open her own poultry farm, thus improving her financial earnings to be able to continue with her higher studies and help her parents

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen, de 37 años de edad, es ama de casa, no tiene ningún grado académico debido a que sus padres eran de bajos recursos económicos y por esa razón no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos, todos menores de edad, 3 asisten a la escuela y su segunda hija de 14 años murió hace casi un mes, ella aún no se recupera de esa prueba por la que ha pasado, más sin embargo está tratando de salir adelante por sus tres hijos.

Carmen, conoce muy bien el trabajo agricultura, su pareja conoce muy bien este trabajo también y es él quien le apoya mucho para salir adelante, la distancia para llegar donde tiene el cultivo está a un kilómetro y por eso tiene que madrugar mucho.

Carmen, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, abono, pesticidas para plaga y también preparar la tierra y pagar mano de obra.

El sueño de Carmen, es preparar académicamente a sus hijos, para que tengan las oportunidades que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 37 years old, is a homemaker. She doesn’t have any academic degree due to the fact that her parents had few economic resources. Therefore, she did not have the opportunity to study. She is in a relationship and her partner is a farmer. She has four dependent children, three of whom attend school. Her second daughter, 14 years old, died about a month ago. She still has not recovered from this ordeal that she has been through, but regardless, she is trying to move ahead in life for her three children.

Carmen knows the agricultural sector very well. Her partner also knows it very well and he supports her so they can move ahead in life. The distance to arrive where the crops are is one kilometer, which is why she often has to wake up very early. Carmen needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for pests, to prepare the land and to pay for labor. Carmen’s dream is to prepare her children academically so that they have the opportunities that she never had.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for pests, to prepare the land and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband represents the main income source for the family in order to fulfill their family needs and is always ready to meet their demands.

Today, in order to pay her children's study fees, she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to help them and ensure them a suitable educational path.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees.

loans.name: Dalida

texts.en: Dalida is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman with only one child attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He works as an employee in a local company. Dalida at this period is in real need of a little help from Kiva. For that reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child's educational fees to register him for the coming school year. She said that she is happy that she will be able to pursue her child's education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees to register him for the coming school year.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Phoebe has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Phoebe requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Phoebe has been in this business for four years. In the future, Phoebe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Herminia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, su esposo es ingeniero industrial, tiene dos hijas que viven en casa con ella y están estudiando. 

María, trabaja con ganado repasto, solamente tiene un año de trabajar y lo aprendió de su tía y decidió hacerlo para buscar un ingreso extra; también tiene venta de ropa en su casa, el negocio de ganado lo tiene en la comunidad a 1 kilometro de su casa y viaja a pie, en este negocio le apoya una tía y un sobrino y su horario es variado. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto; este préstamo le ayudará mucho porque podrá tener un ingreso económico más para la familia y así mismo le permitirá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para tener un mejor futuro para su familia y así poder darles estudios superiores a sus hijas.
texts.en: Maria, 39 years old, studied until high school and is married.  Her husband is an industrial engineer, and she has two daughters that live at home with her and are studying.  Maria works with grazing cattle.  She has only done this work for one year.  She learned it from her aunt and decided to do it to make an extra income.  She also sells clothing from her house.  She runs the cattle business in her community one kilometer from her house, to which she walks.  Her aunt and nephew support her in this business, and her schedule is varied.  Maria needs the loan to buy grazing cattle.  This loan will help her a lot because she will be able to make additional income for her family, which will help her provide them with a better quality of life.  Her dreams are to continue working to have a better future for her family, and in doing so provide her daughters with the opportunity to pursue higher education.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Rosabelle

texts.en:
Rosabelle is 45 years old and married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosabelle has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of frozen food to offer for sale.

Rosabelle has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen food to offer for sale.

loans.name: Jennevie

texts.en:
Jennevie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines, and she supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Jennevie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food, and other groceries.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Johnny Cesar

texts.es: Johnny es habitante del municipio de Malambo y en esta misma localidad emprendió su negocio después de haber recibido una liquidación de su anterior empleo en una empresa de aluminios, en donde adquirió toda la experiencia para llevar a cabo su proyecto de negocio. En la actualidad fabrica puertas, ventanas, protectores, rejas y cerramientos, actividad que le ha permitido sostener su hogar y educar a sus 4 hijos.  Su clientela esta conformada por vecinos y ferreterías del municipio y actualmente requiere un capital adicional para atender los pedidos de sus clientes, por lo cual está solicitando su primer credikiva a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar aluminio y vidrios. Su meta es mejorar la imagen de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Johnny lives in the Malambo municipality.  Here, he started his business after having received severance pay from his previous employment at an aluminum business, where he acquired all of the experience necessary to carry out his business project.  Currently, he fabricates doors, windows, protectors, grates and fences, a profession that has helped him to support his home and to educate his four children.  His clientele consists of neighbors and hardware stores in the municipality.  He currently needs additional capital in order to fulfill the orders of his clients, which is why he is requesting his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to purchase aluminum and glass.  His goal is to improve his business image and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum and glass.

loans.name: Luis Pastor

texts.es:
Luis, de 38 años de edad, es comerciante y agricultor, estudio hasta primaria, es padre de 3 hijos que están estudiando octavo, noveno y bachillerato, su pareja se dedica al comercio informal.

Luis, se ha dedicado a trabajar desde que era muy pequeño, ya que su padre se dedicaban a la agricultura y él les ayudaba en esta actividad, actualmente cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.- Hace un par de años su pareja le ayudo a colocar una tienda en su casa, con una pequeña cantidad de productos y le era rentable y solicitaron crédito para aumentar los productos de primera necesidad y ha venido creciendo pero también dedicándose a la agricultura. 

Luis, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad para la tienda como maíz, frijol y otros.

Luis, sueña con seguir ampliando su tienda y darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis, 38 years old, is a storekeeper and farmer. He studied through primary school and is a father to three children who are in the eighth, ninth, and final years of school. His partner works in informal trade.

Luis has been dedicated to working since he was very young since his father worked in agriculture and he helped him in this job. Currently he cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn. A couple of years ago his partner helped him to put a store in their home, with a small quantity of products. It was profitable and they sought a loan to increase the amount of staple goods. The store has been growing but he is also dedicated to agriculture.

Luis needs the loan to buy staple goods for the store like corn, beans, and other things.

Luis dreams to continue expanding his store and give his children an education.

loans.use: to buy staple goods for the store like corn, beans, and other things.

loans.name: Kenia Lizzeth

texts.es:
La Joven Kenia  de 25  años de edad, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, no tiene esposo y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 02 años  al negocio de venta de tortillas sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que llegan a comprar este producto.
Kenia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal, para tener la materia prima necesaria para elaborar su producto y que sus ventas aumenten gracias a la inversión que realice, es su tercer préstamo que solicita.
Kenia uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Kenia is 25 years old. She has two children who depend on her. She doesn't have a husband and lives in a community in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. 

For the past two years she has dedicated herself to the business of selling tortillas. Her customers are neighbors and other people who come to buy her product.

Kenia is requesting this loan to buy corn, wood, and limes in order to have the necessary materials to develop her product and increase her sales. 

This is Kenia's third loan and one of her dreams is to have a house of her own. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Amador

texts.en:
Amador is a single man from the town of Carcar City, Cebu. He owns a house and has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for many years.

Amador sells commodities like coffee, biscuits, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, powdered soap, matches, soft drinks and condiments.

Amandor decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost his business. With the loan amount of 15,000 PHP he would like to purchase grocery items and a variety of fish.

In the future, Amandor is determined to improve his sari-sari (variety) store by maintaining the flow of merchandise inventory to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and a variety of fish.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David de 30 años, es un joven que la falta de oportunidades laborales no lo detiene, de tal manera que optó  por el emprendimiento como medio para generar ingresos y lograr su sostenimiento, el de su cónyuge y su bebé de 9 meses;  desde hace tres años se dedica a la comercialización de hortalizas  como lechuga, cebolla, repollo, tomate, zanahoria y  otras de las  mas usadas en la región, además de queso y cerdo, productos que adquiere en la central  de abastos y comercializa entre los residentes del barrio donde reside; actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en la compra de hortalizas, queso y cerdo en mayor volumen para ampliar la cobertura de su negocio. David considera que aunque este tipo de productos se comercializan principalmente en súper mercados aún existe mercado para su negocio, que visualiza con la apertura de varios puntos de ventas, generándole unos ingresos mayores que en el futuro le permitan adquirir una casa para su familia.
texts.en: David is 30 years old. He is a young man who is not held back by the lack of work opportunities. He opted for entrepreneurship as a way to generate income and support himself, his spouse and his 9 month old baby. For three years, he has worked selling produce such a lettuce, onions, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, and more of the most popular items in the region, as well as cheese and pork. He gets these products the market center and sells to the residents of the neighborhood where he lives. Now he is taking out his first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Doming. He will invest the resources in buying produce, cheese and pork in higher volumes to expand the coverage of his business. David considers that although this type of products are sold in supermarkets, there is still a market for his business. His vision is for it to open up various points of sale, generating more income that will allow him to acquire a house for his family in the future.

loans.use: to invest in buying produce, cheese and pork.

loans.name: Al Farah 4 Group

texts.en:
Iman is the featured borrower for Al Farah 4 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and lives at the same time.

Iman is a 45-year-old married Palestinian mother of three children. Two years ago, she started working as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She has sixteen years of experience in this field.

Although Iman works hard to cover her family's additional expenses, her family's income is still not enough. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's Field Partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her necessary medical expenses.

Iman is the lady sitting in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Samar is the lady on the left, and Farah is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her necessary medical expenses.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: Elena tiene 42 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas gaseosas agua frugos  galletas frutas comida y sándwich en su pequeño kiosco que tiene a las afueras de un centro educativo de su localidad hace varios años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas gaseosas golosinas galletas agua y frutas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elena viste polo de color blanco es la tercera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Elena is 42 years old. She is single and has two dependent children. For several years, she has sold candies, sodas, water, frugos drinks, cookies, fruit, and sandwiches from her small kiosk outside of an education center. She will invest the loan in buying more sodas, snacks, cookies, water and fruit. The group is thankful to the KIVA investors for the loan. Elena is wearing a white t-shirt. She is the third person from the left.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, candies, cookies, water and fruit.

loans.name: Cirilita

texts.en:
Cirilita is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cirilita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cirilita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Cirilita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Cirilita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Angie Paola

texts.es: Angie es una joven emprendedora de 19 años que para obtener recursos que le ayudaran a cubrir sus gastos de estudios se direccionó por la actividad de ventas por catálogos; ella comercializa entre sus compañeros de estudios, amigos y familiares productos cosméticos, ropa interior y productos de belleza. Ella reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y cuenta con todo su apoyo de su pareja, es por ello que actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual proyecta invertir en un mayor surtido de ropa interior, productos cosméticos y productos de belleza para incrementar su oferta y ampliar el número de clientes. Esta joven microempresaria tiene como meta consolidar su negocio, incrementar día a día sus ingresos y comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Angie is an enterprising 19-year-old woman. In order to obtain resources that would help her cover her school expenses, she operated sales activity through catalogs. She sells beauty products, undergarments and beauty products to classmates, friends, and family.

She lives with her husband in a neighborhood of the Barranquilla municipality and counts on all of his support. Because of this, she is currently applying for her first credikiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she plans to invest in a better selection of undergarments, cosmetic products and beauty products to increase her sale and expand her number of clients.

This microenterprising young woman's goal is to strengthen her business, increase her income day by day, and buy her own house.

loans.use: to invest in a better selection of undergarments, cosmetic products and beauty products.

loans.name: Manale

texts.en:
Manale is a 29-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has two children attending school.

Her husband represents them as the main income provider. He is a hard worker in order to collect enough money to be able to pay their heavy life expenses.

Today Manale is demanding a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s registration fees at school. She said that she is very happy and willing to always benefit from Kiva’s loan to suitably continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s registration fees at school.

loans.name: Yolanda Olga

texts.es:
YOLANDA TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE SOLO CON SUS 3 HIJOS ELLA SE DEDICA AL NEGOCIO DE POLLOS Y CERDOS ADEMAS A LA SIEMBRA DE TOMATE DE ARBOL,Y A LA CRIANZA DE CIERTOS ANIMALES TALES COMO POLLO, CON CREDITO OBTENIDO LE AYUDARA A LA COMPRA DE POLLOS Y CERDOS PARA INCREMENTAR SU ECONOMIA Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA. 

EL SUEÑO DE YOLANDA ES OBTENER UN VEHICULO, EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA RALIZAR DEPORTE Y LE GUSTA MUCHO DANZAR.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 24 yeasr old. She lives alone with her 3 children. She works in the chicken and pig business. She also grows tree tomatoes and raises other animals. The loan will help her to buy chickens and pigs to grow her finances and be able to improve her quality of life.

Yolanda's dream is to obtain a vehicle. In her free time, she likes to play sports and she really likes to dance.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Angilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Angilyn works hard to support her family. Angilyn has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and veterinary supplies.

Angilyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle in her motorcycle transport business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Angilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 30 years old and married with three children. All of her children are enrolled in school.

Cherry is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cherry has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Cherry would like to save money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Daria works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a furniture shop.

Daria is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline, and bamboo for her fishing business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Daria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline, and bamboo for her fishing business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, egg, flour, cooking oil, etc., for her food vending business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 1 year, and she earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Rebecca dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, egg, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit very quickly ended her first Kiva loan which was so profitable for her farming and this time again she hopes for one more deal again for her farm development. Margarit with her husband lives in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. She has a big farm with cows, calves, heifers, pigs and chickens. The assortment of her farm products for sale is the same- milk, macun (a national dairy product), meat and eggs. She is also good at land cultivation with which her husband also helps her. Margarit sells potatoes to re-sellers from her house. This time Kiva loan she asks as she wants to buy fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six kids, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamisi  operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 



With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Sky Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Hawa is a forty-eight years old business woman and a member of Sky solidarity group with four members of which are all women. Hawa sells soft drinks. She has been in this business for the past fifteen years. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.

Hawa established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business. See Hawa (left of the group picture).

Hawa and her group members needs a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which Hawa is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy more 10 crates of assorted soft drinks for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Hawa is married and has 2 children.
In the feature, Hawa plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.
Hawa will be very appreciative to anyone that can help.

loans.use: to buy more 10 crates of assorted soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance applying for a loan of 2400,000/=. She is a married woman with 2 children.

She is a business woman owning a beauty salon. In abid to increase on her working capital /expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 1400,000/=, however she is faced with a challange of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and kKva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to boost her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a maize mill, which will be used by 120 local families to produce flour for their families.

loans.name: Martha Piedad

texts.es:
MARTHA TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERA VIVE CON SUS PAPAS, EN LA COMUNIDAD DE BELLAVISTA, CANTON GUARANDA, PROVINCIA BOLIVAR.

ARTHA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE GANADO, ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GANADOS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE GANADO, QUE SERVIRA DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO ES  SEGUIR INCREMENTANDO EL CAPITAL DE NEGOCIO Y CONSTRUIR UNA PLANTA PROCESADORA DE CARNICOS

DURANTE SU TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA JUGAR INDOR FUTBOL Y CAMINAR CON SU BELLA MASCOTA.
texts.en:
Martha is 31 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the community of Bellavista in the Guaranda canton of the Bolivar province.

Martha makes a living selling cattle in addition to raising cattle and pigs. She is going to use the loan to invest in the buying and selling of cattle, which will serve as a big help to increase production.

Her dream is to continue increasing her working capital and to build a meat processing plant. During her free time she likes to play indoor soccer and walk with her beautiful pet.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Km-Garden Tazara Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her early 40's, is divorced and has six children, one of whom is grown up and others are still in school. She has been selling animals such as goats and cattle for twenty three years. She works from 5am to 8pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Christina's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy more goats and cattle to sell. She dreams of extending her business.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group, KM GARDEN, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy more goats and cattle to sell.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: Sandra  tiene  27 años de edad es conviviente con una hija dependiente. Hace 02 años que implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad abarrotes verduras frutas bebidas productos lácteos y útiles de limpieza. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Sandra es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Sandra is 27 years-old. She is in a relationship and has one dependent child. Two years ago she opened a small store in her home. She offers basic supplies such as grocery supplies, vegetables, fruit, drinks, and dairy and cleaning products. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Sandra is the first on the left.

loans.use: to buy more grocery supplies, vegetables, fruit and drinks.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Alicia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her new fishing boat like paint, bamboo, wood, etc.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her the new fishing boat like paint, bamboo, wood, etc

loans.name: Leny Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leny Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

Leny Joy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish for her business.

Leny Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Sobia's husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer for a very low price. He now wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but is still short of the full amount.

Sobia's husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw. Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan amount, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw.

Sobia and her husband thank Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services so can drive and generate money for his family.

loans.name: Yiv's Group

texts.en:
Yiv, 36, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

For the last 20 years, Yiv has been growing cassava and rice to make a living. Together, she and her husband can earn about 69,000KHR per day. Low crop yields due to insect pests has been the main challenge for her business.

Yiv has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five cycles already and she has completely repaid the loans. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to seek another loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sidwata 08 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr FRANCOIS représente le groupe SIDWATA 08 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 03 vont à l’école. Il a 08personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 25ans et aussi l'agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 06moutons.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il veut assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr Francois represents the Sidwata 08 Sapone group. He is married and father of 6 children. The oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Three of this children are in school. He has 8 dependents. Mr Francois has been raising livestock for 25 years as well as farming. He stocks up at nearby villages. He wants to buy 6 sheep. He wants to reinvest his revenue in his business. He wants to provide for his children's school education.

loans.use: to buy 6 sheep.

loans.name: Ragomzanga De Silmissin Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALIFOU  est le responsable du groupe RAGOMZANGA DE SILMISSIN. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 10 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis  07 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 02 moutons et 03 poules.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Mr. Salifou is the leader of the Ragomzanga de Silmissin group. He is married with five children. The oldest child is 14 and the youngest is three. Four of the children go to school and he has 10 people to support.
Mr. Salifou has been livestock farming for seven years. He buys his stock at local markets.
With the loan that he requests, he plans to buy two sheep and three hens. He would like to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to become an important livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy two sheep and three hens.

loans.name: Badia

texts.en:
Badia is a 25-year-old single woman who started working in an educational center four years ago to cover her needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a lot of dreams and plans for her future.

Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to make the first step forward and open her own educational center. She hopes to succeed in this new business and attract a large number of students.

loans.use: to open her own educational center

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 49 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsie has been farming coconuts for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending and farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jenny Rebeca

texts.es:
JENNY ES UNA CHICA DE 26 AÑOS, SOLTERA, VIVE CON SU MAMA Y CON SUS DOD HIJITOS, SE DEDICA NATURALMENTE A LA VENTA DE AGUA ARDIENTE, A LA SIEMBRA DE CAÑA DE AZUCAR Y FREJOL, A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y VACAS ,POR MEDIO DE EL CREDITO DESEA PODER INCREMENTAR EL NEGOCIO DE AGUA ARDIENTE, OBTIENDO MAYORES RECURSOS ECONOMICOS PARA EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA.

 EL SUEÑO DE ELLA ES DE COMPRAR UN VEHICULO PARA USO PROPIO DEL NEGOCIO.

MEDIANTE SU TIEMPO DE DESCANSO LE GUSTA VISITAR A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Jenny is 26 years-old. She is single and lives with her mother and her two small children. She happily devotes her time to selling aguardiente [a liquor made from distilled sugar cane juice], growing sugar cane and beans, and raising chickens and cattle. Through this loan she hopes to grow her aguardiente business and have better financial resources for her family's well-being.

Her dream is to buy a car for the business.

She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to grow her aguardiente business.

loans.name: Chanthoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province, Chanthoeurn is 31 years old and married. She is blessed with two daughters, one of whom is in school while the other is still too young to attend.

For many years Chanthoeurn has grown cassava and rice to help support her family. Cassava farming is a particular challenge due to the diseases to which cassava is susceptible. She earns about 11 USD and saves approximately 5 USD of it each day.

Chanthoeurn decided to form a VisionFund group of two members to apply for a loan of 3,600,000 KHR. Her past two loans were paid back completely and on time and helped her to meet her family’s needs and buy school supplies for her daughter. Chanthoeurn’s group loan will be divided between her and her group member, and she will use her share to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to improve her crop productivity.

Chanthoeurn hopes that she will earn enough income to upgrade the family’s standard of living, keep sending her child to school and buy some pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to improve her crop productivity.

loans.name: Kiswar

texts.en:
Kiswar is 48 years old, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns an electrician's shop. With the help of her son he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components -- such as ceiling fans and washing machines -- and troubleshoots the underground electric supply. He sells electrical components as well at his shop, such as copper cable, bulbs, switches, sockets, etc.

He wants to buy new inventory for his shop but does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, Kiswar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can be empowered to buy his desired inventory.

Kiswar thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for her husband's electrician's shop.

loans.name: Maria Dulia

texts.es: Dulía es una mujer trabajadora de 50 años de edad que cada día muestra sus deseos de salir adelante con su negocio de venta de frutas actividad que realiza todos los días, además elabora tamales de gallina, elote y frijol para vender y de esta manera obtener ingresos económicos extra. Dulía vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 15 años de edad al que han logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Dulía desea invertir en frutas y productos para elaborar sus tamales, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: fresas, melones, sandias, además de los ingredientes para preparar tamales, por lo que espera contar con este apoyo. Con el crédito anterior Dulía logro mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dulía is a hard-working 50 year old woman. Every day she shows her desire to get ahead with her business selling fruit, a business she does every day. She also makes chicken, corn and bean tamales to sell and in this way she obtains more economic income.

Dulía lives in a house that she owns together with her life companion and 15 year old son who she has managed to raise with great effort. Dulía wants to invest in fruits and products to make her tamales. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in strawberries, melon, watermelon and the ingredients to prepare tamales. She hopes to be able to count on this loan. With her previous loan Dulía managed to improve the roof of her house.

loans.use: to invest in strawberries, melons, watermelon and also ingredients to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Ana Delmis Yamileth

texts.es:
Ana, de 34 años de edad, estudio bachillerato opción salud, pero nunca ha laborado en esa área, actualmente tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos están estudiando y la menor que es una niña de cuatro meses de edad.

Ana, desde muy joven le gusto trabajar, cuando tenía 17 años de edad le ayudaba a su madre a vender carne de res en la comunidad, pues su madre destazaba, actualmente su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y ella trabaja vendiendo carne de res, siempre siguió con el mismo negocio de su mamá.

Ella, anteriormente solicito un crédito para reanudar sus labores porque uno de sus hijos se había enfermado y se había quedado sin capital de trabajo; pero ahora necesita este nuevo crédito para comprar reces para destazo.

El sueño de Ana, es que sus hijos se puedan preparar académicamente.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and has a degree in health, but she has never worked in that area. Currently she has three children, of whom two are studying and the youngest is a four-month-old girl.

Ana liked working from the time she was very young. When she was 17 years old she helped her mother sell beef in the community, since her mother was a butcher. Currently, her husband works in agriculture and she works selling beef; she always followed in her mother's business.

Previously she asked for a loan to restart her work because one of her children had gotten sick and she had ended up with no working capital, but now she needs this new loan to buy cattle for butchering.

Ana's dream is that her children will be able to prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy cattle for butchering

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
Sin is a single woman who resides in a rural village in Kampong, Cham province. She is 47 years old.

The main source of her income is growing rice. She gets supplemental income by working for others for a fee to support her living conditions. She has been involved in her job for 27 years. Recently, the crop has grown not well because of insect pests destroyed it.

Sin has never been with VisionFund before and this is the first loan for her. As a group leader of three, she plans to use her entire loan portion in order to buy fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crop yield. She hopes that her crop will grow healthily and return a greater yield. This will allow her to make additional income so that she can expand her current business and save for future needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield so to sell it in a better price.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 47-year-old married woman living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a butcher shop; his income is insufficient for his family. His daily practice is to buy mutton and lamb from the market and sell it from his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which diminished his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop.

So, Sajida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy billy goats and sheep for producing mutton and lamb.

Sajida wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams to provide all the benefits of life to her children.

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy billy goats and sheep for her husband's butchery shop so he can produce mutton and lamb.

loans.name: Savoen's Group

texts.en:
Savoen, aged 25, is a married woman blessed with two dependent children. One is in school and the other one is under school age.

She has been involved in her farming business for seven years and she earns about USD 14 per day. The drop of cassava’s price is the main challenge to earning a good income for her family.

This will be the first time for her with VisionFund; she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer for her rice and cassava field. She hopes she can increase her income to upgrade their standard of living and support her children’s studying.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for her rice and cassava field so that she can support her children's studying.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum District, Tbaung Khmum Province

loans.name: Jenniffer Carolina

texts.es: Jenniffer es una emprendedora mujer de 31 años de edad que se encontraba dedicada al comercio de mercancías varias y un día recibió una propuesta por parte de una amiga que le sugería aprender a elaborar decoraciones de temporada, al considerar que era una muy buena oportunidad de negocio se trasladó al municipio de Barranquilla y comenzó con esta actividad en la que lleva siete años con excelentes resultados.  Ella reside en un barrio del municipio en donde realiza toda su producción y se traslada hacia sus clientes empresariales, así mismo en las temporadas navideñas adecua un punto de venta en donde comercializa luces, figuras con luces, pesebres y otro tipo de decoraciones.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en luces de navidad, mangueras, y alambres, un material necesario para decoraciones de la temporada.  Jenniffer es soltera y su meta es tener su propia vivienda y en su negocio es continuar ampliando su base de clientes.
texts.en:
Jenniffer is 31-year-old female entrepreneur who made a living by selling a variety of merchandise. One day she received a proposal from a friend who suggested she learn to make seasonal decorations. Thinking that this was a very good opportunity, she moved to the city of Barranquilla and started with this business, where she has worked for seven years with excellent results.

She lives in a neighborhood of the city where she does all of her production and takes it to her business customers. During the Christmas season she also has a stall where she sells lights, figurines with lights, mangers, and other kinds of decorations.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in Christmas lights, hoses, and wires, the material needed for seasonal decorations.

Jenniffer is single and her goal is to have her own home -- and in her business it is to continue expanding her customer base.

loans.use: to invest in Christmas lights, hoses, and wires

loans.name: Djirigho Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le 18 février 2001. C'est un groupe de femmes qui pratiquent le commerce. Madame Maimouna qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 48 ans et mère de deux garçons. Elle s'active dans le maraîchage depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle n'est pas la seule à mener cette activité dans le secteur. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise de la famille et à épargner.
texts.en:
The village finance association to which this group belongs was inaugurated on February 18, 2001. It is a group of women whose business is trade.

Mrs. Maimouna, who is on the right in the picture with her hand raised, is the group's spokesperson. She is forty-eight years old, married, and a mother of two. She has been active in farming for over twenty years. She is not the only one from this group in business in this sector.

Profits will be used to help support the family and increase savings.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Rosiris Rocio

texts.es: Rosiris es una joven de 29 años certificada como vendedora por una institución del estado que reside en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Cartagena y encontró una alternativa para generar ingresos a través de la comercialización de productos para la nutrición y la salud; aprovechó sus conocimientos como vendedora para promover nuevos hábitos de alimentación complementaria; malteadas, multivitamínicos, té, proteínas vegetales, bebidas energizantes. Ella comercializa a sus esta amplia gama de productos a través de la oferta del catálogo a sus conocidos, sin embargo también vende puerta a puerta y en cuanto establece su pedido lo realiza a su empresa proveedora. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en productos para la nutrición y la belleza, con esta inversión sus ganancias se incrementaran y estará mucho más cerca de su meta de abrir un local al público.
texts.en:
Rosiris is a 29-year-old youth. She is certified as a vendor by a state intuition that resides in a local, Cartagena municipality neighborhood.

She found an income-generating alternative, through the commercialization of nutritional and health products. She took advantage of her knowledge as a salesperson to promote new complementary dietary habits: smoothies, multivitamins, tea, vegetable proteins, and energy drinks. She sells her broad range of products through catalog offerings to her acquaintances, yet also sells door to door and as soon as she establishes their order, she executes it with her supplier.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ['Mario Santo Domingo Foundation'], which she will invest in products for nutrition and beauty. With this investment her earnings will increase and she will be much closer to her goal of opening a location to the public.

loans.use: to invest in products for nutrition and beauty.

loans.name: Rubidia Lorenza

texts.es:
Rubidia, de 44 años de edad, tiene una tienda, se dedica al comercio desde muy pequeña, porque su madre le inculco a ganarse la vida trabajando, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, solo vive con su hijo menor que está estudiando noveno grado y los demás ya están acompañados.

Rubidia, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos que venderá, ella tiene un cafetín en la escuela de su cantón que está a una distancia de 400 metros, ella vente tostadas de plátano, sodas, jugos, golosinas, entre otras cosas más.- Este cafetín lo tiene desde hace 5 años atrás.

Rubidia, necesita el préstamo para comprar mesas y trastos para tener los alimentos que tiene a venta.

El sueño de Rubidia, es poder mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo, ya que si eso pasa tendrá mayores oportunidades de ganar un poco más y mejor su vivienda como siempre lo ha soñado.
texts.en:
Rubidia, 44, has a shop and has dedicated herself to commerce since she was very young because her mother instilled in her to earn a living by working. She is married and her husband makes a living by working in agriculture. They only live with their young son who is in the ninth grade; the others are already in relationships.

Rubidia gets up very early every day in order to prepare the food that she sells. She has a small cafe in her canton's school which is 400 meters away. She sells banana tostadas, sodas, juices, and candy among many other things. She has had this small cafe for five years.

Rubidia needs the loan in order to buy tables and dishes for the food that she sells.

Rubidia's dream is to be able to improve and expand her business because if this happens she will have more opportunities to earn a little more and to improve her house, as she has always dreamed.

loans.use: to buy tables and dishes for the food that she sells.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 32 years old, living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a small vegetable shop for many years in nearby town and earning a reasonable income. Over time inflation increases day by day, but the amount of income remains constant. To grow his income he wants to turn his enterprise towards progress. He wants to purchase more fruits, but he does not have sufficient resources. He tried to borrow some money from his friends and relatives but nobody helped him.

Therefore, Sobia has requested a loan for her husband so that he will be able to buy additional fruits to sell.

Sobia thanks to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's vegetable business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery work by machine at home to support her family. She has become expert in machine embroidery, but a few days ago her machine stopped working due to its continuous use. Now she wants to buy a new embroidery machine to continue her business.

Razia has requested a loan to buy a new embroidery machine so that she can stitch more embroidery dresses to sell and can grow their income.

She is a mother of five children; she is motivated to provide her family with good clothes and education. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to use a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children. Razia thanks to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new embroidery machine for her business.

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Lat is a divorced woman who is 55 years old and lives in a small house in Kampong Cham province; she has one child.

She has been growing rice and smoking tobacco to support her family’s living for 37 years. Moreover, she has been growing corn, sesame and soybean to earn more income as well. The sale price of crops is decreasing, so she now only earns an income of about 5 USD per day. After offsetting her business expenses, she can save around 3 USD each day.

She has been with VisionFund for two cycles and she repaid her previous loans successfully. The past loans helped her to have enough income to support her family’s living. She is now applying for a new loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to grow her crop fruitfully. She hopes to get good yields so that she can sell it for a good profit to upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to grow her crop fruitfully in order to increase her income to upgrade her living conditions.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES PROGRESANDO” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son varios, entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de mochilas, venta de salchipapa, venta de libros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hija que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio son sus hijos.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, aderezos y salchicha por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MUJERES PROGRESANDO” communal bank is starting their sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of nine members and is lead by a board of directors with Hilaria as President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Amongst them are: selling food, selling backpacks, selling salchipapa and selling books.

The loan will benefit all of these micro-entrepreneurs, Hilaria being one of them. She indicated that she has belonged to Pro Mujer for three years, joining on the invitation of her daughter who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling salchipapa (a street food with sausage and potatoes). She indicated that she started this business a number of years ago on her own initiative and her children currently help her with the business.

The loan that she is now taking out will be to augment her capital (buying potatoes, seasoning and sausages wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesalers of the city of El Alto and later after preparing them, she will sell them in her commercial space. This method of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, seasoning and sausage wholesale.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas De Che La Reina Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Mujeres Victoriosas de Che la Reina” está en su 1er. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una situación extrema de pobreza, pero ella a través del esfuerzo y por medio de las ventas ambulantes que hace tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos para la venta, como ser prendas, calzados y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Victoriosas de Che La Reina” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are committed to working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. They have taken the poverty elimination survey, which will help them to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Sra. Maria, whose survey results indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level. This means that she is in an extreme poverty situation. Through her efforts and her work as a traveling saleswoman, she will have the means to help her family.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of products to sell such as clothes, shoes, and other items. As a result, she will be able to continue her sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 48-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task. Now her son has just started to drive a moto-rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bear the jolts over the roads. Now, the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his moto-rickshaw.

Rehana has requested a loan so that her son can buy the moto-rickshaw body and drive it smoothly.

Rehana thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto-rickshaw body for her son's local transportation services.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama LAS EMPRENDEDORAS está en su ciclo 3º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una pone sus esfuerzos para poder crecer y mejorar. 
 La Sra. Edén es una  las integrantes quien en su más reciente encuesta mostró que ha ido mejorando y creciendo, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma prepara y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Tiene ya mucha clientela que siempre compra de ella y de esa forma tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, pollo, y otros insumos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir haciendo las comidas que vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group named “Las Emprendedoras” (The Entrepreneurs) is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are developing by working as a team and helping one another in a supportive manner. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program so that each woman can focus her efforts toward being able to grow and improve.

Sra. Edén is one of the members. Her most recent survey results indicated that she is growing and improving. Edén says that her business involves preparing food and then selling it as a street vendor. She has many customers who always buy from her, so this gives her the means by which she can help her family.

Edén is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken, and other ingredients so that she can continue preparing the food that she sells. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can improve each day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gabriel's Group

texts.en:
Gabriel is in his early 50s and is married with four children who are grown up. He has been having a welding business for one year now. He works from 8 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Gabriel's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy metal pipes and made more grills and more metal beds for his business and was able to pay back all his loans successfully.

He used the profit to repay the loan, take care of his family, reinvest in his business, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase the metal pipes to meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of expanding his business.

Gabriel will share this loan with his loan group Serengeti which has two members who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the metal pipes to meet his customers'  requirements.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 54 years old and married, and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

Cristina has been in this business for eight years.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine has been in this business for 15 years now.

Josephine requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth has been in this business for 11 years now.

Elizabeth requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional boxes of fruit to sell. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 25 years old and has two children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband works tirelessly to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life.

Today, because of the fact that the new school year is coming, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees.

The family's only target and dreams are to see the children achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Porvenir Ii De S.r. Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PORVENIR II DE S.R.” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mónica es la Secretaria.
