Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, costura y venta de fundas para sillones, venta de salteñas (empanadas tradicionales), venta de juguetes, venta de coca. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una tía que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de fundas para sillones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, trabajando en el taller de una vecina como costurera y después de contar con un pequeño capital, decidió emprender este negocio hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y  posteriormente, a la confección de fundas, lo comercializará en la feria 16 de julio . Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Porvenir Ii de S.R." began its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer, in one of its regional offices in Panamericana. The group is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, of which Señora Mónica is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them are: the sale of blankets, the sale of food, the knitting of blankets, the sale of vegetables, sewing and the sale of chair covers, the sale of "salteñas" (traditional empanadas), the sale of toys, and the sale of coca leaves.

The loan they are requesting will benefit a small group of micro-entrepreneurs where Señora Mónica is a member. She says that she has spent five years with Pro Mujer; she joined at the invitation of an aunt who is a client of the institution. Now she has a sewing business and sells chair covers. She unveiled that she learned this business many years ago while working in the workshop of a neighbor as a seamstress. After having some capital she decided to undertake this business several years ago.

The loan that she will now get will be for increasing her capital by purchasing wholesale fabric that she will acquire from the sellers in the city of El Alto and later use to make covers which she will sell in the 16 de Julio fair. This form of work allows her to generate resources so that she can support her family financially since she is married and has one son. When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Hem's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Hem is 43 years old and married. She has three dependent children. The primary sources of her family’s income are rice farming and raising pigs. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee.

Having been in this business for 25 years, she can earn about 80,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 40,000 KHR each day after expenses. The main challenge for her family’s business is the drop of cassava’s price and unhealthy rice crops.

Hem has never been a member of VisionFund before. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for supporting her farmland, and use some of it to spend on buying gasoline for operating the plowing machine. She hopes to make more healthy rice so as to increase her family’s income to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for supporting her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas is the age of 35, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns an electrical shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans and washing machines, and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components as well from his shop, such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc.

He wants to buy new inventory for his shop but does not have the amount to buy new inventory. Therefore, Muqadas requested from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband could be empowered to buy his desired inventory.

Muqadas thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc., for her husband's electrical business.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a 29-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who has lived and worked in a Palestinian refugee camp since he was born.

He has been working in preparing and selling coffee since 2014. He works on a small carriage in a selected corner and provides coffee to neighbors and villagers.

Taha is an ambitious man. He is trying to expand and develop his working sector so that in the future he can open a large cafe and expect customers all day.

His income is low, and it is hard for him to improve and develop his business. That's why he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop his business through buying a new coffee and hot drinks machine, in addition to buying a bedroom.

loans.use: to develop his business through buying a new coffee and hot drinks machine, in addition to buying a bedroom.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María, tiene 35 años de edad, una madre joven que tiene un niño pequeño de tres años. Ella es socia del grupo "Los Girasoles" formado por seis socios.
Hace cinco años trabajaba en la venta de comida que ella misma preparaba, actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, con motivo de tener un niño pequeño que requiere su total atención se vió en la obligación de cambiar su actividad económica, la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos le permiten organizarse mejor con el tiempo y a la vez puede visitar a sus clientes si es necesario llevando a su pequeño niño.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para poder tener un stock que ofrecerle a sus clientes que de vez en cuando le hace pedidos que requieren que los atiendan rápidamente.
texts.en:
María, 35, is a young mother with a small child, 3. She belongs to Los Girasoles Group, made up of six members.

Five years ago she was selling food that she herself made. Currently she sells beauty products. Having a small child requires her complete attention, so she saw the need to change jobs. Catalogue sales of beauty products allows her to better organize her time. She can also take her young child when she visits her customers if necessary.

She's going to invest the loan in buying beauty products so she has stock to offer her customers, who occasionally make requests she has to fill quickly.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to stock

loans.name: Djirigho Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le 18 février 2001. C'est un groupe de femmes qui pratiquent le commerce. Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 48 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de bois mort depuis plus de dix années. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité un camion de bois mort. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en: The Banc Villageois to whom this group belongs was inaugurated on February 18, 2001.  This group gathers women who are all involved in retail business.  Mariama (raising her hand and standing on the right hand side in the photo), is the group's representative.  She is married, 48 years old, and the mother of five children, three of whom are boys.  Mariama has been selling dead wood for more than ten years.  She will use her loan to buy a truckload of dead wood.  She will use her profits to help her husband to support the family.

loans.use: to buy dead wood.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 59 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Estrella has been in this business for four years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maria Teresa has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 31 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Anabel has been in this business for nine years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband remains sick most of the time and unable to work. To support her children and to meet household expenses, she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all the materials for her embroidery. She completes her tasks with her daughters using a wooden frame. She wants to sells embroidery directly on the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy raw material on her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Nazia has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell to generate maximum income.

Nazia is the mother of two daughters and two sons. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for embroidery and wooden frames for her embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Heap's Group

texts.en:
Heap, 41, is a widowed woman who has five dependent children to take care of. She lives with her family live in Tbaung Khmum province where she has been growing rice as the main source of income for years. Sometimes, she works as a paid worker to earn additional income. Both of her businesses earn her about USD 13 per day. The rice growing business’s challenge is the low selling price in the market.

This is the first time for Heap with VisionFund and as the leader of three-member group, she will use her loan portion to support rice farming through purchasing fertilizer, paying the plowing fee, and pumping water to the field. She hopes she can improve the living condition of her family and expand her business to a larger size.

loans.use: to support rice farming through purchasing fertilizer to boost the crop yields.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Djirigho Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le 18 février 2001. C'est un groupe de femmes qui pratiquent le commerce. Madame Mame qui est à la droite de la photo est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 36 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont trois filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de fruits et de balais depuis plus de dix années. Elle compte acheter des balais d'une valeur de 200 000FCFA et des fruits d'une valeur de 400 000FCFA. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en: The Banc Villageois to whom this group belongs was inaugurated on February 18, 2001. This group gathers women who are all involved in retail business. Mame (standing on the right hand side in the photo), is the group's representative. She is married, 36 years old, and the mother of five children, three of whom are girls. Mame has been selling fruits and brooms for more than ten years. She will use her loan to buy brooms (for a total value of 200,000 CFA) and fruits (for a total value of 400,000 CFA).  Thanks to her profits, she will be able to help her husband to support the family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and brooms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, cassava, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Khatoona

texts.en:
Khatoona is a 54-year-old married woman living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son drives a wagon in Lahore city. He provides transportation to passengers from one stop to another. Due to continuous work, most of the parts of the wagon have depreciated, and there is urgent need for replacement with new parts.

Therefore, Khatoona requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is a field partner of Kiva, so her son can repair his wagon and can drive smoothly. Khatoona hopes that through this loan her son will be able to buy spare parts so he can drive his wagon again.

Khatoona belongs to a poor family. Her son is the only earning person, and they do not have any other source of income. She seems very happy after receiving this loan, thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her son's wagon so he can drive it smoothly for his transportation business.

loans.name: Grupo La Familia Group

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer de 24 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 1 y 7 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea xejuyup.
Delia (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) su principal actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa típica, con esta actividad ella tiene 2 años de realizarlo, gracias a este negocio a su familia ha sacado adelante. Ella es representante del grupo denominada  la familia y con el afán de mejorar sus servicios con los clientes a decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tinte que son los que tienen mayor demanda, con esta inversión Delia espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes. Su esperanza de vida, es construir su casa  y comprar terrenos para un mejor futuro e sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delia, 24, is single and has a beautiful family with two children, ages 1 and 7. This humble family lives in a community in the town of Xejuyup.

Delia (the first one on the left in the photograph) primarily works buying and selling traditional clothing. She has two years of experience in this job. Thanks to this business she has gotten her family ahead.

She's the representative of La Familia Group. She wants to improve her customer service, so she decided to request a loan to buy
, which are most in demand. With this investment Delia hopes to better satisfy the needs of her customers. Her hope for her life is to build her house and to buy land so she and her children have a better future.

cortes de tinte

loans.use: to buy and sell dyed skirts

loans.name: Bagh

texts.en:
Bagh is a 40-year-old woman, living with her eight children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw.

With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw; its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient funds to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body.

Therefore, Bagh has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers and can drive the rickshaw smoothly.

Bagh hopes that her husband will now be able to generate more income. Bagh is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new seat covers and a new body for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is age 42. She is living with her six children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years; he uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling, and as a hawker he can easily reach the people. The people like to buy fruits at their doors instead of going to the market.

Due to his fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased, and around noon his stock runs out.

Shahnaz is proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is receiving this loan for her husband so that he can buy seasonal fruits in greater quantities and an equilibrium scale to weigh them. She wants to save the excess profits so that she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for her husband's business selling fruits from a cart

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, blouses, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 22-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband runs a small gas station where he sells LPG to the rickshaw drivers. In his area, a lot of people drive vehicles, and there is lot of demand for fuel as well, so he decided to open a gas station so that he can earn maximum profits.

Due to the rapid increase in the demand of LPG, he wants to buy more gas cylinders so that he can easily fulfill the demand.

This is reason that Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. It will allow her husband to easily cope with the demand and maximize his net income.

Rukhsana is very pleased with this collaboration and she is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy LPG cylinders for her husband's gas fuel station

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 42-year-old lady; she is a very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been in this business for many years and has been utilizing wooden planks and bamboo, which depreciates from time to time.

Presently, her husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new, smooth wooden boards and bamboo to continue his business again.

She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to her life and that her husband will earn maximum profits with the help of this loan.

Bushra is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy smooth wooden boards and bamboo for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is age 31, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for many years.

Her husband is an expert at his art: he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career.

He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, chisel and level, which have begun wearing out. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy these tools.

Therefore, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools for construction.

Asia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mason tools for her husband's construction services.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat is a 29-year-old married father of two children who has been working as a driver for an import and export services company for eight years, to support his beloved family members.

Izzat is well known in his region for the special care he reserves for his children, and for how hard he works to provide them with the best education to make sure they will benefit from a brighter future.

Since his income is limited, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees.

He hopes to make his children's dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos es dueño de un Tracto Camión, con semirremolque, en el que se dedica a realizar fletes por todo el país, ya que trabaja en asociación con una empresa transportadora.  
Se inició en el rubro hace más de 10  años, anteriormente trabajaba para otra persona, hasta que pudo comprar para su propio camión y actualmente ya trabaja por su cuenta.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cubiertas nuevas para su camión, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando con su camión.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcos is the owner of a tractor-trailer truck that he uses to haul cargo across the country. He works in partnership with a transportation company.

Marcos started in this trade more than 10 years ago. He previously worked for another person, but since then he purchased his own truck and currently works on his own.

Marcos is requesting this loan so that he can buy new tires for his truck. This will enable him to keep his truck in operation.

loans.use: to buy tires for his truck.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 49-year-old mother of five children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine with the help of her elder son and manufactures vehicle spare parts using cutting tools. He has been involved in this business for many years and, until now, his business has been very steady.

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of the parts, it will affect the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or to buy cutting tools.

Therefore, Nargis has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.

Nargis hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to fix the lathe machine and to buy cutting tools for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra, aged 50, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children. For this reason she works extremely hard - in order to keep her children smiling.

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her three children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. She subsequently decided to start tailoring work at home and, since then, she has been sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her craft so she would like to buy a Juki sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand.

Azra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a professional sewing machine (Juki) for her tailoring services

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa is a 34-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband and a child, is shown in the photo.

She is in the business of making artificial jewelry. The business has great potential for growth and Rafiqa is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them.

They have five children, none of whom are going to school. The couple wishes to send them to school by trying to increase their earnings to afford the educational expenses of their children.

In order to fill orders on time and boost their sales, Rafiqa requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Del Mañana Group

texts.es: Katty tiene 32 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de miel de abaje y frutas hace 03 años y a la vez elabora kekes y tortas. El crédito lo usara como capital de  inversión de dos colmenas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. katty es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste polera ploma.
texts.en:
Katty is 32 years old, is single, and has a dependent child. She makes a living in the sale of honeybee honey and fruits for 3 years, together with pancakes and cakes. The loan will be used as investment capital for two beehives.

The group is grateful to Kiva investors for the credit offered.

Katty is the first person seated on the left, seen in a lead-colored polo shirt.

loans.use: to purchase two beehives.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a wood sales business. She sells wood to the people of her community, as they use it in making the handles of knives and furniture, as well as for burning purposes.

Shabnam has become famous in her area for providing good quality wood of different types. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is a laborer whose income is insufficient to meet the needs of the family alone. Shabnam is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to purchase bundles of good quality wood with some cutters.

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of good quality wood with some cutters.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 57 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija y dos nietos a los que quiere mucho y siempre trata de proteger. Ana se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos en su vivienda, cuidando además de sus nietos, también gracias a años de arduo trabajo cuenta con una pensión que le permite obtener mejores ingresos. Ana desea reparar el techo del corredor y ampliarlo, ya que el agua se filtra deteriorando las pertenencias que tiene en el mismo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para reparar el techo de su corredor.
texts.en:
Ana is a 57 year-old woman who lives in her own home with her daughter and two grandchildren, whom she loves and always tries to protect. Ana helps with household chores, in addition to caring for her grandchildren. 

Thanks to years of hard work, she also has a pension that allows her to earn more income. Ana wants to repair the roof of her home's hallway and expand it, because water seeps in and has damaged her belongings. 

For this reason, she is applying for a loan with FUSAI to invest in galvanized steel, wood, nails and wire to repair the roof in her hallway.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel, wood, nails and wire to repair the roof in her hallway.

loans.name: Jedeon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JEDEON” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora  es Yara la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artesanías, venta de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de movilidades.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yara es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de unas tías que son clientas de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió  ayudando a su mamá en el tejido de mantas y hace más de diez años que la señora decidió emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Jedeon” communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the the Panamericana administrative office. It’s made up of eight members and is directed by a board, of which Yara is the president. The businesses owned by the group members are varied. Among them are: craft sales, shawl sales, food sales, neighborhood small grocery store, and furniture sales.

The loan they will take will benefit the small business owners, of whom Yara is a member. She explains that she got involved with Pro Mujer via the invitation of some aunts who are clients of the institution. She currently has a business that knits and sells shawls. She says she learned this business by helping her mother make shawls. It was more than ten years ago that she decided to start her own business.

The loan that she will now take is for increasing her capital for the purchase of wool at wholesale price, which she will obtain from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. She will then make and sell the shawls in the markets in the city of El Alto. This work allows her to generate income so she can help her family  economically, since she lives with her partner and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale price.

loans.name: Edgar Daniel

texts.es:
Edgar, de 30 años de edad, actualmente está acompañado y tiene un hijo que está estudiando tercer año de primaria y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Edgar, trabaja como agricultor, desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño lo básico de trabajar la agricultura, hace seis años viajo al extranjero pero tuvo muy mala suerte y no logro pasar, ahora se está esforzando mucho para trabajar la agricultura y cultivar dos hectáreas de jícama.
	
Edgar, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes y abono, para aplicarlos a su cultivo de jícama.

Edgar, sueña con tener un excelente cultivo de jícama y maíz y sabe que con la ayuda del préstamo lo podrá lograr.
texts.en:
Edgar, who is 30 years old, has one son who is in third grade, and his wife takes care of the household.

Edgar has worked in farming since he was a boy. His father taught him the basics of working in agriculture. Six years ago he traveled abroad, but had very bad luck and wasn't able to enter the country. Now he is putting a lot of effort into farming and growing two hectares [4.94 acres] of jícama [a root vegetable]. 
	
Edgar needs the loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and manure in order to use them on his jícama crops. His dream is to have excellent jícama and corn crops and he knows that with the help of the loan, he will be able to achieve it.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, de 70 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor, solo estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado, junto a su esposa procrearon tres hijos, de los cuales todos son profesionales y ninguno vive junto a él y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Luis, trabaja como agricultor desde muy pequeño, pero también ha trabajado como motorista de vehículo, actualmente trabaja como agricultor, cultivando dos hectáreas de maíz, a un kilómetro de distancia de su hogar.
	
Luis, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, porque se ha quedado sin fondos y sus cultivos necesitan la ayuda de fertilizantes.

Su objetivo principal es tener un buen cultivo de maíz y sabe que con la ayuda de su crédito lo podrá lograr.
texts.en:
Luis is 70 years old and works as a farmer. He only studied through fifth grade. He’s married and he and his wife had three children, all of whom are professionals and none of whom live with him. His wife takes care of the household.

Luis has worked as a farmer since he was very young, but he has also worked as a transportation driver. He now works as a farmer, cultivating two hectares of corn at a distance of about 1 kilometer from his house.

Luis needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs because he is without funds at the moment and his crops need fertilizer.

His main goal is to so have a good corn crop, and he knows that with the help of this loan, he will be able to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Aged 27 years, Thy is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She earns a living through growing cassava which she has been doing for 20 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 50,000 KHR per day from the current business and are able to save about 25,000 KHR each day for the future.

This is the fifth loan for Thy with VisionFund. She has used the loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Thy wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production, and better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her six children; one of them is still studying. She is a housewife and her husband represents the main income source that enables them to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help him continue his education.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from personal care products. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell to customers.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mercina

texts.en:
Mercina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mercina has been in this business for four years. She earns extra income from motorcycle transport.

Mercina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Arsenia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Arsenia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosmawati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Rosmawati, who is a 34-year-old married woman with one son and two daughters. Rosmawati is a housewife and her husband is a fisherman. She has a small shop which sells food and snacks. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Rosmawati will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sorn is aged 55 and married with three children, two of whom are in school. For more than 20 years, she and her husband have been growing cassava and rubber as the primary source of their family’s income. Low crop yield has been the main challenge for their business.

Sorn has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sorn is going to use her portion to buy cassava and seeds for her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her cassava as well as rubber production, to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cassava and seeds for her business

loans.name: Yolanda Mercedes

texts.es: Yolanda de 34 años es una emprendedora mujer que laboraba como servicio doméstico en una casa de familia y su patrona era dueña de una catálogo de distribución de productos, y le recomendó que vendiera productos para que generará ingresos adicionales a los de su empleo, ella siguió el consejo que le cambió la vida y les ofrece a los compañeros de trabajo de su cónyuge diferentes tipos de mercancías.  En la actualidad cuenta con un año de funcionamiento  y les ofrece comodidad de pago a su clientela, sin embargo su capital le es insuficiente para responder oportunamente con las solicitudes de pedidos, es por ello que Yolanda está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir artículos varios del catálogo y poder incrementar sus ventas.  Yolanda en compañía de su cónyuge ofrecen bienestar a sus dos hijos menores de edad, y su meta a largo plazo es lograr que ellos se gradúen como profesionales y tengan un excelente futuro.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 34, is an entrepreneur who works as a domestic employee for a family.  Her boss used to sell products by catalogue and she recommended the work to Yolanda for additional income.  Following her advice changed Yolanda's life and she now sells goods to the wives of her husband's work. colleagues.

So far she has been in business for a year, offering credit terms to her customers.  However she does not have enough capital to respond quickly to orders.  Therefore, Yolanda is applying for her first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  This is to buy a variety of goods by catalogue so she can increase sales.

Yolanda and her husband provide a good home for their two minor children.  Their long-term goal is to see them graduate and become professionals so they will have an excellent future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods by catalogue.

loans.name: Sougrenom Wend Group

texts.fr:
Madame JUSTINE KISWENSIDA est la représentante du groupe SOUGRENOM WEND. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 17 ans et le moins âgé à 14ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes en charge. 
Madame vend des fruits et des gâteaux depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de fruits.
 Elle veut s’acheter 05 cartons de bananes, 02 cartons de pommes.
 Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante (import-export)des fruits.
texts.en:
Justine Kiswensida is the representative of the Sougrenom Wend group. She is married and the mother of two children. The elder is 15 and the younger 14 years old. She is financially responsible for seven people in total. She has sold fruit and cakes for fifteen years, and buys her supplies in the fruit market.
She wants to buy five crates of bananas and two crates of apples. Her ambition is to become a large trader (import-export) of fruit.

loans.use: buy five crates of bananas and two crates of apples.

loans.name: Sidwata 06 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr KOUDOUGOU FRANCOIS devient le représentant du groupe SIDWATA 06 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 05 vont à l’école. Il a 10personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’agriculture et aussi l'élevage depuis 12ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant de son village.
Il veut acheter 02 moutons, 5 sacs d'engrais, 10m de tuyaux.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Koudougou Francois is the representative for the Sidwata 06 Sapone group. He is married and the father of six children. The eldest is 13 and the youngest 4 years old. Five of them attend school and in total he is financially responsible for ten people.
He has worked farmland and also reared livestock for twelve years. He buys his supplies in the local markets near his village.
He wants to buy two sheep, five sacks of fertiliser and ten metres of piping.
He wants to invest his profit back into the business and to cover the costs of his childrens' schooling.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep, five sacks of fertiliser and ten metres of piping.

loans.name: Neftali Armando

texts.es:
Neftalí, de 72 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor, no posee ningún tipo de conocimiento académico, actualmente está acompañado y junto a él vive su nieta quien está estudiando en la universidad.

Neftalí, trabaja como agricultor desde que es muy joven, actualmente trabaja una hectárea de jícama, también trabaja como criador de ganado; él compra ganado para repastar y cuando está gordo lo vende y de esta manera obtiene algunos ingresos, que son muy importantes para la economía de su hogar.

Neftalí, anteriormente había solicitado un préstamo para invertido en los cultivos de maíz y frijol, pero no obtuvo ganancias, dado que el clima seco le afecto mucho y sus cultivos se secaron, este nuevo crédito que está solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de jícama.

Su sueño es apoyar a su nieta con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Neftali, 72, works as a farmer.  He has no education and lives with his partner and a granddaughter who attends the university.

Ever since he was a young man Neftali has worked as a farmer and now grows jicama and also raises cattle.  He buys the cattle for grazing and then sells it for more income, which is an important part of his household income.

Neftali requested a previous loan that he used to grow corn and beans but he made no profit because of the dry climate that badly affected the crops.  This new loan will be to buy farm supplies to grow jicama.

His dream is to support his granddaughter in her studies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to grow jicama.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 46 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Merlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Luis Efrain

texts.es:
LUIS TIENE 41 AÑOS, SOLTERO, VIVE CON SU MAMA Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 2 AÑOS, HABITA EN LA COMUNIDAD DE FACUNDO VELA, CANTON GUARANDA, PROVINCIA BOLIVAR.

EL ES UNA PERSONA QUE SE DEDICA AL NEGOCIO Y SIEMBRA DE MORA Y FREJOL, ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE CUYES Y OVEJAS, MEDIANTE EL CREDITO LO INVERTIRA EN EL MANEJO ADECUADO DEL CULTIVO DE MORA Y FREJOL, PARA DE ESTA MANERA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DEL MISMO.

EL SUEÑO DE LUIS ES DE CONSTRUIR UNA CASA.

DURANTE SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA JUGAR FUTBOOL Y CAMINAR POR LOS DIFERENTES BELLOS LUGARES DE SU COMUNIDAD.
texts.en:
Luis, 41, is single and lives with his mother.  He has a two-year-old son and lives in the Facundo Vela community in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

He is dedicated to his business growing blackberries and beans.  He also raises guinea pigs and sheep.  The loan will be used to provide his blackberry and bean crops with proper maintenance to increase production.

Luis dreams about building a house.

In his free time he enjoys playing soccer and walking around the beautiful areas in his community.

loans.use: To give his blackberry and bean crops proper care.

loans.name: Sumaria

texts.en:
Sumaria is a 26-year-old mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Sumaria wants to help her elderly parents because they are not earning, and she wants to enable her brother to look after them. Her brother is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of vehicle engines, renewing the turbines and radiators. He has been working in this business for many years and up to now, his business has been very steady.

However, due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been torn off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of these parts, the whole mechanism of the lathe machine is affected.

Her brother is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy the spare parts to fix his lathe machine or buy cutting tools. Therefore, Sumaria has requested a loan for her brother so that he can fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.

Sumaria hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of a lathe machine and to purchase tools for her brother's turner business, so that he can look after their elderly parents.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 33 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor, solo logro estudiar hasta noveno grado, actualmente está acompañado, tiene un hijo y su pareja quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Luis, desde hace seis años trabajaba como mecánico en un taller de reparación de vehículos, desde que él se mudó a la zona rural se dedicó al trabajo agrícola, estando allí realiza cultivó maíz, frijol y jícama, y estos cultivos son los que le generan ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otras cosas relacionadas a su trabajo agrícola.

El sueño que tiene es trabajar muy fuerte para terminar de complementar sus ahorros para construir su vivienda de ladrillo, porque la que posee actualmente es de lámina y no es muy segura.
texts.en:
Luis, 33, works as a farmer.  He has a ninth grade education and lives with his partner who is a homemaker.  They have a son.

For six years Luis worked as an auto mechanic repairing vehicles.  But since he moved to a rural area he has been working in agriculture growing corn, beans and jicama.  These crops generate an income to support his family.

The money from the loan will be used to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, pest control agents, insecticides and other goods related to agricultural work.

His dream is to work harder to add to his savings to build a brick house.  The one he has now is made of corrugated metal and not very safe.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like fertilizers, pest control agents, insecticides and other goods for his work.

loans.name: Margaritas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS DE ORO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Judith es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de empanadas y queques, venta de ropa, venta de jugos, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Judith es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de su hija que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de empanadas y queques; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y hace más de dieciocho años decidió emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de harina y azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la facilidad de los préstamos y  el área de salud  que brinda la institución.

En la foto no aparece la señora Nadia ya que, después del desembolso, tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The community bank "MARGARITAS DE ORO" is starting its fourth Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Panamericana Social Center.  The group comprises nine members and the secretary of its management board is Judith.  The members are involved in different businesses that include sales of pies and cakes, clothing, juices and construction services.

The loan will benefit small business owners including Judith.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years and joined by invitation through her daughter who is a client of the institution.  Judity currently sells pies and cakes, a trade she learned from her mother.  Over 18 years ago she started her own business.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital to buy flour and sugar wholesale from dealers in the city of La Paz.  Later she will sell her goods at the markets in the city of El Alto.  Through her work she is able to generate an income to support her family economically.  She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says it is the easy credit terms and the health training provided by the institution.

Missing from the photo is Nadia who had to go to work after the meeting.

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar wholesale.

loans.name: Djirigho Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le 18 février 2001. C'est un groupe de femmes qui pratiquent le commerce. Madame Dieynaba qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 49 ans et mère de deux enfants dont une fille. Elle s'active dans la vente de chaussures et de draps depuis plus de quinze ans. Elle compte acheter avec le montant sollicité dix paires de chaussures nu pied, dix paires de chaussures fermés et soixante mètre se de tissu pour les draps. Elle est la seule qui mène cette activité dans sa localité. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was founded on 18th February 2001. It is a group of women who all work as retailers. Dieynaba (on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is forty-nine years old, married and mother to two children - one girl and one boy. She has been selling shoes and bedsheets for fifteen years.

Dieynaba will use her loan to buy ten pairs of open sandals, ten pairs of closed shoes and sixty metres of bedsheet fabric. She is the only person selling these goods in her district. Her profits will help her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and bedsheets.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady est membre de banc villageois depuis sa création en février 2001. Elle est mariée, âgée de 64 ans et mère de six enfants dont quatre garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de pain de singe depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle compte acheter en grand  quantité de sac de pain de singe. Elle est la seule qui mène cette activité dans sa localité. L'activité marche très bien car elle a des clients qui lui sont très fidèle. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Khady has been a member of this 'Banc Villageois' since it was founded in February 2001. She is sixty-four years old, married and mother to six children - two girls and four boys. She has been selling baobab fruit (monkey bread) for more than twenty years.

Khady will use her loan to buy a large quantity of baobab fruit. She is the only person selling this in her district and her business is very successful and has many loyal customers. Her profits will help her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy baobab fruit (monkey bread).

loans.name: Eak's Group

texts.en:
Eak is a 49-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Thom province. This married woman is blessed with four children, three of whom still depend on her.

This family’s main income comes from rice growing, and Eak sometimes works for others for a fee to earn supplemental income. She has been involved in the farming business for 31 years and she earns only about USD 7 per day, of which she can save approximately USD 4 each day. The difficulty in rice farming is drought, which causes her crop to produce lower-than-expected outputs.

This is the first time that Eak has borrowed with VisionFund. As the leader of an eight-member group, Eak will use her loan amount to buy a water filter for her family to use. She hopes to see all of her family members become healthier as they have clean water to drink, and she also wants to generate more income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for her family to use so that all family members will become healthier.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Clara works hard to support her family.

Clara has a buy-and-sell fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall and for her buy-and-sell fruit and vegetable business.

Clara has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of one kid. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning correctly.

For this reason, Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and to provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Sajida gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en:
Gnel is 43 old and he lives with his wife and two children in Geghamavan village in the Gegharkunik region. His son now is in the army passing his military service and his daughter is a student. She studies at the Yerevan State University in the faculty of Economy and Government. She is in her first year of studying and she studies in the paid division.

Gnel is a farmer and simultaneously works as a driver and despite working hard all day long, he does not manage to solve all his family financial problems. The hardest among them is the problem of his daughter’s tuition fee. Now he is asking for this loan of 320.000 Armenian drams in order to pay the tuition fee for his daughter for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee of his daughter for the first semester.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which is always in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Naseem has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston and one wheel and wants to pay the labor cost to cover it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Naseem thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to maintain the engine’s piston and one wheel of the rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is 62 years old and is retired. He started to work by himself as an accountant.  He needs money to keep improving his house, so Ernesto took a loan to buy desk materials for his office, such as paper and other equipment. Ernesto is an experienced man and he will have a lot of clients, so he hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy desk materials for his new office such as paper and other equipment

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
He is Juan, aged 46, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Beverly, a businesswoman and they have five children of which two are in College, two are already working and the youngest in Elementary Level in school. The couple work hard to help each other make a living to raise their five children. They value education for it is a path for their children to uplift their lives.

Juan being a foodie started cooking viands for his neighbors who come late from work and has no time to cook meals. Until  word spread that he cooks really flavorful dishes so more people are ordering cooked food from him. This led Juan to rent a small place to cook and serve dishes to the public. 

To sustain and serve more customers, Juan is requesting for a Php 10000 loan to buy ingredients like fresh meat, rice, seasonings to cook viands at his small eatery. He thanks KIVA and CCT for their noble cause of supporting small businessmen like him. 

Juan aims to have his own place for his eatery. Like most parents, he dreams to see his children finish College to allow them a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for rice, pork, chicken, fish, veggies and seasonings to cook meals for his small eatery.

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en:
Vinani is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is 56 years old and married with seven children, only one of whom is still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Cheung Prey district where crop farming is the common way to make a living. Like others, Thorn has been growing rice for 20 years while her husband works as a paid construction worker to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about 86,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Thorn with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: He Still Lives Group

texts.en:
Winifred is 34 years of age. She is from Mankessim in the Mfantsiman District of the Central Region of Ghana. Winifred is the group representative of He Still Lives. She is single but has one child. Her child is currently in school.

Winifred is a medicine seller who deals in the treatment of malaria and all kinds of fevers and other forms of ailments. She also sells gauze, cotton, etc. Her medicine is in high demand due to the high cases of malaria and other forms of fever mostly caused by mosquitoes in her locality. Winifred has been in business for six years. This is her first time working with the field partner. Winifred plans to have a wholesale shop in addition to the current one.

She will use the current loan to buy more medicine, cotton, and gauze to restock her shop. Winifred will invest her profit into the business, which will help increase sales and savings. She thanks all Kiva micro lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for malaria, gauze, and cotton for resale.

loans.name: Sos Nema 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inaugurée le quatre juin 2010. C'est un groupe de femmes qui évoluent dans le commerce. Madame Binta qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 33 ans et mère d'une fille. Elle s'active dans la vente de fruits et légumes depuis plus de dix ans. Elle compte, avec le montant sollicité, acheter une quantité importante de fruits( mangues,mades,etc.)et de légumes( tomates,oignons,etc.). Elle est douée dans l'activité et elle arrive à satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices vont à aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was founded on 4th June 2010. It is a group of women who all work as retailers. Binta (on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is thirty-three years old, married and mother to one daughter. She has been selling shoes fruit and vegetables for more than ten years.

Binta will use her loan to buy a large quantitiy of fruit (mangoes, mades - a seasonal, local fruit - etc) and vegetables (tomatoes, onions, etc). She is very gifted at selling her produce and pleases her customers. Her profits will help her husband to provide for their family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Sos Nema 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le quatre juin 2010. C'est un groupe de femmes qui évoluent dans le commerce.
Madame Martha, qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 31 ans et mère de deux filles. Elle s'active dans le maraichage depuis plus de cinq ans.Elle compte avec le prêt sollicité acheter des semences, de l’engrais, d'insecticides et de pesticides. Elle est douée dans l'activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son dans la prise en charge de l'éducation des enfants et dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was founded on 4th June 2010. It is a group of women who all work as retailers. Martha (on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is thirty-one years old, married and mother to two girls. She has been growing and selling vegetables for more than five years.

Martha will use her loan to buy seed, fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide. She is very gifted in her business. Her profits will help to provide for the day-to-day expenses of her family and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide.

loans.name: Dolrech

texts.en: Dolrech is 27 years old, single, and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. He runs and operates a rice and corn mill, and grain distribution business that supplies rice and corn grains within the Zamboanga peninsula. He is also an active member of Paglaum MPC and has availed himself of various loans already. This time, he is taking out a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for vehicle registration.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle registration

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is heading for the next crop season. She wants to prepare well especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Josephine hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson thought he was in the right place when he joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. He decided to give it a try after he learned he can receive financial assistance for his chosen business. Nelson has maintained his membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. He has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, he availed of a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for his chosen business. Nelson wishes to continuously manage his business more effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: God Gives Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a 43-year-old woman. She comes from Apam in the Gomoa West District of the Central Region of Ghana. Ruth is the leader of the God Gives Group. She is married with two children, both of whom are schooling. Ruth has four dependents.

She is a petty trader who deals in stationery and sells items like exercise books, text books, pens, pencils, erasers, etc. Ruth has been in business for 24 years. She is also a photographer, which gives her profit in addition to her stationery business. With the help of the field partner, she has been able to build her own storeroom where she now keeps her goods through her previous micro loans.

Ruth has been with the field partner for three years now and this is her seventh loan. Ruth has a good repayment record and always pays on time. She has a future plan of having a wholesale shop to supply the community and its surrounding school with stationary items. Ruth will use the current loan to buy more textbooks, pens, pencils, and erasers to restock her shop. She will invest her profit in the business to increase sales. The extra income will also help support her husband to cater to the family. Ruth and her group member thank all Kiva micro lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase exercise books, textbooks, erasers, pencils, pens, chalk and other stationary items for resale.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Kwesi is 54 years old. He comes from Apam in the Gomoa West area of the Central Region of Ghana. Kwesi is married with five children. The ages of his children are 19, 22, 26, 30 and 33. Kwesi is a petty trader who owns a provisions store and sells things such as milk, sugar, biscuits, toffees, slippers, mosquito repellent, electrical appliances, etc. He has been in this business for five years now. Kwesi does fishing to supplement the profit from his trading business. He is a new client. This is his first time working with the Field Partner.

Kwesi is aiming to expand his business and also provide better service to his customers in the next five years to come. His main challenge is the rise in prices of goods on a daily basis. He will use the current loan to purchase goods in bulk, which will be an antidote for his problem. Kwesi will invest his profit into the business, which will help him increase sales and savings. He will gradually use some of his profit to complete his ongoing building project to accommodate his family. Kwesi and his group member are grateful to all Kiva micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy goods such as  mosquito repellent, milk, milo, slippers, electrical appliances, biscuits, sugar, and diapers for resale.

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Savoeurn is 43 years old. A single woman, she makes a living through growing rice and working for others for a fee. She has been involved in the farming business for 20 years. Savoeurn’s daily income is about USD 12 per day and she can save about USD 8 each day. Drought, which causes rice to grow unhealthily, is the main challenge to her farming business.

Savoeurn is leading a three-member group to apply for loans from VisionFund; she will spend her loan on purchasing organic fertilizer to improve her crop productivity. She hopes that she can generate more income so that she can upgrade her lifestyle and meet her family’s needs on time.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity and increase her income to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sos Nema 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le quatre juin 2010. Ce groupe est constitué de vingt femmes très dynamiques qui développent l'activité commerciale. Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de 28 ans et sans enfant.Elle évolue dans l'aviculture depuis plus de quatre ans. Elle compte avec le montant sollicité acheter des poussins, des aliments, des vaccins et assurer l'entretien du local. Elle a une bonne clientèle qu'elle arrive à satisfaire. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider ses parents dans les dépenses quotidiennes et à satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was founded on 4th June 2010. It is a group of twenty dynamic women who all work as retailers. Awa (on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is twenty-eight years old, single and has no children. She has been raising poultry for more than four years.

Awa will use her loan to buy young chickens, feed and vaccines for them, and to pay for the upkeep of her premises . She has a good customer base and satisfies their needs very well. Her profits will help her parents pay for their day-to-day expenses and provide for her needs.

loans.use: to buy young chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Sivorn's Group

texts.en:
A 34-year-old farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sivorn is married and she is blessed with two children who are in school. Sivorn and her husband have owned a rice growing business for 16 years. Sometimes, she and her husband work for others for a fee to supplement income. Together, they earn about USD 10 per day and can save about USD 8 each day. Rice is being destroyed by pests and grows unhealthily; these are the challenges to her farming business.

In a group of two members, Sivorn is the group leader and she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her crop productivity. She hopes that she can get more income to upgrade her family's standard of living and expand her family’s business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity, so that she can earn more income to upgrade her family's standard of living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en:
Dara, aged 41, is a resident of Mondulkiri province. She is married and has four children, three of whom are dependent on her. Her cassava growing business has been running for years and it is the main source of her family's income. In order to earn more income, Dara sometimes works for others for a fee. Her crop is threatened by pests and diseases; these are the main challenges to her cassava farming business.

Now, she is leading a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund to buy organic pesticide. She hopes that her crop can grow healthily and produce high outputs so she can support her school-aged children and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide to grow her crop healthily and produce high outputs, so she can support her family’s needs.

loans.name: Tilene Nord Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le dix neuf mai 2007. C'est un groupe de femmes qui pratiquent le commerce. Madame Jeannette qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 46 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont deux garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de chaussures,vêtements et sacs depuis plus de vingt années.Elle compte avec ce prêt acheter trente sacs, vingt douzaines de vêtements et cinq cartons de chaussures. Elle est très douée dans l'activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la dépense quotidienne,à la santé et à la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was founded on 19th May 2007. It is a group of women who all work as retailers. Jeannette (on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is forty-six years old, married and mother to five children - three girls and two boys. She has been selling clothing, shoes and bags for more than twenty years.

Jeannette will use her loan to buy thirty bags, a large amount of clothing and five boxes of shoes. She is very gifted in the sale of her products. Her profits will help to provide for day-to-day expenses, healthcare and schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Lourdes Azucena

texts.es:
LOURDES ES SOLTERA, ES UNA PERSONA CON MUCHOS SUEÑOS QUE DESEA ALCANZAR,VIVE SOLA, SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DEL PAN, AMEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS, MEDIANTE EL USO DEL CREDITO DESEA INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO  YA QUE ES PRIMORDIAL PARA ELLA REALIZAR UNA AMPLIACION DEL MISMO Y POR MEDIO DE LOS RESULTADOS ECONOMICOS MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.

EL SUEÑO DE LOURDES ES EL DE CONSTRUIR SU PROPIA CASA.

DURANTE SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA REALIZAR DEPORTES EXTREMOS TALES COMO: MOTOCROSS, ESCALAR MONTAÑAS ENTRE OTROS.
texts.en:
Lourdes is single. She is a person with many dreams that she hopes to achieve. She lives alone. She works baking and selling bread, and additionally raises chickens.

Through the use of this loan, she would like to expand her business, which is very important to her. With the income she generates, she can improve her quality of life.

Lourdes' dream is to build her own house. During her free time, she likes to participate in extreme sports, such as motocross, mountain climbing, and others.

loans.use: to expand her bakery business.

loans.name: Tilene Nord Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en Mai 2007. C'est un groupe de femmes qui pratiquent le commerce. Madame Christine qui est  à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 32 ans et mère de trois filles. Elle  s'active dans la vente de produits de consommation denrées de premières nécessites. Elle  mène cette activité depuis plus de deux années. Avec le montant sollicité elle compte acheter dix sacs de riz, de l'huile, des pots de tomate, bouillons, etc.... . Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was founded in May 2007. It is a group of women who all work as retailers. Christine (on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is thirty-two years old, married and mother to three girls. She has been selling basic food products for more than two years.

Christine will use her loan to buy ten sacks of rice, oil, jars of tomatoes, stock cubes, etc. Her profits will help her husband to provide for their family.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Sugey Del Carmen

texts.es: Sugey es una ama de casa residenciada en un barrio del municipio de Soledad que decidió generar ingresos para su familia a través de la venta de prendas de vestir y el alquiler de lavadoras, actividades que le permitirían continuar con sus labores en el hogar y al tanto del cuidado de sus seis hijos.  Diariamente ella está disponible a partir de las 6 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. doce horas consecutivas en las que los habitantes del sector donde reside alquilan lavadoras por fracciones con la finalidad de realizar esta labor con el menor esfuerzo posible y un ahorro significativo en agua y detergentes, y su venta de ropa la promueve entre sus misma clientela en este mismo horario.
