Sugey lleva dos años en esta labor, en la que ha contado con multiplex beneficios para su familia y en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar tres lavadoras y nuevo surtido de prendas de vestir, de este modo podrá atender más servicios y tendrá un inventario para abastecer la demanda que se ocasiona a raíz de la temporada de navidad.  Su meta a futuro es tener muchas lavadoras e inaugurar una miscelánea que le permita aportar más bienestar y calidad de vida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sugey is a housewife who lives in the town of Soledad. She decided to earn a living to support her family by selling clothes and renting out washing machines. These activities allow her to continue with her household chores and look after her six children.

She is available every day from six in the morning till six in the evening; 12 hours straight, during which time local people can rent washing machines for short periods, helping them be more efficient and save a significant amount of water and cleaning detergents.

She sells her clothes to these customers during the same hours. She has been doing this for two years to the benefit of her family.

Now she is asking for her first loan through the 'Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo' to buy three washing machines and a new selection of clothes. In this way she can offer a better service and have enough stock to satisfy the demand for clothes during the Christmas period.

In the future she would like to own more washing machines and open a general store which will allow her to improve the quality of life of her customers.

loans.use: to buy three washing machines and a new lot of clothes.

loans.name: Wendsongda De Weglega Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALIF est le représentant du groupe WENDSONGDA DE WEGLEGA. Il est marié sans enfant et a 02 personnes en charges.
Mr  est gérant de kiosque depuis 03 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son village.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 02 caisses de boissons (sucreries), 02 boites de café, et 02 boites de lait.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne devenir un grand restaurateur.
texts.en:
Salif is the representative of the 'Wendsongda de Weglega' Group. He is married and has no children. He is responsible for two people. Salif has been running a small cafe for three years. He buys his supplies in the markets in his village.

Salif will use his loan to buy two crates of soft drinks, two boxes of coffee and two boxes of milk. His plan is to reinvest his earnings in his business and he hopes one day to own and run a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy 2 crates of drinks, 2 boxes of coffee and 2 boxes of milk.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Marta, de 37 de años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a los trabajos agrícolas y además a la crianza de cerdos, actualmente tiene 12 cerdos y todos de diferentes tamaño.

Marta, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también se dedica a cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol junto con sus hijos; desde muy pequeña ella aprendió los trabajos de la tierra, porque ayudaba a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos que tiene sembrados para tener más rendimiento en sus cosechas y tener mejores ingresos.

Marta, sueña con seguir trabajando junto a sus hijos, además quiere criar cerdos y poner una granja de pollos, para tener ingresos extras, para generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 37, wasn't able to study for lack of funds so she decided to work at home and do agricultural work, as well as raising pigs.

Now she has 12 pigs of all different sizes. In addition, and apart from doing the housework, she looks after 7000 m² of corn crops and 7000 m² of frijoles beans. She does this with the help of her children.

She learnt how to work in agriculture by helping her father when she was young.

She is asking for a loan to buy compost and fertilizers for her crops so she can have a better harvest and improve her income.

Her dream is to work with her children, raising pigs and also chickens, which will give her extra income for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Tilene  Nord Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en Mai 2007. C'est un groupe de femmes qui pratiquent le commerce. Madame Angèle qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de 56 ans et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Elle s'active dans cette activité depuis plus de seize années. Elle compte acheter soixante litres de l'huile de palme et soixante litres du jus de citron. Elle a une forte clientèle à Dakar car c'est elle seule qui le vend dans sa localité. Les bénéfices vont servir à augmenter son niveau d’épargne, à la prise en charge de ses enfants et à satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was founded in May 2007. It is a group of women who all work as retailers. Angèle (on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is fifty-six years old, single and mother to three children - one girl and two boys. She has been running her business for more than sixteen years.

Angèle will use her loan to buy sixty litres of palm oil and sixty litres of lemon juice. She is the only person selling these goods in her district of Dakar, so she has a large number of customers. Her profits will increase her savings, help her to provide for her children and provide for her own needs.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and lemon juice.

loans.name: Tupak Amawta

texts.es:
TUPAK TIENE 37 AÑOS, SOLTERO,TIENE UN HIJO DE 13 AÑOS, Y VIVE CON SUS PAPAS EN LA COMUNIDAD DE LARCOLOMA, CANTON GUARANDA, PROVINCIA BOLIVAR.

SE DEDICA ESPECIALMENTE AL COMERCIO DE QUESO, ADEMAS A LA SIEMBRA DE PAPAS ARBEJA, HABAS, Y A LA CRIANZA DE GANADOS, CERDOS Y OVEJAS, MEDIANTE EL USO DE ESTE CREDITO PRETENDE ENFOCARSE EN EL COMERCIO Y LA COMPRA DE TERRENOS, PARA EL DESARROLLO ECONOMICO DE SU FAMILIA.

EL SUEÑO DE TUPAK ES DE TENER UNA CASA Y NEGOCIO PROPIO.

EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA JUGAR FUTBALL Y ESCUCHAR MUSICA.
texts.en:
Tupak, 37, is single and has a 13-year-old son. He lives with his parents in Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar.

He specialises in selling cheese. However, in addition, he also grows potatoes, peas, and beans; and he raises cattle, pigs and sheep.

He will use this loan to concentrate on his commercial activities and purchase more land. This will help his economic situation. His dream is to have his own house and business.

In his free time he likes playing football and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy some land.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
Blanca, de 51 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 17 años de edad, sus otros dos hijos viven en los E.E.U.U. tiene más de cinco años que no los ve. 

Blanca, junto a su esposo toda su vida han trabajado en la agricultura, porque es de donde ellos con sacrificio han logrado crecer a sus hijos. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, poque tienen sembrado 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y necesita fertilizarlos a tiempo para que sea una buena producción.

Blanca, sueña con viajar a los E.E.U.U. porque desea conocer a sus nietos y poder ver a sus hijos nuevamente.
texts.en:
Blanca, 51, is very hard-working and responsible woman. She lives with her husband and 17-year-old son. Her other two children live in the USA. She hasn't seen them for more than five years.

Together with her husband, she has worked in agriculture all her life. They have made many sacrifices to raise their children.

She needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, pesticides and herbicides. She has 14,000 m² of corn and she needs to treat the crops at the right time so she can have a good harvest.

She dreams of travelling to the USA so she can meet her grandchildren and see her own children again.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dansivi

texts.fr: Dansivi est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans qui a six enfants à charge. Dansivi est une revendeuse de tomates fraîches et de piment vert qui vit à Baguida. Dansivi achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans à la devanture de son domicile. Dansivi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches et de piment vert en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dansivi is forty-four years old, married and has six children in her care. She lives in Baguida and sells fresh tomatoes and green chillies. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and sells them from in front of her house.

Dansivi has requested this loan to buy baskets of fresh tomatoes and green chillies to sell and increase her profits. These will help her husband to arrange schooling for their children.

loans.use: to buy 8 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 4 baskets of green chillies.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is managing a general store in Pagadian City primarily selling goods for human consumption and household use. He is married with two school-age children. Last April 23, 2007, Anthony and his wife signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC where he accesses financial assistance for his existing bsiness. In need of additional capital for expansion of his business, he availed a loan to restock his store with inventories such as cereals, animal feeds, groceries and other items.

loans.use: to restock his store with inventories such as cereals, animal feed, groceries and other items.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Kiswendsida De Ballole Group

texts.fr:
Mr RASMANE  est le responsable du groupe KISWENDSIDA DE BALLOLE. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé à  10 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 06 personnes en charges.
Mr  fait de l’agriculture depuis 09 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés  environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 boîtes de semence de choux et 02 boîtes de semence de persil.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour aider sa famille à payer la scolarité des enfants. Il ambitionne devenir un grand jardinier.
texts.en:
Rasmane is the representative of the 'Kiswendsida de Ballole' Group. He is married and father to five children. The eldest is ten years old and the youngest is four years old. Four of his children currently attend school and he is responsible for a total of six people.

Rasmane has been growing vegetables for nine years. He buys his supplies in the local markets. He plans to use his loan to buy four boxes of cabbage seed and two boxes of parsley seed. His profits will help the family to pay for schooling for their children. Rasmane hopes one day to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of cabbage seed and 2 boxes of parsley seed.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a 78-year-old widow with one adult-age child and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC since August 22, 2011. Recently, she availed a loan to pay for a medical checkup and to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical checkup and purchase maintenance medicines.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is 59 years old and married with adult-age children. She is from Puntod, Lopez Jaena where she operates and runs a candle production business and candle retail store. She is supported by her loans from Paglaum MPC and nurtured the same for almost 10 years in membership. This time she needs additional capital to respond to bulk orders so she asks for a loan from the co-op. The amount will be spent to buy wax and other items for candle production.

loans.use: to buy wax and other items for candle production.

loans.name: Lion Sisters Group

texts.en:
Adama is the leader of Lion Sisters Group which is made up of four members. All four members are engaged in petty trading, each selling different products.

Adama, who is 29 years old, was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She has been selling clothing materials (textiles) for the past fourteen years. She uses the proceeds of her business to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family.

Adama and other group members of Lion Sisters Solidarity are requesting for their first loan a total of 4,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Adama will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to purchase two more bales of cotton materials for her business.

Adama is married and has a cheerful family of four children, aged 14, 11, 5 and 3 years old. She hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. She hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family.

Adama and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

Adama is standing on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase two more bales of cotton materials for her business.

loans.name: Edwards Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is a twenty-seven-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of Edwards Solidarity Group, which has four members, all women. Memunatu sells soft drinks. She has been in this soft drinks business for the past fifteen years. She opens her business six days in a week from 9am to 9pm.

She established her business to help support her children in school. Memunatu is married and has three children who all go to school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.

Memunatu and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL to buy more assorted types of drinks for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family.

In the future, Memunatu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to expand her business. She believes that educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Memunatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

Memunatu is standing on the left of the group picture.

loans.use: to buy more assorted types of drinks for her business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is an artisan from Peru who specializes in handcrafted ceramic and gemstone jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones.

Silvia has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is her story: "I was born in Iquitos, one of the most charming towns in the Peruvian rainforest. I was always a timid child and jewelry helped me conquer my shyness — I can convey my energy through my designs, a positive energy. I feel so proud when I see my ideas become a reality. I find inspiration in everything around me, especially colors. I really like ceramics and gemstones.

"Many thanks to all of you who support artisans like myself. This loan will be of great assistance as I prepare for the holiday season."

Use the link below to view Silvia's handcrafted ceramic and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/9117

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones

loans.name: Primavera 2015 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA 2015” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yanela es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido y venta de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de uniformes para policías, venta de suplementos alimenticios, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yanela es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y hace más de veinte años que decidió emprender su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PRIMAVERA 2015” communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Panamericana focal center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Yanela is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are weaving and selling blankets, selling clothes, selling police uniforms, selling food supplements, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business woman, including Yanela. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a a friend who was a client of the institution. Right now she has a business weaving and selling blankets. She reports that she decided to start her own business.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying vicuña wool wholesale, which she will acquire from sellers in the city of El Alto. Later, after making them, she will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health and the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
MARIA TIENE 36 AÑOS ES SOLTERA, TIENE UN HIJO DE 13 AÑOS VIVE CON LOS PAPAS EN EL CANTON GUARNDA, PROVINCIA BOLIVAR.
ELLA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA,SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, PAPAS, HABAS, Y ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE VACAS Y OVEJAS.

POR MEDIO DEL CREDITO DESEA REALIZAR LA COMPRA DE UNA VACA PARA MEJORAR AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE LA LECHE.

EL SUEÑO DE MARIA ES DE CONSTRUIR UNA CASA, DURANTE SU TIEMPO LIBRE LE  GUSTA TEJER PRENDAS DE VESTIR.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. She has a 13 year old son. She lives with her parents in the Guarnda canton, Bolivar province.

She works in agriculture, planting corn, potatoes, and beans. She also raises cows and sheep.

Through the loan, she wants to buy a cow to improve and increase milk production.

Maria's dream is to build a house. In her free time she likes to knit clothes.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sayuris Ester

texts.es: Sayuris es una microempresaria habitante de un barrio de Barranquilla que emprendió su negocio al quedar desempleada, ella se dijo a si misma que debía hacer alguna actividad con la que pudiera ofrecer bienestar a su familia, así que decidió comprar una fotocopiadora de pocas especificaciones para desde su casa ofrecer el servicio, sin embargo tuvo muy buena acogida y su conyuge decidió apoyarla y le compro una fotocopiadora más grande con un portátil, luego le compró un computador de escritorio para que ampliara su oferta de servicios.  Su mamá le propuso que comprara calzado y prendas de vestir que eran fácilmente comercializables en los pueblos del Magdalena a lo que también le apostó. Hoy en día es una microempresaria exitosa que administra varios roles en su vida: ama de casa, madre y esposa, y que está muy feliz de dar a su familia bienestar con su trabajo, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en calzado y prendas de vestir para mantener un inventario que respalde la temporada de fin de año.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su gama de productos y servicios, y garantizar que sus hijos tengan una educación de calidad y que a largo plazo sean unos profesionales.
texts.en: Sayurisis a micro-businesswoman who lives in a neighborhood of Barranquilla. She started her business when she lost her job. She told herself that she had to have some activity for her family's well being, so she decided to buy a photocopier with few specifications so that she could offer that service from her house. Nonetheless, she had a good response and her spouse decided to help her, so he bought her a larger photocopier that was portable. Later, he bought her a desktop computer to expand the services she offers. Her mother proposed that she buy shoes and clothing, which are easy to sell in the towns of Magdalena, and she invested in her as well. Today she is a successful micro-businesswoman who manages several roles in her life: housewife, mother, and wife. She is very happy to bring well being to her family with her work. That is why she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in shoes and clothing to maintain an inventory for the end of the year season. Her goal for the future is to expand her range of products and services, and guarantee   a quality education for her children so that in the future they can graduate from college.

loans.use: to invest in shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase motor oil, steering ball joints, brakes and rubber spring axles.

loans.name: Bogologo De Balole Group

texts.fr:
Mme ADAMA est représentante du groupe BOGOLOGO DE BALOLE. Elle est marié et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans 06 mois. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 12 personnes en charges.
Mme est restauratrice depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 01 sac de riz, 01 fagot de bois, et une quantité de condiments.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour aider son mari à payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande restauratrice.
texts.en:
Adama is the representative of the 'Bogologo de Balole' Group. She is married and mother to five children. The eldest is twenty years old and the youngest is seven and a half. Three of her children currently attend school and she is responsible for a total of twelve people.

Adama has been running a restaurant for four years, she buys her supplies at the local market. She plans to use her loan to buy one sack of rice, a bundle of firewood and a quantity of food ingredients. Her profits will help her husband pay for schooling for their children. In the future, Adama hopes to run a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice, 1 bundle of firewood and a quantity of food ingredients.

loans.name: Eyi

texts.fr: Eyi est une femme mariée âgée de 61 ans qui a trois enfants à charge. Eyi est une revendeuse de sel qui vit à Baguida. Eyi s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant et à domicile. Eyi sollicite l’octroi de ce prêt pour commander des sacs de sel en vue de bien vendre puis d’avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Eyi is a 61-year-old married mother to three children who lives in Baguida. She earns a living through selling salt. She gets her supplies twice monthly from market then resells the salt both as a street vendor and out of her own home.

Eyi is requesting this loan so she can purchase bags of salt so she can earn a greater profit. By doing this, she will be able to assist her husband in paying for their children's educations.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of salt.

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: Divorcée et mère de deux enfants, Afiavi est une femme âgée de 43 ans résidant à Baguida. Marchande de condiments, Afiavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers et à domicile. Afiavi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de cubes, et des tas de potasses. Afiavi profitera du bénéfice suite à une bonne vente pour bien prendre soin de ses enfants en les inscrivant dans des écoles de qualités supérieures.
texts.en:
Afiavi is a 43-year-old divorced mother to two children who lives in Baguida. She earns a living through selling various items. She gets her supplies twice monthly from market then resells them as both as a street vendor and out of her own home.

Afiavi is requesting this loan to purchase stock cubes and potash fertilizer. With the resulting profits from selling her stock, she will be able to take good care of her children by sending them to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase four packs of stock cubes and five bags of potash fertilizer.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Divorcée et mère de deux enfants, Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 62 ans qui vit à Baguida. Akossiwa est une couturière qui expose des pagnes dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire, Akossiwa se rend une fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is sixty-two years old, divorced and mother to two children. She lives in Baguida and works as a seamstress, selling her pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) from a workshop in her home.

Akossiwa buys her supplies once a month from the market. She has requested this loan to buy more pagnes to increase her earnings. These will be used to help her children with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr: Emefa est une femme mariée âgée de 27 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayant deux enfants à charge, Emefa  se bat  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des produits d’alimentaires. Pour s’approvisionner, Emefa se rend trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de gingembres, Emefa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Emefa va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emefa is twenty-seven years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and earns a living selling food products. She buys new stock three times a month from the market.

Emefa has requested this loan to buy sacks of ginger. The resulting profit will help her husband pay the day-to-day expenses of their family and provide for schooling for their children.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of ginger.

loans.name: Manfred

texts.en:
Manfred is 22 years old. He is single and doesn't have children. He lives in his parents' house and helps them with their expenses. Manfred is a mason and gets a paycheck every week. Manfred also sells milk and makes cheese.

He needs a loan to buy a milking cow. He hopes you can help him because he wants to improve his business and he would like to quit the mason job.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr: Femme mariée de 37 ans, Félicia est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé. Avec deux enfants à sa charge, Félicia est une revendeuse des objets en plastiques. Félicia s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Félicia sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de sceaux en plastiques en vue de mieux vendre puis de satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de ses enfants
texts.en:
Félicia is thirty-seven years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and sells plastic products. She buys new stock twice a month from the market, and sells it on foot in surrounding neighbourhoods.

Félicia has requested this loan to buy plastic buckets to satisfy the demands of her customers. Her resulting profits will help her husband to pay for the day-to-day expenses of their children.

loans.use: to buy 47 plastic buckets.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: It was May 5, 2005 when Lilia and her husband agreed to sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC. In need of additional inputs such as bags of fertilizers and insecticides, Lilia asks for her 15th loan to cover these expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional inputs such as bags of fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach is a resident in Kampong Cham province and she is 41 years old. Mach is married and has five dependent children, four of whom are in school. In order to make a better support to her family, she has run a rice growing business for 23 years. Additionally, she is working for others for a fee to get more income. Pests are the main challenge to her farming business.

Mach, who is the group leader of two members, is applying for a loan from VisionFund to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to apply to the farmland so as to improve crop productivity. She hopes to earn more income so that she can keep her children in school until they graduate and upgrade the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to apply to the farmland so as to improve crop's productivity.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is known in Tudela, Misamis Occidental for her snacks and food vending business. She has been into this type of business for 10 years. Through this, she was able to send her children to school until they finished college.

Apart from her hard work in her food vending business, she is also an active member of Paglaum MPC where she has accessed various financial support through loan products. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, meat, salt and spices and others.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, meat, salt, spices and others.

loans.name: Ha Mokolanyane Group

texts.en:
Mantsane is a 90-year-old mother of 10 children, grandmother of 16 and great grandmother of eight. She lives with two of her grandchildren, age 12 and 16, and one of her sick children, aged 68. Mantsane, now in a family of four, lives in a traditional hut that is not well-ventilated, nor warm in winter. She works long tiring hours to ensure there is enough food for her entire family, some of whom are going to school and only help her in the field on Saturdays and Sundays, and one who is sick and needs her constant care. Together with her eldest grandchild, she has to wake up between 3 a.m. and 4 a.m. during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for the children before they go to school.

Collecting firewood, setting up the fire and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold, and often Mantsane has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke which, when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time, can lead to lung diseases, eye problems and in the worst cases, to death. In these circumstances, life for women like Mantsane has been very difficult.

Mantsane has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to be able to purchase a clean cook stove that will provide her -- and nine other people from her village who are living in similar circumstances -- the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require a lot of wood -- hard to find in Lesotho -- nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery that runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp --a life improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation and the danger of house fires. It has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For stove info please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: to be able to pay for the ACE cook stove, which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Akouto

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Akouto est une femme mariée vivant à Adidogoméa. Akouto a trois enfants à charge et exerce comme activité, la vente de produits de beautés, alimentaires et des objets en plastiques à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Akouto achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché. Pour bien tirer une bonne rentabilité de son commerce, Akouto sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de pommades, des cartons de poissons et des litres d’huile afin d’orienter l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et de prendre en charges certains dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouto is thirty-three years old, married and has three children in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and sells beauty products, food items and plastic products from her home and in the surrounding areas. She buys her supplies three times a month from the market.

Akouto has requested this loan to buy bottles of beauty cream, boxes of fish and litres of oil. Her earnings will pay for schooling for her children and pay for some of the expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 30 bottles of beauty cream, 2 boxes of fish and 8 litres of oil.

loans.name: Blessed Assurance Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 52 years old. She is from Apam in the Gomoa West District of the Central Region of Ghana. Margaret is the group representative of Blessed Assurance. She is married with five children. The youngest is the only one currently in school. The ages of the children are 15, 23, 25, 31 and 36. Margaret is a petty trader who sells children's dresses and sewing materials. She has been in this business for the past 20 years.

Margaret has a challenge of accessing additional funds to restock her store. She has a vision to add plastic products to her business in the next five years because the demand for it is very high in her locality. The new loan will be invested into her business and the profit will be used to pay her child’s school fees and also save for the family's future business expansion. Margaret thanks all Kiva microlenders for their support of the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy clothing like children's wear, sewing materials, and diapers for resale.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Veronica, who is in her early 30s, is single and has two children who are still in school.

She has had a charcoal store for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Veronica's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her charcoal stock and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments and take care of her family.

She will use this loan to open another charcoal store in a different place. She dreams of being a big business woman.

Veronica will share this loan with her loan group, Tumaini, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another charcoal store in a different place.

loans.name: Noe Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango is the second largest city in Guatemala and has grown quite a bit in the past decades. There, seven determined women have gathered together to transform their lives by empowering themselves and growing their small businesses. Their primary objectives are to meet the expenses of their households and to be certain that their children are able to have formal education. The ladies realize how important education is for a successful future, especially since almost all of them have had little or no education.

Mayra, who is 25 years old, is married with four children. She has an animal husbandry business and is requesting a loan to buy two bulls. Besides this business, she has another business making soaps and shampoos that she will sell out of her home. She will use another portion of the loan to buy supplies for her soap and shampoo business.

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, which combines small loans and education, is especially useful for these ladies. They learn to manage their loans with knowledge and training about budgeting, accounting, customer service and marketing.

Kiva investors are greatly valued by these women in their efforts to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. They face a brighter and more prosperous future benefitting themselves and their families. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy two bulls.

loans.name: Wakiso Hill School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Shaka. He is the head teacher of Wakiso Hill Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Wakiso with 350 students. Wakiso Hill School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Wakiso Hill School will repay its loan from school fees, which are collected each term. Shaka ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from waterborne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Jeannette est une veuve femme qui vit à Adidogomè  avec un enfant à charge. Jeannette est âgée de 50 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Jeannette est une revendeuse de pagnes, de sacs à main et des chaussures qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Jeannette demande ce prêt pour commander des unités de sacs à main et des pièces de pagnes en vue de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et de bien vendre puis avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Jeanette is fifty years old, widowed and has one child in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and makes a good living selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), handbags and shoes. She buys new supplies once a month from the market.

Jeanette has requested this loan to buy more handbags and pagnes to respond to the demands of her customers. Her increased earnings will give her a good financial position and allow her to help her child's education.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and 14 handbags.

loans.name: Akoss

texts.fr: Femme mariée de 31 ans, Akoss vit à Adidogomé et est mère de deux enfants. Akoss se bat énormément dans son commerce de petits poissons fumés pour subvenir  à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Akoss demande ce crédit pour commander des paniers de petits poissons fumés et des tas de poissons séchés en vue de mieux revendre puis avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Akoss is thirty-one years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Adidogomé and works very hard to sell smoked fish to earn a living for herself and her children.

Akoss has requested this loan to buy baskets of small, smoked fish and a quantity of dried fish. This will increase her stock levels and her earnings, and allow her to improve the living conditions of her children and pay for schooling.

loans.use: to buy 9 baskets of smoked fish and 4 quantities of dried fish.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en:
Met is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Tbaung Khmum province. She has four children, one of whom is independent and three still in school. Met and her husband are growing cassava and rice to support the family’s living. They have been involved in these businesses for 28 years. Earning around USD 12 per day, Met manages to save around USD 7 each day for future needs. Low cassava production is the main challenge to Met’s farming business.

She decided to form a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund to save her business. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields; some loan portion left will be used to buy organic pesticide and pay for labor fees. She hopes to earn more income in order to buy an additional plot of farmland and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields as well as her income and save for buying more plots of farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.name: El's Group

texts.en:
El, aged 61, is a local farmer living in Tbaung Khmum province and he is married. To make a living, he has run a cassava and rubber farming business for years. Decrease in cassava’s price is the challenge to his farming business.

Forming a group of two members to request loan from VisionFund, El is the leader and he will use his loan portion to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop productivity, some organic pesticide and pay labor fees. He hopes that the crop can produce more outputs to meet his family’s needs and buy an additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and pay for labor fees to grow his crop healthily and fruitfully, so to increase his crop yield.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey owns a business. He has been selling purses and backpacks for over six years.

Since his last loan from Kiva, his wife had surgery. Also local currency devaluation had a negative effect on Sergey's business. But Sergey did not give up. He cares about his family and continues to further develop his business.

Sergey is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to increase his assortment of purses, backpacks and suitcases. The loan will help him to attract new clients and receive additional income.

loans.use: to purchase purses, backpacks and suitcases.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio works as a mason. He is married and is the father of one son.

Gregorio is also a farmer and he needs a loan to buy a milking cow. He has been in the milk business since he was a child so he has good experience.

Gregorio is the owner of his house, but the place is made of adobe so he would like to improve his home in the future. Gregorio is healthy. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Chosen Generation Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is 47 years of age. She is from Apam in the Gomoa West District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is single. Rebecca is a baker with 15 years of experience. According to Rebecca, she took over from her mother who was a baker and she has been a successful doing it. She has no other business that serves as another source of income.

Rebecca is a new client and this is her first time working with the field partner. She has promised to repay her loan by the due date. Rebecca’s main challenge is the price increase of the raw materials she uses, which is restricting her from buying in bulk to enjoy discounts and to meet customer demand. She has planned to buy a flour mixing machine in the next five years. This will enable her to mix the flour in large quantities and reduce production and transport costs. It will bring additional profit because other people in her locality will also be mixing their flour at her place.

Rebecca will use the current loan to purchase more raw materials in order to boost her business and also meet her customers' demands. She will use some of her profit to cater to the needs of her dependents and part for her business expansion goals. Rebecca and her group member thank all Kiva microlenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and margarine in bulk to bake in large quantities to sell to customers.

loans.name: Flor Del Campo Patzuneras Group

texts.en:
It is always an exciting time for a group of indigenous Guatemalan women to meet for the very first time and learn about the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge that combines small loans and education. The goals are for the women to empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. Since practically all of the 22,000 clients of the organization have had little or no formal education and do not have access to credit, this is an amazing opportunity for them.

Seven visionary women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor del Campo Patzuneras” or “Flowers of Patzun.” Patzun is an indigenous town in the State of Chimaltenango.

Margarita is a member of the Trust Bank. She is 60 years old, married, and has nine children. When she realized that she, along with her husband, needed to earn funds to support their very large family, she began her businesses. Margarita has a convenience store and also sells chicken meat and vegetables. As her businesses became successful and her clientele grew, she saw the necessity to get a loan. The loan was destined for the purchase of increased inventory for her convenience store. Specifically she needs to buy more oil, sugar, rice, vegetables and other supplies for her convenience store.

The vast majority of the population is Kaqchikel Maya. Problems in the area include widespread poverty and malnutrition, lack of work and inadequate education. The area is largely agricultural and men work as laborers in fields of broccoli, snow peas, blackberries and other crops. The land is very fertile and the wages are quite low.

Kiva investors are essential partners in this effort and are greatly valued by the women. They are poised to step into a brighter future benefiting themselves, their families and their community of Patzun, Guatemala.

loans.use: to purchase increased inventory for her convenience store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 58 years old. She is retired and she receives a retirement payment. She is also an artisan.

She needs a loan to fix the walls of the house where she lives. She would like to have a better place to live since she is the owner of the place. Magdalena works hard and she is healthy. She hopes you can help her. She is at her house in the picture.

loans.use: to fix the walls of the house where she lives.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is 39 years old. He is in the pastries business. He is a good cook and he needs a loan to buy ingredients to make cakes such as flour, salt and butter.

Jorge learned how to make a cake many years ago. He is the owner of his bakery, and he hopes you can help him. Jorge is a responsible man. He pays rent but he would like to have a house of his own in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cakes such as flour, salt and butter.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan works as a consultant and he is a teacher also. Juan is single. He doesn't have children but he lives with his mother and he helps her with the expenses.

Juan needs a loan to fix up a room at the place where he lives. Juan would like to be the owner of a house in the future. Right now, the place where he lives with his mother is too small.

loans.use: to fix up a room at the place where he lives.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is managing her food stall business in Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family.

Recently, she loaned an amount to buy additional stock of fishballs, kikiam and tempura for her food stall. She wants to expand her business and hopes to open another food stall in nearby schools.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fishballs, kikiam and tempura for her food stall.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Boukare

texts.fr:
Mr BOUKARE est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 18 mois. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 08 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis 17 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son village.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 01  moto pompe.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité de jardinage. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Boukare is married and the father of five children. The eldest is 18 years old and the youngest 18 months. Two of the children attend school and in total he has eight people financially dependent on him. Boukare has been a gardener for 17 years. He buys his supplies in his village market.
With the funds borrowed, he plans to buy a motorised pump. He wants to use the proceeds of the loan to grow his gardening business.
His ambition is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase a motorised pump.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 54, married in Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, she runs a store that is the primary support for her family. She never tires of tending her store.

Lourdes is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for stock of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for stock of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
José, de 43 años de edad, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, porque no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, luego se casó junto a su esposa y procreo tres hijos, tiempo más tarde su esposa con la ayuda de su mamá decide viajar a EE.UU, hoy en día tiene cuatro años de estar en ese país y sus dos hijos mayores se fueron para E.E.U.U también y se quedó solo con su hijo menor, trabaja todo los días para comprar el pan de cada día y para ayudarlo en el estudio.

José, toda su vida ha trabajado la agricultura, porque es de donde él puede generar ingresos para ir sobreviviendo día a día y para cubrir los gastos de su hijo en el estudio.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar fertilizante y comprar cuatro quintales de abono, para darle la nutrición  de su cultivo y de esa forma poder tener una buena cosecha.

José, sueña con poder ir con su hijo a conocer los E.E.U.U. Para ver su familia que ya hace cuatro años que no los vé.
texts.en: Jose is 43 years old. He has worked in agriculture his whole life, because he did not have the opportunity to attend school. Afterwards, he got married, and with his wife they had three children. Some time later, his wife - with her mother's help - decided to travel to the U.S. It has been now four years that she has been in the U.S., and their two older children went there, as well. Jose stayed only with his younger son. He works every day to support him and help him with school. He has always worked in agriculture, because this is where he can generate income to subsist every day and to cover for education expenses for his son. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and four quintals of manure in order to nurture his crops and be able to have a good harvest. Jose dreams of being able to go with his son to visit the U.S. and see his family, because it has already been four years that he has not seen them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and four quintals of manure.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia has signed up with PMPC and received the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her.

Verginia is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. She used her loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet who is 46 years old and is married. She earns a living through growing rice and cassava in her local area of Kampong Cham province. She has been involved in farming for twenty-eight years. The challenge to her farming business is that the price of her cassava is decreasing in the market while cost of business such as fuel and organic fertilizer is high.

She decided to apply for a loan from VisionFund to support her farming business by purchasing organic fertilizer to boost crop yields and purchasing pesticide to save her crop from threat of insects. She hopes to gain higher yields so as to meet her family’s needs and upgrade their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so as to meet her family’s needs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has a banana farm in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This is her primary source of income for her family.

Lydia makes it a point to have good land preparation to have the maximum yield to have a good income.

Recently, she needed an amount to pay for irrigation costs, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC.

Lydia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor on irrigation to soften tillage pans.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is getting ready for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially much needed land and seedbed preparation.

She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, so she applied a loan from the Cooperative.

Rebecca hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, harvesting and earning income as well. Loreta has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Just as she tends to her farm, Loreta has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heartier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Loreta hopes to purchase another plot of land to cultivate rice that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 65 years old, a widow and she has one adult-age child. She runs and operates a snack vending business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has been into this businss for a long time to support the needs of her daughter whomshe raised alone after her husband's death.

Recently, she took a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bags of flour, sugar, margarine, etc.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Librada is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. She used her loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Abra est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec un enfant à charge. Pour favoriser son épanouissement, Abra vend de l’huile végétal en bidons et réalises son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Abra s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bidons d’huile, Abra demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et pouvoir bien vendre puis  avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux besoins de son enfant et à son épanouissement.
texts.en:
Fifty years old, Abra is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with one dependent child. To help with raising the child, Abra sells jerrycans of vegetable oil and thus makes a profit. She buys her stock twice a month at the market.
To place an order for these cans of oil, Abra is requesting this loan to finance the purchase. She will be able to sell them at a healthy profit margin in order to meet the expenses of raising her child.

loans.use: to buy four jerrycans of oil.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business.

Veronica has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business.

Veronica wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively, with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
In the year 2008, Maximo learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Maximo feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business.

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season.

Maximo wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Afi est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires  résidant à Adidogomé. Afi achète et revend ses marchandises deux fois par mois. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches, de gombo et des sacs de piment vert en vue de bien vendre et d’avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 36 year old married woman who lives with her four dependent children. Afi is a retailer of food products who lives in Adidogomé. Afi buys and sells her goods twice a month.
Afi is requesting this loan to order baskets of fresh tomatoes and okra, and some sacks of green peppers. She plans to sell them at a profit, to help her husband to properly arrange the school education of the children, and to cover some of the family's living expenses.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of okra, three baskets of fresh tomatoes and two sacks of green peppers.

loans.name: Simba Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma who is in her early 30's is single with one kid who is still in school. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be Mwajuma's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is so happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, loan repayments and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store to meet her customer's requirement. She dreams of expanding her business.

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group "SIMBA" which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store to meet her customer's requirement

loans.name: Celestiana

texts.en: Celestiana is managing her bakery business in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has mastered the business when she and her husband were on the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept bulk orders for additional income. Recently, she loaned an amount to purchase bags of flour, sugar, milk, leavening, shortening, cheese, butter, margarine and others for her bakery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, milk, leavening, shortening, cheese, butter, margarine and others

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a hardworking mother from Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Erlinda has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Erlinda hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 36-year-old, Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She doesn’t work and her husband is the main income source in the family. He works as an employee in a bakery but he earns barely enough income. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her children school fees. She tends to provide them with a good education and ensure them with a secure future.

loans.use: to pay her children school fees

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is 47 years old, married, and lives in Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, he is given priority in financial services to alleviate his present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other training in which he actively participated. Nilo had seen the changes in his general living conditions from the moment he signed up for membership with the cooperative.

This time, he ask a loan of PHP 45,000 to purchase materials for boat making, such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia is married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the co-op. She's requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her existing business to buy different varieties of rice for retail in the local community. Virgilia hopes to continue her business and to be able to save enough money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of rice for retail in the local community.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 32 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Divina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and vitamins for her pigs.

Divina has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Musarat Bano

texts.en:
Musarat is the age of 60 and a mother of seven children living with her children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her son is a responsible to fulfil the needs of the entire family. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw 8 years ago to meet the family’s expenses.

Today Musarat’s son wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy the auto rickshaw. Therefore Musarat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan,Musarat’s son can purchase the auto rickshaw and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income.
She and her family will be thankful to the Kiva, lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 31 and the mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and has been selling fresh fruits from his shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so he can maximize sales of the fruit selling business.

Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruits to resell. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits in bulk for her husband's fruit shop. .

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is 68 years old. She is known in the Katipa, Lopez Jaena area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Deogracias

texts.en:
Deigracias has wide experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for, and harvesting, to earning income from his crops as well. Deogracias has supported his family doing this type of work.

As a farmer, Deogracias has nurtured his membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. He knows he can always turn to the Cooperative for his financial needs. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will give good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Deogracias hopes to purchase another rice field to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is a businesswoman from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Artemia is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Artemia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 27 years old. He is married and lives with his wife Melano is Batumi district. Ramaz has been working at local market for years and he is experienced in this field. He has newly opened his own market and needs some money to add products. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 600 USD. With the received credit he will fill his market with more products and will generate more profit which will be reinvested in the business. 
Ramaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of products to fill his newly opened market

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional bundle of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Nida has been in this business for 4 years. Nida earns more income from buy and sell dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of fishing nets.

loans.name: Adolphe

texts.en:
Adolphe is a first-year student at Kepler. Due to his impressive academic record and test scores, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because he wants to learn the skills necessary to have a fulfilling career.

Adolphe plans to study Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, he would like to work for an NGO, possibly in poverty alleviation—while also using his earnings to support his family and community.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Chhay Eang

texts.en:
Chhay Eang, 36, is a rice farmer in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum province. Married with a dependent son, Chhay Eang is growing rice for the main source of income. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement income, too. She has been involved in her farming business for years. Low rice is the main obstacle to rice farming business.

She decided to request a loan from VisionFund to buy 0.3 hectare area to grow rice; she hopes she can get more income to improve her living condition and send her son to school.

loans.use: to buy 0.3 hectare area of farmland to expand her farming area.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина замужем за дехканина. Ей 27 лет. Она из городка Турсунзаде. Мадина замужем и имеет детей. Она родилась и выросла в городе Турсунзаде. Мадина в городе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. У нее имеется домашнее животное. Мадина 3 года выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Ей нравится заботиться о домашних животных. Она решила увеличить поголовье скота и расширить животноводческую деятельность. Ее доходы только от животноводства. Мадина  очень нуждается на поддержку.
texts.en:
Madina is married to a farmer. She is 27 years old. She is from the small city of Tursun-zoda. Madina is married and has children. She was born and raised in Tursun-zoda. Madina is engaged in farming in the city. She has farm animals. 

Madina has been rearing livestock for three years. She likes to care for the livestock. She has decided to increase her livestock headcount and expand her cattle-rearing business. Her income is only from animal husbandry. Madina really needs your help.

loans.use: to buy cattle and expand her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 51 years old residing at Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a widow with adult-age children.

She joined PMPC on 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she took her 9th loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 to buy a variety of commodities and food products to sell to the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is an active member of Paglaum MPC and has been engaged in farming for almost 10 years. He's earning a good income that sufficiently supports the needs of his family.

Recently, he asked for a loan from the cooperative to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medicines.

Bernardo is glad that his financial needs are supported by the cooperative.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Albine

texts.en:
Albine is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Rwanda's capital Kigali with her mother and sister. Due to her strong academic record, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and she chose Kepler because it provides the technology training she needs for her career.

Albine plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to work at a hospital or health NGO that uses technology to better manage patient relationships with their doctors. To achieve this, Albine is looking to improve her professional and technology skills while at Kepler.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Anicita

texts.en:
Anicita is 63 years old and is known in Calamba, Misamis Occidental for her delicious and palatable breads. She delivers her breads to different school canteens and operates her bakery just outside her house. She has expanded and increased her production due to high orders from her local customers.

In order to meet the demand, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 30,000 to purchase ingredients for her bakery, like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and other items. Anicita believes having enough inventory of the raw materials will further her daily operations.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery, like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and other items.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and has four children. She has coco land that she cultivates and into which she integrates other commodities for more income.

Gloria plans to disperse goats on her farm. She approached Paglaum MPC to buy more goats for dispersal. She wants to take advantage of the high demand for goats for butchering.

In the future, Gloria hopes to sustain her business and would love to open an eatery.

loans.use: to buy more goats for dispersal.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Fourty-five-year old Liezel is a fish vendor from the town of Trinidad in Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband work hard together selling fresh fish in their community. Sometimes, she does it by visiting each of her neighbors' houses offering fresh fish. At some time, if there is gas, she can use the motorbike to sell her fish. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy a big foam cooler and a weighing scale. This way she can stock more fish to sell. Her income helps pay for the family's food and the school fees of her children ages 17 and 19. In the future, she hope to have a prosperous life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a foam cooler and a weighing scale

loans.name: Habibahan

texts.ru: Хабибахан, 62 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. На протяжении 25 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Хабибахан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 16 овец, 2 лошади. На участке мерою 1,10 Га она выращивает арбузы. Ежемесячный доход Хабибахан составляет 24,900 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хабибахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров и теленка. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Habibahan is 62 years old, and a mother of 4 children. Over the past 25 years, she has worked in crop cultivation and animal husbandry. Thanks to her hard work, today Habibahan has 4 cows, 16 sheep and 2 horses. She also grows watermelon on 1.10 hectares of land. Habibahan's monthly income is 24,900 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase 3 cows and calves. With income from the loan, she plans to invest in the further expansion of her herd, in order to save funds for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy three cows and calves in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Please meet Lucila from Talisay City, Cebu. She is 60 years old, single, and carries many responsibilities for her siblings, nephews and nieces. She extends financial assistance to them regularly. They are the reason for her perseverance, as she doesn’t want to work for herself alone.

She runs a “sari-sari” or variety store that sells the usual commodities like eggs, bread, repacked condiments, snack items, toiletries, and many more. She also retails rice per kilo to increase her income. Her income provides for her everyday needs and financial assistance for her relatives.

Lucila knows that the competition is stiff and profits are irregular; hence, she dreams of expanding her business. She needs to buy more sacks of rice and additional supplies for her variety store so as to meet the demand of customers who prefer a store with a wide array of merchandise. She knocks at your kind hearts for loan assistance of PHP 20,000. For sure, the profits that will be derived from her business will be shared with her relatives.

She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and additional supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Sokkorn

texts.en:
Sokkorn is 26 years old and married. She earns a living through growing rubber plants and cassava in her local area of Kampong Cham province. She has been involved in the farming business for eight years.
