The challenge to her farming business is that her cassava has grown unhealthily and the cost of inputs, such as fuel and organic fertilizer, is high.

Sokkorn uses her free time to raise piglets to earn additional income as well. She decided to apply for a loan from VisionFund to support her additional business, pig-raising, by purchasing more piglets to raise.

She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to save for future needs and to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise so as to increase her income to save for future need and to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is a first-year student at Kepler. He is from the Kamonyi district of Rwanda, and he is one of three children in his family. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Vedaste plans to major in Health Care Management and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He decided to attend Kepler because he believes the use of technology will help him pursue his goals as a community leader and manager.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a hardworking man from Trinidad, Bohol. With a family to support, he farms rice and drives a motorcycle for transport to earn an income.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to sustain his rice farm. He plans to use it to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings. Manuel plans to expand his livelihood so he can support the needs of his children, aged 5, 10 and 15.

In the future, Manuel hope that his business will be more sustainable, and he can ask his wife to come home from working abroad to be with the whole family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya owns a sari-sari (variety) store in the municipality of Bien Unido, in the province of Bohol. She is 44 years old and married with three children ages 16, 18 and 20.

Her store has been operating for six years. Her income helps her family for food and school. This also serves as a supplemental income from her husband's fishing business.

She is asking for a loan to refill her shelves. She will use it to buy canned food, seasonings, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits and noodles. In the future, she plans to expand her store and make it as a wholesaler, and she also aims to have a place where she can sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy canned food, seasonings, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits and noodles.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. He is 48 years old.

Fredrick is a very active person involved in agriculture, especially banana a plantation and poultry project. He has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to improve his agricultural production, especially bananas.

He works for 12 hours daily, and he also works with an escrow company where he earns an extra salary. He started his business in 2008.

He is a married man with four children aged, 14, 11, 6 and 3, respectively; three are school-going.

He carries out his agriculture in the rural area of Kashenyi, Kiruhura village, Bushenyi district. He began the business to earn additional income for his development.

When he gets the loan, he will use it to buy manure to increase production. His clients are all kinds of people.

Fredrick hopes to increase and boost his agricultural business and to improve on the welfare of his family.

He is faced with bad weather conditions, especially in the dry season, that reduce yields; limited capital to boost his business; and pests and diseases that destroy crops.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 56 years old. He is married to Dena, a good housewife, and they have five children. They have conquered many challenges in raising their children, and now four of them are already working.

He runs a small canteen with karaoke in Tigbauan, Iloilo. He’s lucky to have a space like this along the road because it’s accessible to customers, but he’s not the only one who has a space in that area. Several canteen operators are also present there, competing with each other. It's a problem for Romeo’s because he can only offer limited meal choices and few snack items. The reason behind this is his inadequate capital.

He’s reaching out to you for additional capital worth PhP 15,000, which he can use to buy more raw ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and frozen goods, and some trays and display materials. With this amount he can prepare more meal choices that are enticing to customers. It will surely boost his income and sustain his family’s everyday expenditures.

Romeo dreams of buying home appliances now that he is relieved of huge educational expenses for his children. He also plans to have his canteen renovated soon. He prays for good health and more quality time for his family.

He is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative where he gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients, like meat, fish, vegetables and frozen goods, and some trays and display materials.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS se llama esta grupo formado en la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes.
La señora Crisolina es la tesorera del grupo, está casada, ella  tiene un pequeña lavandería, que pudo ir creciendo mediante su esfuerzo y lucha, y sumado a las capacitaciones de la fundación, y gracias a eso hoy ya tiene dos personas a su cargo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabones, suavizantes, y otros insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo de lavandería, y también para continuar dando fuentes de trabajo.
En la foto del grupo hay 14 personas, ya que esa es la cantidad de integrantes del grupo, pero en este ciclo solo 13 de ellas piden este préstamo.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" group is from the city of San Ignacio. The members - all women - are united and supportive. They work together for the same reason. They feel the support of the women's committee programme as they increase their income and become more and more independent.

Crisolina is treasurer of this group. She is married and has a small launderette. She has been able to expand her business through her effort and hard work, and with the help of training from Fundacion Paraguaya. Thanks to this expansion, Crisolina has two employees now.

Crisolina is applying for a loan in order to buy soaps, fabric softener, and other supplies to continue with her launderette and continue providing jobs to others.

The group photo features 14 people - this is the total number of group members, but just 13 have applied for a loan in this cycle.

loans.use: to buy soaps, fabric softener, and other supplies for her launderette.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa, a 52-year-old married mother of eight children, lives in San Miguel, Bohol where her husband works as a carpenter. Andresa buys and sells fruits and vegetables in her community. She is also engaged in farming rice.

Andresa, who works hard to improve her income and sustain her family, is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI to buy more fruits like banana and to pay hired farmers for their labor.

She hopes for her business to improve and for her children, ages 8-20, to attend college and have a good life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and to pay hired farmers for their labor.

loans.name: Agatona

texts.en:
Agatona is 47 years old and from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with three children. Her husband works as a farmer, and Agatona is into operating a sari-sari store (general store) where she sell basic household needs like toiletries, seasonings and canned goods. This business started last year.

She is asking for a loan to buy items in bulk like soft drinks, rice, canned food, noodles, seasonings, toiletries, spices and fertilizer. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to make her store bigger so she can better provide for her family and support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, fertilizer, canned food, noodles, seasonings, toiletries and spices.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Yawavi est une femme mariée de 34 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Mère d’un enfant, Yawavi est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes de hautes et moyennes qualités, Yawavi demande ce prêt afin d’acquérir un grand nombre de stock et mieux vendre puis avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de soutenir sa famille dans certaines charges et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à son enfant.
texts.en:
Yawavi is a 34-year-old, married woman who lives in Adidogomé. The mother of one child, Yawavi sells "pagnes" (local dresses) that she purchases two times a month at the market and resells by walking through the nearby neighborhoods.

Yawavi is asking for this loan so that she can order high- and medium-quality pagnes. She intends to have a large stock and better sales in order to make a good profit. She wishes to support her family with some expenses and allow her child to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy four pieces of high-quality pagne dresses and five pieces of medium-quality pagne dresses.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 46-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He rears animals. His parents also reared animals, and so this is a hereditary activity. His parents taught him how to look after cattle since his childhood, and now he is teaching it to his own children.

Samuel had a herd of cattle, but the foot and mouth disease attacked them a few years ago and the numbers dwindled. He sold off most of his cows, leaving only a few.

Since he only has a few cows, Samuel has decided to increase his herd of cattle, and he wants to have a lot of cows once again that he will rear and later sell. He needs money for this, and he has applied to UGAFODE for a loan.

He is grateful in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Funny Retailers - N27Qhưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thướng is 55 years old and married. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and market need is low in this region.

She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thướng faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items to expand her business. Before borrowing from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, it was really difficult for her to cover the costs of living and save money.

In 2009, Thướng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thướng has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of "Funny retailers - N27QHưng", which consists of three members.

In the future, Thướng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more items to expand her business.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is a 58 year old married man with three grown children. He operates a tricycle (rickshaw). He earns a living for the last eight years by transporting passengers from one place to remote areas. He lives in the rural town of Dumanjug, Cebu.

Luciano is asking for a loan to buy tires, fuel and pay for maintenance. These would help boost his daily earnings and able to provide good food and better shelter to live. He could also pay his obligation and set aside some of the savings for future use.

He is looking forward to improve his livelihood by providing quality services and to invest other business ventures to become successful.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita decided to give it a try to join Paglaum MPC after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Esterlita has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Esterlita wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Ruthcell

texts.en:
Ruthcell is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Ruthcell dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira, a 28-year-old mother is in the photograph at the house that she has started to build with her husband, Prel and their two young children aged 4 and 2. The house as you can see, is not finished yet and they are worried that even if they have no money, to at least install doors and windows to one room and cover that room with roofing, otherwise their living conditions will soon be unbearable. They live in the northern Albania, where the cold has already started.

For the past five years, they have been doing agriculture/livestock to increase the income of their family. They have been planting corn and seasonal veggies in the land that their family has given them. In addition to this, they have very few chickens. roosters & ducks, one sow and six sheep.

Prel had an accident while working in Italy, thus he receives a monthly compensation of 150 euros as well.

loans.use: to make livable at least one room in the house where their young children and parents will live.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña guapa, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y unidas, que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Son 18 mujeres muy luchadoras que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
María es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la lavandería, lava ropas de los clientes que siempre le llevan muchas ropas para que ellas las pueda lavar. Ella es una persona que se sacrifica para poder dar una mejor calidad de vida no solo a ella, sino también a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabones, suavizantes, perfumes para ropas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group is called Kuña Guapa and is from the city of San Ignacio. They are very self-sacrificing and united women who want to improve their living conditions through their effort and sacrifice. They are 18 very tenacious women who want to improve their living conditions.

María is one of the members of this group. She provides laundry services. She washes clothes for her customers who always bring her a lot of clothes so that she can wash them. She is a person who is self-sacrificing in order to be able to give a better quality of life not only to herself but also to her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy soaps, softeners, and scents for clothes and others. This way she will be able to continue to give good service to her customers.

She is grateful for the opportunity they are receiving in order to be able to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy soaps, softeners, and scents for clothes and others.

loans.name: Beauties Group

texts.en:
Shirley is the featured borrower of Beauties group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partners Al Majmoua, because they have always been close friends since they met in Lebanon, after leaving their hometown to work as house keepers and improve their family's living.

Shirley is a 31-year-old single mother, who is putting so much effort to provide her only child a better living. She works as a house keeper providing cleaning services with a limited monthly salary.

Her acquired loan will be sent to her only child in her hometown in the Philippines, to support him through covering increasing living needs, and promising him a better future.
Shirley is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. Edna is the lady at the center, while Mailin is the lady at the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: to support her child back in her hometown in the Philippines, through covering increasing living needs and promising him of a better future.

loans.name: Friendly Farm - N01T2Tvậnthoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bé is 45 years old and married. Bé lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has been working in the agriculture business of raising pigs for 6 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region. The income from her business is unstable because sometimes pigs get sick and die which leaves her with nothing to sell. The main hardship that Bé faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Bé joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She hopes that this loan will help her earn more money.

She is the group leader of "Friendly farm - N01T2TVậnTHoá", which consists of four members.

In the future, Bé hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel within the country.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie used the previous loan amount of Php 10,000 for buying ingredients daily for her food business. She never thought that it’ll be very easy to apply for loan in Center for Community Transformation (CCT) as they quickly responded to her application.

Rosalie is now able to earn an approximate amount of Php 6,500 every month. Her profit form this helped her sustain their daily needs aside from the income earned by her husband. She dreams that the business will continue to operate and be progressive. She needs to buy necessities and more raw ingredients for her food business on a daily basis that is why she applied again for a new loan amounting to Php 12,000. If granted, the amount will make a vast effect on her business.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Rosalie spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of raw ingredients needed for her recipes.

loans.name: Lucill

texts.en: Lucill earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. Lucill hopes to live comfortably with her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and other supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her buy and sell fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Eva dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and other supplies

loans.name: Wilyn

texts.en:
Wilyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Wilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Wilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is the age of 27, mother of 2 children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession and he has been selling fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits. Therefore her wife, Shazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruits. Shazia thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband's shop

loans.name: Masudahan

texts.ru: Масудахан, 55 лет, в разводе, 2 детей, сын женат, живет отдельно, дочь Масудахан студентка, живет с матерью. Образование средне-специальное медицинское, на протяжении 35 лет работает медсестрой в детском саду. Ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Масудахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на ремонт и утепление дома. На запрошенные средства она приобретет котел, пластиковые трубы, батареи. Доходы Масудахан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Masudahan is 55 years old, divorced and has two children. Masudahan's son is married and lives separately; her daughter is a university student who is living with her. Masudahan has secondary specialist medical education, and she has been working as a kindergarten nurse for 35 years. Her monthly wages are 7000 som (KGS). 

Masudahan has applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to renovate and insulate her house. With the requested funds, she will purchase copper, plastic pipes, and radiators. Masudahan plans to invest the funds in the future improvement of her living conditions,

loans.use: to purchase copper, plastic pipes, radiators etc. for insulating her house.

loans.name: Aptohan

texts.ru: Аптохан, 56 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Аптохан есть 20 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 16,900 сомов(KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аптохан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. В будущем Аптохан планирует направлять доходы от кредита на развитие ее деятельности.
texts.en:
Aptohan is 56 years old and married. She has secondary education, is retired, and is engaged in farming for her family's income. Currently Aptohan's farm has 20 sheep. Her monthly income is about 16,900 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her farm, Aptohan has applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) in order to buy livestock. In the future, Aptohan plans to direct her funds from the loan into developing her business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baby cows.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Sherly dreams that one day She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like milk, soap, noodles, chips, etc for her general store business.

Babylyn has been in this business for 1 year. Babylyn earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like milk, soap, noodles, chips, etc

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food .

Consolacion dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 28 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Geraldine has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell dry goods.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en: Zaid is a new borrower. He is currently working for a public organization and he is in the process of enrolling in a ‎university for another semester of his degree in accounting. He is requesting the loan in order to pay for his ‎university enrollment and course fees. He is two years away from finishing his degree. He is very grateful to the ‎people on Kiva for helping him to achieve his goals.‎

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Demir

texts.en:
Demir is 46 and a married father of three, 16, 18 and 23. He is in the photograph with his wife, Beglije. Demir has worked seasonally in Greece, for some years until three years ago when he returned for good to his village. Since then he rented from others some agricultural land where he's been planting and selling in large quantities, mainly corn and beans and has grapevines. In addition to these fresh products, he sells bales of straw that is used as feed for the animals in other villagers.

Demir's and Beglije's 23-year-old daughter is getting married soon and they need some money for the traditional event and other expenses such as marriage license etc. This is why they are requesting this loan. " It is in our tradition to organize a little get-together when children get married. However, nowadays, these kind of events cost lots of money and a minority of rural families follow this ritual. Despite all, we wanted to have a little event for our oldest child. It would be meaningful to her and us as well," said Beglije during the interview.

loans.use: to pay for the marriage expenses of his oldest daughter.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
RAZIA is a 34-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop in a good manner.

His children are growing and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fee, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, RAZIA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy healthy and seasonal vegetables for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 56-year-old married father of two children, who has been working as a lab technician for twenty years. He is his family's sole earner, thus his limited salary income needs an external financial support to cover the increasing living needs, especially his children's education.

Jamal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

He hopes to stay in good health to make sure he can provide his children necessary standards of living and best university education.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Raising Hope - N20Ásơnđhải Group

texts.en: Minh is 37 years old and is married. She has been a carpenter for eight years. Minh lives in Thanh Hoa City, Vietnam, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Her work is really hard but the income is not high. The main hardship that Minh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to expand her business. In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of "Raising Hope - N20ÁSơnĐHải", which consists of seven members. In the future, Minh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to expand her carpentry business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a resident in the town of Aloguinsan, Cebu. She is 50-year old married woman with six children. Three of her children are still attending school. She engages in vegetable gardening and grows mung bean and eggplants.

She would like to improve the yield of her farm. She needs capital to sustain the farm maintenance needed to have bountiful harvest.

Rosita has joined CEVI, a field partner of Kiva to avail a loan to purchased farm supplies like fertilizers and basic need like food. With these she could maximize the resources and will slowly improve her income.


She is very grateful for your support and looking forward to have a better living condition in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchased farm supplies like fertilizers and basic needs like food.

loans.name: Asylbubu

texts.ru: Асылбубу, 53 года, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Образование среднее, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2014 году. Благодаря упорному труду Асылбубу, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 15 овец, 3 лошади. Также выращивает картофель и фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асылбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для полеводства и скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Асылбубу планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Asylbubu is 53 years old, married, and her children are independent adults. She has secondary education, and she farms livestock for the family's income, having started in 2014. Thanks to Asylbubu's persistent hard work, currently on her farm there are four cows, fifteen sheep, and three horses. She also cultivates potatoes and beans for sale. 

With the aim of further developing her business, Asylbubu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilisers for growing crops, and livestock for increasing her herd. Asylbubu plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and additional livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is a 39-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. Aside from farming rice, she tried to maximize her time by also running a Sari-sari store business and hog raising business. This is on-going for a year now. She needs an additional capital to buy fertilizer, seasoning, toiletries, noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, chips, candies, detergent and cement to repair her barn. Concepcion will save for the school fees of her four children ages 11-20.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seasoning, toiletries, noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, chips, candies, detergent and cement to repair her barn

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is 49 years old. He lives with his pensioner mother in the Martvili district. Zeinab is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a cow and a plot of agricultural land, where he grows different kinds of vegetables for family use. Zeinab decided to start an additional activity and requested a loan for a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 800 GEL.

With the received credit he will purchase a stock of grapes and will start trading business in Martvili. Zeinab hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade in grapes.

loans.name: ِِaya

texts.en: Aya is a student in her third year of business administration. She is currently working as a sales representative ‎earning an income that helps her to pay for her studies and bring a little bit of money home to help her parents. ‎She is a person who sacrifices for her goals and dreams to be able to be a good professional. She is asking for a ‎loan to pay her tuition for this year and the fees that she owes. This way she can keep studying.‎

loans.use: to pay for her next semester in university.

loans.name: Gloria Elsy

texts.es:
Gloria, de 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, porque su esposo emigro a los E.E.U.U hace siete años y con el paso del tiempo dejo de ayudarle y ella con sacrificio lavando y planchando ropa ajena,  ajustaba para que la comida no les faltara a sus hijos, porque ella no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela; hoy en día su ex esposo le ayuda con la alimentación de sus hijos y ella con los pocos ingresos que obtiene cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, para su alimentación y la de sus hijos.

Gloria, tiene tres años que se dedica a la agricultura y con sacrificios ha logrado cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y de esa manera al sacar su cosecha ella pude comprar lo que le hace falta en su hogar y también para la alimentación de cada día.    

El crédito lo necesita para pagar el alquiler de la tierra que va a cultivar y también para comprar una novilla que le vende su suegro. 

Gloria, sueña con cultivar 25 tareas de maíz para obtener mejores ingresos, para ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 32, lives with her four children. Her husband emigrated to the United States seven years ago. With the passage of time, he stopped helping her. With sacrifice, by washing and ironing others' clothes, she adjusted so that her children would not lack food because she did not have the opportunity to attend school.

Nowadays her ex-husband helps her feed her and her children with the little income that he gets. She cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn to feed herself and her children. Gloris has been working in agriculture for three years. With sacrifices she has managed to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn. This way, when she gets the harvest, she is able to buy what is needed for her household and for daily food.

She needs the loan to pay the rent for the land she will cultivate. She will also buy a heifer that her father-in-law will sell her.

Gloria dreams of cultivating 25 'tareas' [a tarea is 628.86 square meters] of corn in order to get better income to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to pay the rent for land that she will cultivate and to also buy a heifer.

loans.name: Bukomero School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is David. He is the Head teacher of Bukomero School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kiboga district with 500 students. Bukomero School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bukomero School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. David ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 34, is running a food stall in her street with the support of her husband. She makes delicious ‘Dahi Bhallay’, which is a dish consisting of balls made from ground lentils, deep fried and served in a yogurt sauce. She has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within her town. With the increase in the price of vegetables and lentils, she was barely able to produce enough to make a good sale.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation and today, she has been successful in consistently making sales and earning healthy revenue from the business. In order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem, aged 37, is a married woman with six kids. The man shown in the photo is her husband. He deals in making different articles from iron. Though his work he is trying to provide his family with the basic necessities of life.  Now for purchasing more tools and equipment along with good quality iron, Naseem has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. It would allow him to increase his sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and equipment for her blacksmith husband, along with good quality iron.

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN NICOLAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora  Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de zapatos, venta de celulares, venta de mantas, venta de huevos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una prima que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución y le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
C.F. COLLPANI
texts.en:
The San Nicolas communal bank will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II regional center. It is comprised of nine members and led by a board of directors. Justina is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them are selling vegetables, selling shoes, selling cell phones, selling blankets, selling eggs, neighborhood store, and selling food.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Justina is a member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years. She joined by invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling vegetables. She says that she learned this business on her own initiative several years ago.

The loan she will now take out will be to buy vegetables that she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. After that she will sell them at her sales space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the health services that the institution offers, and she likes to share with her colleagues.

C.F. COLLPANI

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Shining Smiles - N10T2Qgiao Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hưng is 44 years old and she is married. Hưng lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of "Shining smiles - N10T2Qgiao Group", which consists of three members.

Hưng has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than ten years. Her family is a low-income household in the village. The market need is low in this region and the income from this business is unstable because when some poultry diseases happen, they could die, which leaves her nothing to sell. So she would be in financial trouble. The main hardship that Hưng faces is lack of capital.

Hưng is requesting a loan to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Hưng joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hưng has successfully repaid a previous loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

In the future, Hưng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is operating a pottery making business in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. This business enables her to provides the needs of her family knowingly she reared her family alone upon the death of her husband long time ago. She nurtures her membership with Paglaum MPC and has enjoyed the perks of membership. Recently that she needs additional capital to respond to bulk orders that she asks for a loan to buy soil for pottery making.

loans.use: to buy soil for pottery making

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 51 years old residing at Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed with adult age children. She joined PMPC on 2013 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessing her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy dried fish and "longganisa" for resale in the local community.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and "longganisa" for resale.

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Marygen

texts.en: Marygen is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Erlinda is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom is a 38-year-old married woman who resides in Kampong Cham province. She has six children, who are all still in school. Sarom and her husband are growing cassava and rice to make income to support the family’s living. They have been involved in these businesses for 20 years. Earning around USD12 per day, Sarom manage to save around USD7 each day for future needs. The depreciated of cassava’s price in market is the main challenge to Sarom’s farming business.

She decided to form a group of three members to apply for a loan from VisionFund to save her business. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields; for some loan portion left will be used to buy organic pesticide. She hopes to get more returns and earn more income in order to improve the living condition.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields to get more returns so to improve her family's living condition.

loans.name: Awine

texts.en:
Awine is 58 years, married with five children between the ages of 8 and 20 year old. They all are in school. He sells goat, sheep, and cow with fowls on the side.
He has been in his business for the past 20years. It is located in the business district and his primary customers are both restaurants and household consumption.

Awine would need a loan from Kingsbridge to purchase more livestock for the upcoming Moslem festival to earn more money to cater for the family needs and the people he works with.
His future plans are to expand to a point where he can be financially independent. His problem is basically having more funds to inject into the business to earn more profit.

"Supporting small scale businesses in the world is an admirable project", he says, "keep it up and he wishes you God’s blessings".

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to resell.

loans.name: Samarakan

texts.ru: Самаракан, 53 года, замужем, мать 8 детей. На сегодняшний день Самаракан, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1983 году с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Самаракан и помощи ее большой и дружной семьи, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Самаракан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Самаракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Samarakan is 53 years old, married, and has eight children. Currently, Samarakan's main source of income for her family is breeding livestock, having begun in 1983 from purchasing livestock with 20,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Samarakan's persistent hard work, and help from her large and harmonious family, today the farm has five cows and ten sheep. Her monthly income is about 35,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her business, Samarakan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows for increasing her herd. Samarakan plans to invest the funds from the loan in further increasing her herd.

loans.use: to purchase two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Albuera, Leyte. She is engaged in a direct-selling business. She sells products from Avon (a company that sells beauty products, cosmetics, shirts, underwear and accessories). To enhance her family's livelihood, she is also engaged in a raising pigs business while her husband is doing a farming business. They raised their two children through these businesses with the help of the loans that they have. As of now, Anecita is asking for another loan to continue running their businesses. From this loan, she will purchase Avon products to sell. She will also buy feed for their pigs. Anecita dreams of being successful in her chosen field of business.

loans.use: to buy Avon products (such as beauty products, cosmetics, shirts, underwear and accessories) and pig feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Twenty-nine-year-old Elizabeth married at a young age. She now has two children, who are eight and five years old. Together with her husband, who is a mechanic, they raised their children well. They provide them with their needed necessities. They work hard together so that in the future they can give them a good education. While Elizabeth’s husband is working as a mechanic, she successfully opened her own business. She owns a sari-sari store (general store) built within their house. But the problem is, she needs additional capital to buy more commodities such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, salt, flour and soft drinks. She will also buy chicken for laying eggs. She is also running other businesses to enhance their livelihood and wants, in the future, to expand her business for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, salt, flour, soft drinks, and chicken for laying eggs.

loans.name: Try To Gain - N02T06Qlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung is 54 years old and she is married. Nhung lives in Quang Xuong District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of "Try to gain - N02T06Qlộc Group", which consists of three members.

Nhung has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than ten years. The income from this business is unstable because when some poultry diseases happen, they could die leaving her nothing to sell. So, she will be in financial trouble.

Nhung's family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Nhung faces is lack of capital.

Nhung is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. In 2013, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

In the future, Nhung hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria is a woman with determination. For more than 20 years she has been engaged in basket making to help her husband to improve their financial stability. Aswell as this, her husband works hard as a laborer, and with great effort they have raised their big family. They have 10 children - 7 adults and 3 school-aged children.

Now Valeria is thinking of other business opportunities to enhance their livelihood so she is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. She wants to raise pigs to improve their earnings and to be able perhaps to send her school-aged children to college in order to have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a 40-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Catigbian in Bohol, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter while Angelita is engaged in various businesses. She sells Personal Collection products. (PC is a company that sells beauty products, home care products and personal care products.) Aside from this, she is also running a sari-sari store business. Angelita and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their three teenage children. They want them to finish their studies to have better lives in the future. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy PC merchandise and commodities such as spices, cooking oil, eggs, toiletries, salt, sugar, candies, chips, biscuits, noodles and canned goods for her sari-sari store. Her greatest dream is to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, home care products, personal care products, spices, cooking oil, eggs, toiletries, salt, sugar, candies, chips, biscuits, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a resident of Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has a 22-year-old son. Her husband works hard as farmer while Imelda is engaged in a direct selling business where she sells beauty products, personal care products, shoes, sandals, shirts, underwear and accessories from GTY, MSE and Natasha (companies that sell the goods mentioned earlier). She has been doing this for four years. Imelda is a 58-years-old woman who dreams of business improvement in order to have a better means of living in the future. That is the reason why she is asking for a loan to help her enhance her livelihood. She will buy the products mentioned earlier with the money she is requesting. She will also buy dried fish to sell. She is also thinking of other business opportunities that will help her increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, personal care products, shoes, sandals, shirts, underwear and accessories, and dried fish.

loans.name: Diadiza

texts.en:
Diadiza is 61 years old and widowed with seven children, two children are still in school, Diadiza works very hard to provide for them.

Diadiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like drinks, bottled water, bread, snack foods etc.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Diadiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like drinks, bottled water, bread, snack foods etc.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat is a student in her third year of Business Administration. She is currently working as a sales representative, ‎earning an income that helps her to pay for her studies and bring a little bit of money home to help her parents. ‎She is a person who sacrifices for her goals and dreams to be able to be a good professional. She is asking for a ‎loan to pay her tuition for this year and the fees that she owes. This way she can keep studying.‎

loans.use: To cover her university fees and achieve her dreams

loans.name: Esmena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Esmena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Esmena is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Esmena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Clydie

texts.en:
Clydie is 52 years old and married with one child. Clydie works very hard to provide for them.

Clydie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Clydie has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Clydie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products

loans.name: Josias Ezequiel

texts.es:
Josias, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive solo con sus padres.

Josias, se dedica al comercio de ganado, tiene aproximadamente 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio, pero también trabaja como jornalero, él comercializa el ganado en la zona donde vive y va al tiangue, en el negocio solo le ayuda el papá.

Josias, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado, porque está barato y es muy buena oportunidad.

Josias, sueña con comprar un camión para poder transportar ganado y hacer viajes para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Josias, twenty-two years old, studied until the ninth grade. He is single, has no children, and lives with his parents.

Josias works in the livestock trade and has approximately seven years of experience in this business. But he also works as a day laborer. He sells livestock in the area he lives in and goes to the market; he only gets help from his dad in this business.

Josias needs the loan to buy livestock since it’s cheap, and it’s a very good opportunity. Josias dreams of buying a truck to transport his livestock and to make many trips in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy livestock because it's cheap, and it's a very good opportunity.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine thus increasing production and improving his livelihood.

loans.name: Dagan

texts.fr: Dagan est une femme mariée âgée de 23 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère de deux enfants, Dagan est une marchande des chaussures et des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend au bord de la route à côté d’un établissement scolaire. Dagan s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de chaussures et des sachets bonbon.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Dagan compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Dagan is a married woman, 23 years old, residing in Adidogomé. The mother of two, she is a merchant of shoes and grocery items, which she sells along the roadside next to an educational facility. She gets her supplies at the market twice a month. Dagan is requesting this loan to order dozens of shoes and packets of candies. With the resulting profits, she is planning to improve her sales offerings and to help her family to thrive and to have a good education for the children.

loans.use: to purchase 15 dozen shoes and 20 packets of candies

loans.name: Glyceria

texts.en:
Glyceria is 21 years old. She is married and has a one-year-old son. She lives in Lilongwe, Malawi. Glyceria is excited to be connected to Kiva lenders so that she can raise the starting capital that she needs to start running her own business as a Zoona Mobile money transfer agent.

Glyceria has successfully completed her training with Zoona so that she can start running her own business in Lilongwe, Malawi. This mean, Glyceria will be providing financial services to people in her community and earning a profit. She is very happy with the prospect of running her own business as it will empower her to have an income. Glyceria explains that the biggest challenge she currently faces is that her husband does not have a good job and because she is not working, they struggle to have the day to day needs.

With this loan, Glyceria will be able to purchase a small trolley where she will conduct her small business, she will also purchase a web-enabled phone which is necessary for her to make her transactions. This loan will also provide Glyceria with the funds needed to service her customers so that she can start to run her business. Glyceria will use the earnings from her business to provide for her family. She is hopeful that the business will grow so that she and her husband can start operating together as he currently does not earn much from his job.

Glyceria thanks the Kiva lenders for helping her start her own business.

loans.use: to serve as the starting capital that she needs to start running her own business as a Zoona Mobile money transfer agent.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Mariée, Adzo est femme de 58 ans qui vit avec ses six enfants à charge à Adidogomè. Pour mieux vivre et venir en aide aux besoins des enfants, Adzo prépare de la boisson locale alcoolisée appelée « Tchoukoudou» et le revend  à son domicile. Adzo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Adzo désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de mil en vue de bien vendre puis de maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: A married woman, Adzo is 58 years old and lives in Adidogomè with her six children she supports. To have a better life and help out her children, she products a local alcohol called “Tchoukoudou” and resells it out of her home. She gets her supplies once a month at the market and makes a good profit margin through this business. Adzo would like this loan to order sacks of millet with the aim of doing well in her sales, then maximizing the profit for helping her husband take care of their children, thus favoring their education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of millet.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a 22-year-old single lady who started five years ago tutoring from her house to cover her needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady. Despite her limited income, she is fighting to live in descent conditions.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary furniture for her house to make it a good and comfortable living place. She hopes to develop her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary furniture for her house

loans.name: Ratatouille - N05P5Qthắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoa is 45 years old and she is married. Thoa lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of "Ratatouille - N05P5Qthắng Group", which consists of four members.

Thoa has been operating a food stall selling food for five years. Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Thoa faces is lack of capital.

Before borrowing from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, it was really difficult for Thoa to cover her living costs. Because the health of her husband was not good, she had to take care of the whole family by herself. In 2014, Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business.

Thoa is requesting a loan to purchase chickens, ducks and ingredients for cooking food to sell. Thoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

In the future, Thoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, ducks and ingredients for cooking food to sell.

loans.name: Semeon

texts.en:
Semeon learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Semeon tried his luck on doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owe his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital.

Semeon loaned another amount to pay for rice seedlings and compost. This will help his farming income a big boost. Semeon looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for rice seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his rice production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Nicolas feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used to his business.

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next season. Nicolas wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Donah

texts.en:
Donah is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Donah is 43 years old and has two children are presently in school.

Donah has a buy and sell animal feeds business in the Philippines. Donah requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of animal feeds to sell to her stall.

Donah has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of animal feeds to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman, 61 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a buy and sell used blanket business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more used blanket to sell to her stall.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used blankets to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a married woman, 61 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elsie has a buy and sell bamboo business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for 26 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi est un homme marié qui vit à Adidogomé. Agée de 31 ans, Kossi est un maître soudeur ayant quatre personnes à charge. Kossi fabrique des portails en tôles et autres en fer puis s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché du nécessaire. Kossi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de tôles en vue de bien satisfaire ses clients puis gagner un bénéfice afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins et charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a married man who lives in Adidogomé. He is 31 years old, a master welder, and supporting four persons. He produces sheet metal doors and gates and other products made of iron. He gets the necessary supplies three times a month at the market. Kossi is requesting this loan to order sheet metal with the aim of satisfying his customers and then earning a profit for meeting the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase 18 units of sheet metal

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a seamstress who has known from a young age that sewing was her talent. She ‎could not complete her education because of the financial difficulties that her family had ‎faced. She is a mother of seven children, she has been able to provide for her family's ‎well being, and she is now very well known for her work in her neighborhood.‎

She has 8 years of experience and she upholsters sofas and other furniture by herself. She is ‎seeking a loan to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons and other supplies in bulk. Her goals are ‎to strengthen her business and continue providing for her family.‎

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Ma. Nila

texts.en: Ma. Nila is a woman who is engaged in selling food to earn a living. She is 33 years old and married. She has two children who are five and three years old. Her husband works hard as vehicle welder to raise their family. Aside from this, Ma. Nila and her husband own a farm that also gives them an income. They are also engaged in a hog raising business. Ma. Nila is in need of a bigger amount to help them in running their businesses. She will buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, and cooking oil to continue selling food. She will also buy fertilizer for their farm to enhance the growth of their plants. Aside from that, she will buy piglets and feed as well. In the future, Ma. Nila is aiming for business improvement to uplift their livelihood and to be able to give a good education to their children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, fertilizer, piglets and feed.

loans.name: True Colors - 11-02-06Hthanh1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan is 60 years old and she is married. Lan lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of "True colors - 11-02-06Hthanh1 Group", which consists of six members.

Lan has been operating a food stall, selling breakfast for more than ten years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the income from this business is not high enough to cover their living costs and save money. The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital.

Lan is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for cooking more food to sell. Lan loves borrowing from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution because it helps her improve her living standards.

In the future, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking more food to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has started her small time business and became a boss with her snack vending business. She has manage to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only snack making entrepreneur in their barangay.

Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending business

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie lives a simple life with her family in the town of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Her oldest child is 16 years old while her youngest child is two years old. Her husband is a carpenter. Margie is engaged in making barbecue stick to help her husband financially. With her determination to help her husband, she is planning to raise pigs. And that is the reason why she is asking for a loan. She is planning to buy piglets and feed to enhance their earnings. She wants to improve their livelihood in the future so they can have enough money to provide for the needs of their children, especially in giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a 54-year-old woman and a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with three adult children. Her husband raised their family through farming as their main source of income. Martina helps her husband in raising their children through weaving. She weaved “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) fiber. This “buri” fiber is used in various products, such as mats, baskets, bags, coin purses and hats. Martina has been doing this business for almost 21 years. She is asking for a loan to buy “buri” fiber and dye (to add color to the fiber). In the future, Martina wishes to enhance their livelihood to make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy buri fiber and dye

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a 46-year-old man from Catigbian, Bohol. He is married and has three children ages 22, 18 and 16 years old. He earns a living through “tuba” (means coconut wine) gatherer. Aside from this, he also owns a farm that is their main source of income. He also raised chickens to sell and some lay eggs.

Thus, Virgilio is asking a loan to buy “tungog” (a tannin powder used to give color to the coconut wine). He will also buy fertilizer for her farm to enhance the growth of their plants and to buy more chickens. In the future, Virgilio dreams for business improvement, he wants to increase their increase earnings to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy "tungog" ; fertilizer and chickens

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
A Kiva loan will enable Lola to get an education that will open many doors for her and will allow her to find a respectable job so she can support herself and help her family. Once she reaches that level, she intends to regularly donate money to AUCA to support future generations of highly-motivated students who come from financially struggling families.

Lola is looking for the opportunity to grow as an individual and hopes to realize it at AUCA. She feels that her years at AUCA will be the best years of her life, and will also prepare her very well for life after AUCA in becoming useful to society. AUCA is one of the most well-equipped universities in Central Asia. It is supplied with the necessary high technological equipment which allows students to find information quickly and provides vital tools for learning.

There are four in her family -- her lovely parents, herself and her school-boy brother. Unfortunately, her father is currently unemployed. Her mother’s occupation is a family doctor and she is the sole source of support for the family. A doctor’s salary in Kyrgyzstan hardly allows them to make ends meet. Her brother has problems with his head and Lola has problems with her eyes. Both of them need to buy different medicines monthly and she had to change her eye-glasses in the past two years. A huge part of their family’s income is spent for their hospital visits, which have been lasting for many years. Lola believes that they will get through these hardships, and one day after having high education and a well-paid job, she will tell her children the history of her achievements.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee in the SFW Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Kafaa

texts.en:
Kafaa is a 43 year old, married woman. She has five children. She lives in a village in Dairalla. Her ‎husband is working, but has a low income. She wants to help him to provide a good ‎life for her children as she is a hardworking woman with hopes of getting ahead.

Kefaa is very thankful to Kiva for the support. In this instance, she is asking for a loan in ‎order to stock her business with products. She is a client with various loan cycles and hopes ‎that this investment will allow her to carry her family forward and be able to cover her ‎household expenses.‎

loans.use: to buy more products such as juice, fruits, soft drinks and food supplies.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, de 36 años de edad, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya que fue el oficio que aprendió de sus padres, está casado y junto a su esposa han procreado dos hijos, los cuales están estudiando.

José, para generar más ingresos para el hogar, ha colocado una venta de minutas, él sale a vender las minutas desde hace tres años, pero no deja de cultivar la tierra.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizante, para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha.

José,  sueña con ver a sus hijos crecidos y preparados académicamente y poder tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
José, age 36, has worked in agriculture all his life.  It was the line of work that he learned from his parents.  He is married, and together with his wife he has two children, both of whom are in school.
 
In order to earn more income for his household, José has set up a shaved ice stand.  He has been going out to sell shaved ice for three years, but he hasn’t stopped farming the land.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizer to take care of his crop and to be able to have a good harvest.

José dreams of seeing his children grown and academically prepared.  He also dreams of being able to have a store in his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to take care of his crop and have a good harvest.

loans.name: Aichurock

texts.ru: Айчурок, 29 лет, замужем, 2 сыновей ходят в детский сад. У нее высшее педагогическое образование, на протяжении 9 лет работает в Университете статистиком-аналитиком планово-экономического отдела. Ежемесячная заработная плата - 17,000 сом (KGS). Айчурок обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку обоев, краски, линолеума и прочего для ремонта квартиры. Свои доходы она планирует вложить в дальнейшее улучшение условий жизни семьи.
texts.en:
Aichurock is 29 years old, married, and has two sons who go to kindergarden. She has higher education in pedagogics, and for 9 years she has been working as a statistician-analyst in the university planning and economics department. Her monthly wages are 17,000 som (KGS). 

Aichurock has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy wallpaper, paints, linoleum, and other materials for repairing her apartment. She plans to invest the funds in the further improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wallpaper, paints, linoleum and other materials for repairing her apartment.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
18-year-old Natasha describes herself as courageous, hardworking and naturally intelligent. She is one of five siblings. Her courage and determination were evident when she traveled for 10 hours in a public mini-bus from her hometown of Blantyre to Mzuzu to submit her application to become a Zoona agent.

Natasha is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. This means that Natasha will be providing a service that allows people in her community to access financial services. She will earn a commission for every transaction that she makes.

Natasha is determined to make her business a success. She explains that once she starts earning a reasonable profit, she would like to go to school and attain a post-secondary education. She currently has no sponsorship and is hopeful that running her own business will make her financially independent

When Natasha gets this loan, she will be able to pay for her set-up costs such as buying a trading trolley from which to operate her business, an internet-enabled phone, and other equipment that she needs in order to serve her customers. The loan will also be used as float: float is money that Natasha will use to serve customers who come to her shop to send and receive money. Natasha will set up her business in Mzimba, where she will be relocating.

Natasha sends a big thank you to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent, providing financial services to people so that communities can thrive.

loans.name: Thokozani

texts.en:
Thokozani is a mother to two sons, ages 12 and 14. She is married and has been running her own small business since 2013. This is her first Kiva loan.

Thokozani is looking to diversify her business and increase her revenue by adding mobile money transfers to her line of business. Her hope and dream is to increase her income by engaging in the mobile money transfers business.

Thokozani is very excited by the prospect of starting her own Zoona business and growing it so that she can continue to support her family and help her husband pay to pay for her children’s school fees.

Thokozani is requesting a loan in order to procure a branded trolley and an internet enabled phone. She will also use the money to serve her customers who need to access financial services.

Thokozani thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to procure a branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 23 years old. She lives in Blantyre, Malawi with her parents and two younger siblings. Blantyre is the second largest city in Malawi and is known for being the commercial and industrial center of the country.

Gladys would like to start running her own business providing financial services to people in her hometown of Blantyre. She completed high school and attended a technical college for a year. She then started attending classes at a local youth center to learn how to use a computer. Gladys faced challenges in finding employment. She then decided to start her own business so that she can provide for her basic needs and help create employment for other people.

Gladys has requested a Kiva loan to start her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Her business will allow people in her community to send and receive money. With this loan, she will be able to purchase a Zoona branded trolley and a mobile phone. The loan will also ensure that she has the money needed to serve her customers. Gladys would like to take this opportunity to thank Kiva for helping make her dream come true.

loans.use: to start her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent so she can provide financial services to people in her community.
